story:
Send Gabriel to the 2nd WTF World Cadet Championship in Muju, Korea.

My name is Gabriel Nethersole. I have been practising Taekwondo since I was 4 years-old. Through my sports-study program, I train 16 hours a week, while maintaining an academic average of over 75%.

Last year at the age of 12, I received my Black Belt and on June 27th of this year I became the new 2015 Canadian Taekwondo Champion in my category (cadet, 53-57 kg).

Because of this, I have been invited to represent Canada at the 2nd WTF World Cadet Championship in Muju, Korea in August 2015. As you may know, Korea is the birthplace of Taekwondo, so this represents the opportunity of a lifetime to represent my country over there!

The cost for my trip is $5000.00 and I need your support to achieve my dream! Please help in whatever way you can!

Thank you.

_____________________________________________________________________________

Envoyer Gabriel au 2ème Championnat du monde cadet WTF à Muju, en Corée.

Mon nom est Gabriel Nethersole. Je pratique le Taekwondo depuis que j’ai 4 ans. Grâce à mon programme en sport-études, je m’entraîne 16 heures par semaine tout en conservant une moyenne académique de plus de 75%.

L'année dernière, à l'âge de 12 ans, je recevais ma ceinture noire et le 27 juin de cette année, je suis devenu le nouveau champion canadien de Taekwondo dans ma catégorie (cadet, 53-57 kg).

Pour cette raison, je suis invité à représenter le Canada au 2ème Championnat du monde cadet WTF en août 2015 à Muju, en Corée. Comme vous le savez, la Corée est le berceau du taekwondo, c’est donc l’opportunité de ma vie de représenter mon pays là-bas.

Le coût pour mon voyage est de $ 5000,00 et j’ai besoin de votre soutien pour réaliser mon rêve! Aider moi, s’il vous plait, selon vos possibilités.

Merci.

story:
Short Summary

In Reflections of the Legend, a four book series, Genny and Lance's whirlwind romance sends the young lovers on an unimaginable, remarkable and sometimes heartbreaking journey to the sixth century, and back again. Genny’s present and the past collide in the adventure of her lifetime and create a legendary love story that is rivaled by no other in history.

Who Am I?

That used to be a hard question, but now I can enthusiastically say I’m a published author. I still get butterflies in my stomach when I say that. After my last Indiegogo, I was finally able to have Book 1, Passion of a New Day professionally edited and my first book was released on September 4, 2014. It was one of the most satisfying and terrifying things I have ever done. I have heard nothing but wonderful responses and each person I’ve spoken too can’t wait for the next installment. That leads me here again, to raise funds to have Book 2, Embracing Destiny, professionally edited and published with Trafford Publishing.
I had written little bits and pieces of Reflections of the Legend over the last 10 years, but they were just short stories and thoughts. It was almost three years ago, that I began writing Reflections Of The Legend as a book. I began to write as an escape from what was happening in my life. My mother had been diagnosed with stage 4 colon cancer. The emotions that take hold of someone facing that news are hard to deal with. I channeled my raw emotions into writing. Eventually my escape became conversation starters and I began to share my story with others. I decided to post each chapter to my blogger page as I wrote. After many months of writing, over 900 pages and 3800 people viewing my story online, a friend talked me into publishing my story in 3 different manuscripts. It was a terrifying notion, putting my work out there, in book form, for others to judge. Even after publishing Book 1, Passion of a New Day, I still get nervous with each new sale, hoping that they love the story and characters as much as I do. I took my friends advice but as the story was written, it hadn’t ended. There were still too many questions unanswered. So a 4th installment was call for, Beyond the Legend, which is about 90% complete at this point. I can actually say I am proud of myself for following through with the first book. I was able to release it only weeks before my mother passed and I know she is cheering me on to continue with my dreams.

What We Need & What You Get

I hope to raise $5000 in this campaign. Any and all money received from generous donations (even if I don’t reach my goal) will go to the cost of editing and publishing costs, as well as perk fulfillments.

Sneak Peek of Embracing Destiny

Lance turned and strode out the door. Genny watched him walk down the sidewalk to the sedan that was waiting for him. He climbed into the back seat and lowered his head, sobbing into his hands. His sorrow turned to anger, which he let out on the headrest of the seat in front of him. He punched it repeatedly until it flew off the seat and hit the front window. He collapsed back into the seat and covered his face with his hands. His driver started the car and drove away. A slight tinge of regret tried to seep into her thoughts, but it was quickly out-weighed by the feeling of betrayal.

Genny stood in the doorway watching the car disappear then looked at the world around her. Everything had changed for her, but the entire world was the same. The sun was still shinning, the birds were chirping. How dare it be that way? she thought to herself. A darkness was growing deep within her and she was filled with a bitter sadness that chilled her soul. There had been so much to look forward to and now there was nothing. A gaping black-hole of emptiness and sorrow collapsed around her. She fell to her knees as if all the bones in her legs and arms were gone. Genny slowly shook her head back and forth in disbelief, in a dizzying whirlwind of suffering, not knowing what was real or imagined, what was up or down. The world was spinning at light speed around her. She sat, starring out the door, catatonic with grief.

(Copyright © 2012 Elisabeth A. Schneider)

The Impact

I love books. They are a treasure worth more than any monetary value. Stories, poems, music, even movies, they all help us through our day and make life worth the effort. Who hasn’t curled up on a rainy day with a good book and felt the highs and lows of their beloved characters. I want to give that to the world, but I need your help.
Those that have purchased Book 1, Passion of a New Day are eager for this next installment of Reflections Of The Legend. You can check out the reviews on Amazon and make a purchase at:

http://www.amazon.com/Reflections-Of-The-Legend-Passion/dp/149044582X/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1411296878&sr=8-1&keywords=reflections+of+the+legend

Risks & Challenges

Just as I did with Book 1, I will perceiver and push through any and all challenges I may face in publishing Embracing Destiny. I wasn't able to reach my goal in my last campaign, but I saved, borrowed and bartered until I was able to fulfill my goal of publishing. I will be just as diligent this time and in the future.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can’t contribute and that is TOTALLY okay and understandable, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help.

    PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE, help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. Indiegogo has wonderful share tools! Please Tweet, Facebook, E-mail or just tell people about this.

    For any and all information and updates please visit the Facebook page at: https://www.facebook.com/ReflectionsOfTheLegend?ref=hl or on Twitter at: @EA_Schneider

    One last thing… THANK YOU for taking the time to review my campaign. It means the world to me.

story:
We are All the Art, the Visual Art Quarterly of St. Louis. Our mission is to bring art to the people and people to the art by providing a free, printed publication throughout the greater St. Louis area. We are dedicated to all, beholden to none. 

Entrepreneurial endeavors in the arts keep St. Louis living and breathing, however artists and their supporters often receive little recognition. Yet, the arts thrive here.

This publication is a celebration of our city and its artistic accomplishments. It is a record of the innovative exhibitions and art events that invigorate our communities and the artists that report on the condition of our region.

Our intention is to draw in all neighborhoods and populations by sharing the work and vision of a diversity of artists to enforce these key ideas:

Art is important

Art battles apathy and indifference

Art is for you

What We Need

  • In order to produce and distribute our limited edition first run THIS SPRING, we need your help!
  • We're raising $2000 to cover the cost of printing and distributing 500 copies.
  • Any amount we raise will go towards this goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please spread the word about All the Art! Follow us on Twitter at: All the Art @AllTheArtStL, and check out our website www.Alltheartstl.com
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to promote this exciting project!

story:
La meva segona novel·la

Aquesta campanya de micro-mecenatge l'he creat per aconseguir publicar la meva segona novel·la titulada ODIN en format llibre i ebook.

Donada la gran quantitat de demanda que tinc per part dels meus lectors des de fa quasi un any, he decidit tirar pel dret de la mateixa manera que ho vaig fer amb El Diamant d'Herkimer, del que estic molt orgullós pels resultats que m'ha donat.

ODIN té un públic precís i també a la vegada més ampli, ja que en comptes d'una novel·la d'aventures sobrevingudes aquest nou relat s'enclava dins de la ben considerada novel·la històrica.


Per col·laborar amb el projecte només cal que cliqueu al botó de "Contribuir" de la dreta, però si us dóna algun error també em podeu fer un ingrés al compte corrent indicant referència ODIN i el vostre nom i enviar-me mail a info@davidfrigola.com per tenir el vostre contacte i poder-vos donar la recompensa per la vostra gentilesa.

Nº de compte: Deutsche Bank 0019 0047 50 4010029946

 


SINOPSI

Ens situem a Portbou, any 1944. A l'altra banda de la frontera existeix una França ocupada, un món en flames.


La Maria, una jove alemanya, es troba de nit vigilant des de la muntanya l'estació de ferrocarril, un enclavatge primordial que separa dues existències dispars, la calma i la guerra. Està esperant que arribi un carregament estranger que pretén infiltrar-se dins de l'Espanya de postguerra. Ella és l'encarregada de vetllar i de donar notícia de qualsevol moviment; una dona que, víctima dels seus errors del passat, de les seves pors més obscures, es veu obligada a actuar d'una manera que anys enrere no hagués ni somiat: contra els seus.

Malgrat que sembla una tasca molt senzilla la Maria no sap on s'ha ficat. El que ha de ser una operació rutinària esdevindrà l'operació més perillosa i important de totes, la que pot guiar cap a l'èxit als Aliats o a l'Eix (Alemanya-Itàlia-Japó), una conxorxa que portarà al lector a reviure els grans moments europeus des del 1914 fins el 1944, passant per Barcelona, Munic, Berlín, Madrid i finalment Portbou.

I entre totes aquestes sorpreses la Maria haurà de saber amb qui confiar i amb qui no, qui és, qui vol ser i vèncer els seus temors, alguns dels quals li passaran factura.

Sorpreses, aliances contra-natura, amor, acció, espies, enganys i intriga donen a la novel·la els ingredients principals per aventurar-s'hi i descobrir què amaga ODIN.

              


Aquest és un llibre creat a partir d'algunes experiències reals per part del meu avi matern que va residir a Portbou durant aquells anys de la seva joventut. També inclou passatges de la història basats en fets contrastats així mateix barrejats amb la ficció d'una intriga que destapa una veritat que fins ara se'ns ha amagat a tots.


Les recompenses

He creat varis tipus d'aportacions, des de la de 5 euros sense recompensa, passant per la de 10 i 20 fins la de 30, destacable perquè ja inclou el llibre editat i signat. Llavors vindrien la de 40, amb llibre i ebook, 50 que inclou 2 llibres: ODIN i El Diamant d'Herkimer, i finalment la que m'agrada més que és la de 100 perquè et converteix en MECENES oficial del llibre per sempre, a més que també t'emportes un parell de llibres.


Què necessito?

Aquesta campanya de publicació puja a 1.000 euros, destinats de la següent manera:

  • 750 euros per a la tirada de 150 exemplars del llibre.
  • 100 euros per a la conversió en ebook.
  • 100 euros per la portada.
  • 50 euros per a la compra de ISBN del llibre digital.
Si no s'assoleixen els 1.000 euros es reduirà la tirada de llibres.



El desafiament

Aquesta campanya de suport està encarada sobretot a aquells lectors i amics que s'han interessat per quan publicaria la meva segona novel·la. També per aquells que creuen amb mi i dels qui puc comptar sempre que els hi demano ajuda.


Com em podeu ajudar?

Contribuint a aquesta campanya bàsicament i també donant-ne ressò als vostres amics a través de les xarxes socials, el facebook, el twitter, etc...

És molt important sobretot que em recomaneu particularment a amics que li pugui interessar la meva novel·la, perquè si només ho compartiu tindrà poc èxit el vostre esforç ja que les xarxes socials estan saturades d'informació i màrqueting de marques. Moltes gràcies amics i amigues, fidels lectors!

El desafiament Aquesta campanya de suport està encarada sobretot a aquells lectors i amics que s'han interessat per quan publicaria la meva segona novel·la. També per aquells que creuen amb mi i dels qui puc comptar sempre que els hi demano ajuda. 
  
Com em podeu ajudar?
Contribuint a aquesta campanya bàsicament i també donant-ne ressò als vostres amics a través de les xarxes socials, el facebook, el twitter, etc... És molt important sobretot que em recomaneu particularment a amics que li pugui interessar la meva novel·la, perquè si només ho compartiu tindrà poc èxit el vostre esforç ja que les xarxes socials estan saturades d'informació i màrqueting de marques. Moltes gràcies amics i amigues, fidels lectors!

story:
THANKS FOR SUPPORTING OUR POWER of FIVE CAMPAIGN!

 

PLEASE CONTINUE TO SEND DONATIONS VIA OUR WEBSITE AND MAIL!

www.africanvoices.com

 

African Voices, 270 W. 96th Street, New York, NY 10025

 

READ THE RECENT NEW YORK DAILY NEWS ARTICLE ON OUR RECENT "FROM COVER TO COVER: 20 YEARS OF AFRICAN VOICES" ART EXHIBITION AT THE SCHOMBURG CENTER RESEARCH IN BLACK CULTURE:

 http://www.nydailynews.com/lifting-voices-20th-ann-exhibit-article-1.1231884

 

SAMPLE ISSUE & AD RATES

http://africanvoices.com/avblog/advertise/


NEW PERKS FOR 2015

You will get copies of our most recent issue for 2015!

 

Power of 5 Fundraising Campaign

POWER of FIVE: YOU + 5 Friends = $30.

I LOVE publishing African Voices magazine and presenting programs that proivde opportunities for writers and artists to flourish and grow!

On behalf of my staff and the more than 500 artists whose lives we have touched in the past two decades, I thank you for your support and contributions.

African Voices is one of the few surviving print literary magazines devoted to publishing literature and art by writers of color. In addition to publishing a quarterly magazine, the organization sponsors writing workshops for young people and adults, literary readings and other cultural programs including the Reel Sisters Film Festival, a festival that presents films produced, directed or written by women of color.

It's simple, contribute $5 and get five friends or colleagues to do the same. All contributions will be used to pay contributors and publish a print and digital edition of our Spring 2015 issue.

Fundraising Goal: $15,500

We have listed our fundraising goal as $500 so we can get the full benefit of any contributions raised via Indiegogo. 

Please do not stop pushing for us when we surpass $11,500, the money raised will support forthcoming issues and help us pay contributors!

Here's a summary of some costs the campaign supports:

CONTRIBUTORS' FEES: $2,500

EDITING & COPY EDITING: $1,500

PRINTING, DESIGN & POSTAGE: $9,500 (Digital & Print editions)

Total for one issue (52 pages): $15,500

The Impact

The IMPACT is that you will EMPOWER the writers, artists and readers who cherish the magazine through your contribution.

PLEASE feel free to give more than $5 to support African Voices. The reason we're asking for $5 is we want as many people to join in as possible. Times are challenging for many people but the average person has a five spot to spare. 

Your contribution will help us continue our mission to preserve our art, history and culture.

WHAT YOU GET

A positive feeling for supporting a great cause!

EVERYONE gets a digital issue of our Spring 2015 issue!

Contributors making a $35 donation will receive a signed copy of our poetry editor Mariahadessa Ekere Tallie's Karma's Footsteps!

Award winning poet Nikky Finney celebrates Ekere's poetry collection, writing:

"Ekere Tallie's new work Karma's Footsteps is as fierce with fight songs as it is with love songs. Searing with truths from the modern day world she is unafraid of the tweleve foot waves that such honesties always manifest. A poet who 'refuses to tiptoe' she enters and exits the page sometimes with short concise imagery, sometimes in the arms of delicate memoir. Her words pull the forgotten among us back into the lightning of our eyes."


Contributors giving the $60 and $160 level will get a beautiful unframed or framed poster of our Spring 2013 issue featuring Mirlande Jean-Gilles art work "Autumn In the City." Or you may request one of the other equally phenomenal magazine covers from our website. The posters are 18"x24" (you may request an 8"x10" poster).

What we do besides publishing African Voices?

African Voices Communications, Inc., the non-profit arts organization, has a long history of supporting artists through several programs that touch people from eight years old to seventy-five years young.

We believe the arts should impact people’s lives and community activism has been a vital part of our mission.

A brief outline of our arts programming:

Get Your Read On!: Young people are introduced to storytelling and creative writing workshops that nurture their interests in reading and writing.

African Voices Workshops & Performance Series: The series offers emerging writers a chance to develop their craft in weekly workshops and the reading series provides a chance for independent authors to sell and share their work. 

Reel Sisters Film of the Diaspora Festival & Lecture Series: Annual film festival that presents work directed, written or produced by women filmmakers.

 

ABOUT US - OUR STAFF:

PUBLISHER/FOUNDER

Carolyn A. Butts, the executive director and publisher of African Voices, has 20 years of organizing programs in the areas of arts, education, business and film. She served as an assistant press secretary to former New York State Comptroller H. Carl McCall and a press aide to former Manhattan Borough President Ruth Messinger. A former New York Post reporter, Carolyn was featured in Ms. Magazine’s October/November 2001 “Women to Watch” column for her outstanding achievements. Carolyn is also the founder the Reel Sisters of the Diaspora Film Festival & Lecture Series (www.reelsisters.org), an annual Brooklyn-based festival for women of color in the film industry.

Photo Credit: Mark Perkins, Arete Magazine.

MANAGING EDITOR

Maitefa Angaza is the managing editor of African Voices, an acclaimed, nationally distributed Black arts magazine. She is a co-producer of the documentary In Our Heads About Our Hair (2012) and author of Kwanzaa: From Holiday to Every Day, (Dafina Books, 2007), which climbed to #1 on amazon.com holiday books page. She is the proud former executive editor of the award-winning, now defunct newspaper, The City Sun and also worked as an editor at The Daily Challenge, both New York City publications. Ms. Angaza works also as an independent journalist, public relations and publicitywriter and arts reviewer. Her work has been published in Essence, Black Issues Book Review, The Amsterdam News, Our Time Press, The Network Journal, Positive Community, Dance Attitude and other publications. 

POETRY EDITOR

Mariahadessa Ekere Tallie is a poet, writer, educator, New Yorker and world-wanderer.  Her poetry and fiction have been published in several journals including: Crab Orchard Review, Bomb,  Long Shot, Paris/Atlantic, Drumvoices Revue, and Carapace. Her works have been anthologized in Listen Up! (One World/Ballantine), Catch The Fire!!! (Penguin/ Putnam), Bum Rush The Page: A Def Poetry Jam (Random House), Role Call (Third World Press), Beyond The Frontier (Black Classic Press), The Body Eclectic (Henry Holt), Revenge and Forgiveness (Henry Holt), and The Book of Hope (Beyond Borders). Ekere has taught English and conducted creative writing workshops in London, Amsterdam, New York, Chicago and Rundu (Namibia). She earned her M.A. in Creative Writing from Mills College in 2001 and has a B.A. in Mass Communications from Clark Atlanta University in 1996.

ART DIRECTOR

Derick Cross (aka D. Cross) is a multi dimensional visual and performance artist who creates imagery in order to reach deep inside the viewer of his artwork. His work is part of the collections of Erykah Badu (Singer), Ed Lewis(Founder of Essence Communications), Ruby Dee (legendary actress), Judith Jamaison (Alvin Ailey director & legendary dancer/choreographer) and Bashiri Johnson (world renowned percussionist & music producer), among others. He is the Art Director of African Voices. As a performance artist he combines the art of Spoken Word, Vocal Percussion (beatboxing) and Hip-Hop (emceeing/rap), making music to ears of listeners everywhere. D-Cross has been featured on Nickelodean, TV Land BET’s 106’s and Park and the Electric Company. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a $5 contribution, please pass on our invitation to FIVE friends who can! 

• Share this campaign on all your social media networks and tweet about the Poer of Five!

• Subscribe to African Voices for $20 (2 print issues & 1 digital issue a year)

• Advertise in our Fall 2015 issue.

• Contact us about volunteer opportunities at 212-865-2982 or africanvoicesmag@gmail.com

 

*DONORS LIVING OUTSIDE USA: Supporters living outside of the United States will be asked to pay for additional shipping costs for perks.

story:
The really short introduction

Futures of democracy?! is a democratic book about democracy. In its content and its form it resembles many of the benefits and problems of democratic politics. It also has a focus on the future, making it more practical than most other books on political theory and philosophy.  

With your help we can realize this unique and important project; hopefully the first of many to follow.

Het project in het Nederlands bekijken?

* All perks are displayed in US dollars. A dollar currently is 0,75 Euro. 

What's the Fuzz about?

This book will be different. We want to create a book that makes people wonder why there are not more books like this, a book that redefines how topics are presented. 

This is why we decided to take things in our own hands. After years of studying and working with books, we decided to publish a book that really helps people to learn and appreciate the subject it presents.

We have two guiding ideas: 

1. form and content should resemble each other.

2. complex matter can be presented in a challenging, engaging and provocative way.

Many people want to learn, they want to be interested in a topic, they want to become really engaged, but the way information is presented can make this difficult. Thus, we wondered, how can we really engage people? 

The best way to engage people with a topic is to present it in a democratic way. Choose a theme, let people have a say in the topics that will be treated, let them ask questions, let the authors reply, stage debate and discussion - not only at the end of the book but throughout. This creates a unique space for you – the reader – to reflect on where you stand. Many other books do not help you think, they don't really sharpen your understanding. 

Why is the democratic approach best suited, according to us? What makes democracy so popular and strong? It allows people to decide about their own lives. It is not a king or the aristocracy that decides for you - in a democracy, you are the one who decides. Democracy allows you to really engage in what concerns you. 

Discussion and debate provide fuel for change. They provide new insights, new ways of looking at the future, new ways of shaping the future. 

Democracy is all about debate, about contestation, about discussing your views on the world with people that hold different views.We decided that only one topic would be suitable for the first book created according to this philosophy: democracy. 

So in our book, we continually show that there are multiple perspectives, that every position can be contested, that every argument can be questioned. 


Why we need the money & What You Get

Up until now we have funded everything out of our own pockets, because we believe in this project.

Now, we need $5300 to cover the costs for editing and printing the book. 

We need to pay editors and proofreaders, and most of all: the printer. 

With a team of 15 people we have invested a tremendous amount of time to realize this project. We have reached out to philosophers, historians, scientists, and artists and convinced them of the value of our project. They have dedicated their time and effort and have written important and highly readable texts. But there are things that time can't buy, and in order to realize the book we simply need money.

To give you an idea of what we are going to spend the money on:

1. An editor (native speaker), so that we can deliver a flawless text

2. Printing 1.000 copies of Futures of Democracy?! 

If we raise above our goal of $5300 we will spend the money on a number of follow-up goals. You'll find them below.

If you do not have a credit card or paypal account and want to donate, please visit this page for more info. 


Rewards - our ways of saying Thank you!

By supporting us you become part of the family and we want to thank you for joining us. 

Everybody who supports us will be mentioned in a List of Honor, either on our website or in the book. Most of our perks include a copy of the book.

We also have a number of pretty unique rewards.

Feras Aljawabra, an artist from the Syrian opposition who is currently touring Europe with his works, has allowed us to provide a number of silkscreen canvasses as rewards. His beautiful and touching artworks provide a unique perspective on the disastrous current situation in Syria. You can read more about Feras and his artwork below. Here are the four artworks that are available for our perks.

              



                

We also present a one-of-a-kind silkscreen canvas of the cover-art of Futures of Democracy?!, signed by the artist.

Other rewards include a college-pack, webinars, seminars, a meet-and-eat with some of the authors Futures of Democracy?! and the possibility to get your company logo printed in the book. (Yes, companies can buy influence in real-life democracy as well. They call this lobbying.)

The Impact

This book is unique because the discussion is on each page. In order to represent this, we need alternatives apart from just plain text: we need boxes, colors and photos. Only by printing this book high quality and in color will it have the impact we want it to have. But color printing is expensive. As a young company we have no funds to pay it forwards. Since we believe in this book, we hope you follow us and make our dream a reality.

Then there is an idealistic reason. With this book we want to make a constructive contribution to politics and thinking about politics around the world. 

Winston Churchill once said that democracy was the worst form of government, except for all other forms that have been tried. In other words: democracy is here to stay, whatever might be wrong with it. This is why it is essential to talk, think, and debate about its future, about how it relates to the market, to human rights and to religion. This is why we should question who holds the power, what is right and what is wrong, who we consider 'part of the people', and many more things. Democracy touches us all - it is our future.


Follow Up Goals

We fell in love with this format of publishing. We consider many topics suitable for our approach. It is so fruitful to create an open minded exchange of thought, and to give experts from different backgrounds a place to freely exchange insights. Readers will remember more of what they have read and they will be able to really form their own thoughts about the topic of the books. 

This is what we'll do when we raise enough money:

1. Many of our contacts in the Arab world tell us that they would love to have a book like this. There is a big shortage of ideas and texts about democracy there. People want to think about democracy and new political arrangements, but they lack the necessary input to do this. Therefore, we will create an Arab translation and get the book published and distributed in the Middle East.

2. Produce a hardcover version of Futures of Democracy?! Funders who would receive a paperback will receive a hardcover if we'll produce one.

3. Continue with a line of books in the mould of Futures of Democracy?! We already have some ideas:

- We intend to treat topics such as globalisation, the rise of non-governmental powers (ngo's, international organisations, etc.), islam and democracy, and many more. 

- We would love to create and publish a book about how peoples' behavior can be influenced based on the insights of social psychology and neuroscience. There are so many practical, ethical and policy-related issues surrounding this topic that it almost literally begs for a book based on our approach.


Other Ways You Can Help

Share, share, share, share. Did we mention share yet? Please share our project through social media and your email list. Democracy is of concern to everyone, so please recommend our project on facebook, twitter, tumbler, instagram and whatever you can think of. 

You can also give us feedback in the comments. We love feedback, especially if it is constructive, and we are interested in your opinion (that is what our book is about!).

Something missing? Something not right? Something you want to know? Please contact us.

Thanks for everything you have done for us! You are awesome.


About Feras Aljawabra


Feras Al Jawabra is one of the 3 million displaced people living outside Syria. He was forced to leave his country, family and job as teacher at the University as he was held and tortured by the Syrian regime. Feras’ project is to paint the largest painting in the world in support of the people of Syria.

The artwork exists of 36 paintings.Each individual painting contains a story about the Syrian revolution. All 36 paintings together show the profile of Main Al Odat, a key opposition figurehead who was murdered by government snipers during a protest.

His art reflects the influence of the government and the current conflict on the people. Not only do we find his message inspiring, we also fell in love with the use of color and symbols and hope you do too.



All participants

Joep aan den Boom, Cor Burger, Mandy Cobussen, Lars Cornelissen, Mirte van Duppen, Carme Melo Escrihuela, Madelon van Honk, Tim Houwen, Feras Al Jawabra, Andy Knott, George Kwaad, Sonja Lavaert, Bas Leijssenaar, Sawsan Maher, Judith Martens, Wil Martens, Sara Osborne, Mathijs van de Sande, Stefan Schevelier, Andrew Smith, Nathan Tax, Stan Tubée, Marcel Wissenburg, and Evert van der Zweerde.

Follow Up Goals


We fell in love with this format of publishing. We consider many topics
suitable for our approach. It is so fruitful to create an open minded exchange
of thought, and to give experts from different backgrounds a place to freely
exchange insights. Readers will remember more of what they have read and they
will be able to really form their own thoughts about the topic of the
books. 
This is what we'll do when we raise enough money:
1. Many of our contacts in the Arab world tell us that they would love to have a book like this. There is a big shortage of ideas and texts about democracy there. People want to think about democracy and new political arrangements, but they lack the necessary input to do this. Therefore, we will create an Arab translation and get the book published and distributed in the Middle East.
2. Produce a hardcover version of Futures of Democracy?! Funders who would receive a paperback will receive a hardcover if we'll produce one.
3. Continue with a line of books in the mould of Futures of Democracy?! We already have some ideas:
- We intend to treat topics such as globalisation, the rise of
non-governmental powers (ngo's, international organisations, etc.), islam and
democracy, and many more. 
- We would love to create and publish a book about how peoples' behavior
can be influenced based on the insights of social psychology and neuroscience.
There are so many practical, ethical and policy-related issues surrounding this
topic that it almost literally begs for a book based on our approach.



Other Ways You Can Help


Share, share, share, share. Did we mention share yet? Please share our
project through social media and your email list. Democracy is of concern to
everyone, so please recommend our project on facebook, twitter, tumbler,
instagram and whatever you can think of. 
You can also give us feedback in the comments. We love feedback, especially
if it is constructive, and we are interested in your opinion (that is what our
book is about!).
Something missing? Something not right? Something you want to know? Please contact
us.
Thanks for everything you have done for us! You are awesome.


About Feras Aljawabra




Feras Al
Jawabra is one of the 3 million displaced
people living outside Syria. He was forced to leave his country, family and job as teacher at the
University as he was held and tortured by the Syrian regime. Feras’ project is
to paint the largest painting in the world in support of the people of
Syria. 
The
artwork exists of 36 paintings.Each individual painting contains a story
about the Syrian revolution. All 36 paintings together show the profile of Main
Al Odat, a key opposition figurehead who was murdered by government snipers
during a protest. 
His art reflects the influence of the
government and the current conflict on the people. Not only do we find his
message inspiring, we also fell in love with the use of color and symbols and
hope you do too.





All participants
Joep aan den Boom, Cor Burger, Mandy Cobussen, Lars
Cornelissen, Mirte van Duppen, Carme Melo Escrihuela, Madelon van Honk, Tim Houwen, Feras
Al Jawabra, Andy Knott, George Kwaad, Sonja Lavaert, Bas Leijssenaar, Sawsan
Maher, Judith Martens, Wil Martens, Sara Osborne, Mathijs van de Sande, Stefan
Schevelier, Andrew Smith, Nathan Tax, Stan Tubée, Marcel Wissenburg, and Evert
van der Zweerde.

story:
About Us:

The Conium Review is a small press publication from Portland, Oregon.  We publish poetry and fiction from local, national, and international authors.  The first issue is due out in February, 2012.  The issue will be roughly 150 pages with a full-color cover and professional binding. 

Our Funding Goals:

The Basics:

Your donation supports independent writing and publishing, giving us the funds to...

  • Expand our distribution, getting the first issue into bookstores and libraries.
  • Support our podcast, featuring readings/interviews with authors/editors.
  • Host upcoming literature readings/workshops.

In More Detail:

We use online technology to stay in touch with our readers, but we are firm believers in the importance of print media, bookstores, and libraries.  Our current budget lets us fulfill pre-orders and maintain the website, but we need a little extra funding to print additional copies and expand into new bookstore distribution channels.  In short, this campaign gets our print journal into the hands of more readers.

While the print edition is our main priority, this IndieGoGo campaign also gives us funds to continue podcast production and host readings in the community.  If we exceed the funding goal, we can put the additional money toward CLMP dues, getting tables at conventions, upgrading our website, and marketing the issue.

Even $1 helps.  Please support The Conium Review and independent publishing.  Remember to tell your friends and spread the word on Facebook and Twitter.

story:
It started out as a way of life and the tiny idea of trusting life has turned into a Tree of Life and is growing. Remembering the roads where this willingness to follow life has led,  I decided to write a book named Gift's of Gratitude. You will see when you read the book, it could just as easily have been called My Crazy Ass Relationship With Uncertainly.

Now the book is inspiring others. We stand here at the crossroads of civilization, the Shift is upon us, are we determined to run off the cliff because we are egotistical enough to insist that we are right, or can we relax a bit, smile a bit, laugh a bit, hug a bit, and believe that the Horse we are riding knows the way?

Join us! Together we can start a movement! People are joining in and we want to take this way of creating life out on the road. Encourage folks that this is an idea whose time has definitely come!

Gifts of Gratitude is a book about Grace: the enchanting, unexpected, and sometimes downright dazzling shapes that the gifts of Grace can take. These Gifts can surprise, delight, inspire, and at times actually take your breath away. And by the way, the translation of Grace really means the re-entrance of the Divine Feminine. Wouldn't it be spectacular - spectacular if all we have to do to save our world is to get the Divine Feminine and the Divine Masculine together for a little love fest?

So we have the Gifts of Gratitude, but the greatest Gift is all is LOVE.

 

Your contributions will seed a worldwide movement that will change the way we embrace our lives! Your money will help fund workshops, retreats, and promotion for Elizabeth to spread her unique message.

story:
H&g: A Journal for Huntergatherers is a new quarterly lifestyle magazine that honours the people and life of regional WA and expands on the vital connections our regions are making with communities across the globe.
H&g, the first issue, will be an object of beauty and originality, made with love and full of ideas and images to delight.
The magazine is now ready to enter the design phase and we need your help:

Your donation of $25 will mean much more than money. With a community of like minded people behind us, the H&g team will be able to sustain this project using all the media platforms that we can think of.


500 subscribers will put a lot of air under our wings! We invite you to be with us from the start.

ABOUT H&g

Writer & producer Amanda Rowland started her publishing career three years ago with JAM Magazine: A What’s On Guide to the Midwest. Her concept and passion has expanded to sharing the stories of regional WA across the globe from her headquarters in Geraldton, Midwest, WA. “Humour and creativity are not attributes usually associated with stories on mining or agriculture,” Amanda states, “ and this is where H&g excels.”


Amanda says “ We are living in a time of great connectivity and reach. Through our mining and resource industries, WA communities are in a unique postion to expand on the rich ties we share with peoples and nations across the world. H&g will take readers to the heart of regional Australia and shine a light on the amazing people and industries that underpin the viability and vitality of our cities.”

story:
Dorothy Surrenders

I’ve never written Dorothy Surrenders to make money. This should be abundantly clear. It’s one of those genuine labor-of-love deals where I write my blog because it seems impossible not to. And because I a lot of Big Lesbian Feelings about things. Also I like women, a lot. Over my six years of writing, I’ve connected with an incredible community – a community that is smart and funny and compassionate and simply amazing. So I’ve also made a point to steadfastly refuse to put advertising on my site. I believe it’s important to keep a few ad-free spaces on the internet where people can be creative without secretly trying to sell you vacation timeshare rentals. Now, that’s all fine and good. But it certainly doesn’t pay the bills.

So in lieu of banner ads for lube that will make your tender bits tingle, I’m holding this little fundraising campaign. It’s modest, though necessary. Blogging is a simple endeavor, but you still need certain essentials. In my case, I am in dire need of a little technical upgrading. My laptop is well over three years old and has developed a severe limp. And I’d also like to pick up various accessories and software to be able to improve the quality of my daily offerings. Yes, ladies and discerning gentleman, I’m trying to deliver the biggest, best and most beautiful Tank Top Tuesdays to you that I can.

Right, so this is the part where I shuffle up to you, hand extended, and ask for some change. Thank you for coming to my site, thank you for wanting to help. Anything is appreciated. And thanks, of course, for reading.

story:
From movies to rap music, from black “harlequin” novels to video games, common in today’s media is the romanticized portrayal of the black ghetto hoodlum. According to what is fast becoming urban legend, these “super men” win against incredible odds with cunning, street smarts and God’s goodwill. Far from this bullshit fantasy and much closer to the truth, is the fictionalized The American Nigga Machine (alternate title: Niggers, Niggas & Negroes). Taken from the lives of real people and set in a fictitious city, The American Nigga Machine sheds light on the havoc gangsters, thugs, and hoodlums wreak on their communities and the misery they leave behind.

What and why?

Sanitized pop fiction and feel good hero stories fill bookstore bookshelves as the publishing paradigm shifted from art to profits. Great writers are a dying breed and great stories are too far and few in between. But publishing corporations believe they know what the masses want; page after page of nonsensical, cookie cutter drivel that reads like a cross between a bad soap opera and an unfunny sitcom.

I cannot be what I am not.

I am not a form writer, I am not a ghostwriter, and I am not a corporate bullshit-for-profit writer. I write from my heart with passion…I write from my soul with venom. I write not for a living but because I must write. Simply, I write because this is who I am.

Why indiegogo?

True artist of any ilk are first and foremost independent thinkers by nature. I relish this independence and have endeavored to avoid big publishing houses at all cost. But after three rounds of edits and rewrites I have reached my financial limits. Your support for this project will cover in part:

·  Final editing and proofreading of The American Nigga Machine

·  Designing a final print edition of this book

·  Book printing & shipping

·  Literary usage permissions for several copyrighted quotations

·  Initial setup fee for electronic publication

·  Marketing and promotion (online and offline) 

Get involved. Lets bring back art in Literature!

(1) Back this Indiegogo campaign, and share The American Nigga Machine project with anyone and everyone who might be interested and loves good books! 

(2) Visit my websites teryljames.com, thefroogalvegetarian.com, and skillsndeals.com. 

 (3) Follow the project, and spread the word. I will be posting blogs. More than anything, read a good book…one that is not on the best seller’s list. 


Who am I?

Danny Brightmon (pseudonym Teryll James) was born and raised in Compton California. An exceptional student, he was able to navigate around the worst the streets had to offer. But through his eyes he witnessed the horrors and hopelessness of poverty. Through his heart he has felt the triumph of strength and resolve. Through his pen he wants to share these stories with the world.

What if?

What if the final edit is delayed?

I have an editor that has worked with this novel in its earlier versions so she knows it and my writing style well. Even so, I have several back up editors that I have summited samples of work just in case I need to go another route.

What if the book is not finished?

The story has been told and finalized. It needs to undergo a final (line edit) checks and proofreading.

What about delivery?

I have done my homework on everything from e-publishing to printing presses. I am an iBooks (Apple) publisher, an Amazon publisher and have standing several publishing deals with smaller Internet e-book venues as well. I have quotes and timetables from several printing presses. I am currently in the process of receiving an Ingram publisher account for hardcopy distribution.  I have added twenty percent more time to my publishing schedule to cover any unforeseen events.

story:
The Cause

I created this Indiegogo campaign in order to raise sufficient funds in order to dedicate time on writing Tempest Rising (novel) and creating YouTube videos.

It has always been a life dream to become a renowned author and, more recently, a popular YouTuber. This campaign would be of great benefit to me, and those who wish for my dreams to come true, as I would be able to entirely focus all my time and determination on reaching my goals. All donations, of any size, will enable me to do this.

The Novel - Tempest Rising

Tempest Rising will be a fantasy novel based in a fictional world that is created by my imagination.

The plot will follow a Necromancer who is seeking vengeance on the Tyrande Kingdom by utilising any means necessary. 

The story will be dark, graphic in its violence, and should hopefully be captivating and invoke emotion from the reader.

Your funding will allow me to dedicate my time to writing this and getting myself known as an author.

The YouTube

I have been a YouTube vlogger for not-far-off five years. Over that time I have witnessed my channel grow, in both its content and the audience watching it.

It is my goal to become a popular YouTuber for not just vlogs, but also comedy stuff and perhaps even music if the path takes that turn.

Your funding will enable me to acquire new equipment for making videos plus it will also allow me to focus my time on creating them for you.

The Goal

I have set quite a high goal of £20,000 - though I do not expect to raise this much. £20,000 would allow me one entire year to focus all my time and efforts into my writing and making quality YouTube videos without having to worry about distractions and general life activities.

The Perks

The perks list is quite random, and the more expensive donations will grant access to some pretty exclusive perks.

The audiobook recording will only be a feature exclusive to contributors to this campaign, no other people will receive such a benefit.

As the list progresses in price, the perks become even more unique (but I don't honestly expect them to be met anyway).

Please note that any signed copy of the hardcover book will only have free delivery to UK residents. Anyone not within the UK will need to provide shipping costs (but not printing costs, the book itself is free regardless).

The Expectation

I honestly do not expect much of a result from this campaign. Ideally, I would love to believe that I would reach the goal and then I could spend an entire year making my dreams come true - because it is something that I really want.

Should I somehow manage to meet or exceed my target - I will be able to entirely focus all my efforts into my writing and my YouTube career. The quality of both shall be enhanced by this, allowing me to create great products.

A Final Word...

I would just like to thank you for even taking the time to view my campaign - whether you donate or not is entirely up to you, but I thank you nevertheless.

story:
MY PURPOSE - I make Service Dog Vests for disabled veterans, free of charge.  Each vest is specially created for each veteran from their own service uniform.  The insignia, service patches, rank, unit, branch, name labels, etc, (from each member) is incorporated into their vest creating a unique one-of-a-kind vest.  Pockets are removed from the uniform and included on each vest.  The result is a wide array of configurations of vest designs, styles, and sizes each specifically created for that service member and his/her service dog.

Photo by Kerri Jean Photography


When a dog wears a vest created from the service member's own uniform, the dog wears the pride each member has earned.  The dog and vest also take on the role of battle buddy which was so important while in action.

WHY - Our young service men and women have given so much, and even though they are home, many are still in the “battle” - the battle to reintegrate back into civilian life.  In many cases a Service Dog can assist in the support of the service member's reintegration.  A Dog Vest identifies the dog's purpose and mission.  A Service Dog is part of the support team, dressed in the service member's uniform. The vest is adorned with insignia, patches, and even medals earned during the warrior's service.

MY GOAL – is to keep up with the increased demand for these one-of-a-kind Service Dog Vests, at no charge for our Heroes.

WHO AM I - I retired two years ago after 25 years working as a Federal Government employee! I've worked for the Army, Navy, Airforce, Department of Justice and NASA. The last 15 years was spent in the law enforcement field.

HOW DID I GET HERE - About two years ago, I be-friended a woman who was running a non-profit organizaton called Hounds4Heroes Tampa Bay. She was taking homeless shelter dogs and training them to become service dogs able to assist military veterans suffering with Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) and other “hidden disabilities.”

Thinking this was amazing, I volunteered to assist in some way......

Well, they needed vests and I happen to be able to sew!

One day, a soldier asked if I could make his service dog's vest from his military jacket and insignia/patches he had worn while serving his Country in Afghanistan . . . .

And, hence, my custom, one-of-a-kind service dog vest was born!

I started posting photos of these amazing dogs wearing their custom designed vests on my Facebook Page:

Facebook - DogVests4Vets

Word quickly got out. I now have soldiers contacting me from all over the United States. I encourage you to view my Facebook Page and see all the warriors and their four-legged companions that I have been honored to serve.

What's up Now - I started a website, DogVests4Vets, in August of this year. This website has helped me reach more veterans and improve the process of ordering a free vest. The website also serves as a journal, listing all my terrific heroes and their dogs sporting their new vests.

Over the last two years, I have had the honor of making dog vests for over a hundred deserving veterans and their dogs – FREE OF CHARGE. I have never charged a fee for my vests. I wanted to give back to my Heroes – they deserve it!

TODAY - Creating these one-of-a-kind vests has become my obsession! It is very rewarding providing this service to our veterans and their four legged companions.

Recently requests for my vests was increasing dramatically. The reality is I can no longer afford to continue making vests, free of charge, at this increased rate.

I started off making 2-3 vests per month

I am now making 3-4 vests per week!

WITH YOUR HELP - I can continue providing dog vest for vets "free of charge" to all our Heroes!

I now have a waiting list of Heroes wanting a vest for their service dog. I don't want to disappoint these warriors – but, I need your help with the funding.



What I Need & What You Get


WHAT I NEED – is to raise enough funding to supply vests to heroes for at least another year (or more).  That is at an average rate of 2-4 vests per week.  If I exceed our goal it will allow us to perhaps increase production or extend our timeframes.

Your funds will be used for:

  1. Fabric (for the soldiers that no longer have their military uniforms)

  2. Hardware (plastic buckles, slides, handles, D-rings)

  3. Webbing

  4. Velcro

  5. Patches

  6. Sewing Notions (thread, needles, etc.)

  7. Shipping Costs

  8. Labor (if I get enough funding, I would like to pay another seamstress to help increase production)

Some of the funds will have to be used to cover the costs of using this crowdfunding site, they include:

      1. Cost of “Perks” - your rewards for making a donation

      2. Fee to Indiegogo (9% if I don't meet my goal; 4% if I do meet my goal)

      3. Fee to process payments (3%)



WHAT YOU GET – They are called “perks” – I'm so excited about my new Logo. It was designed especially for my Heroes. In fact, the dog's name on my Logo is “Hero”. I had all my warriors help select his name on my FaceBook page.

So, all of my perks are made using my “Hero” logo. You will love it –

The Logo will be placed on stickers, stainless steel military dog tags, and embroidered patches and given to you for your contribution.

It is such a wonderful, rewarding feeling to give back to these amazing heroes. Your reward is a lot like my reward, with the addition of a few materialistic items of appreciation.


HERE ARE THE PERKS

$10 USD - Vinyl Sticker of Hero - You will receive an oval 4 x 6 inch vinyl sticker of our dog “Hero” and your name included on our website donation list.


$20 USD - Dog Tag of Hero - You will receive a stainless steel 2 x 3 inch military dog tag (with chain and key ring) with our dog “Hero” on one side and “Help a Dog . . . Help a Hero” printed on the back. Your name will also be included on our website donation list.

$25 USD - Embroidered Patch of Hero - You will receive a 3 x 4 inch embroidered multicolor patch of our dog “Hero”. Your name will also be included on our website donation list.



$ 50 USD - Three Heroes - You will receive all three of the previously listed items; that is a sticker, a dog tag, and a patch. Your name will also be included on our website donation list.


$100 USD – Sponsor a Hero - Personally Sponser a specific Service Dog Team by having your name on a label sewn into a Service Dog Vest. The label will identify you as providing funding for the dog vest. You will be provided a photograph of the Service Dog wearing the vest you sponsored along with a letter of appreciation. Your name will be listed in a special location within the home page on our website donation list. You will also receive a sticker, a dog tag, and a patch. 



If you cannot make a donation, please help me out and use the Indiegogo Share Tools to get the word out and . . .

                             "Bark It Up!"

Thank You for your consideration and our Veterans Thank You as Well !


Together We Can Do It !

PURPOSE -
I make Service Dog Vests for disabled veterans, free of charge.  Each vest is specially created for each
veteran from their own service uniform.  The insignia, service
patches, rank, unit, branch, name labels, etc, (from each member) is
incorporated into their vest creating a unique one-of-a-kind vest.  Pockets are removed from the uniform and included on each vest.  The
result is a wide array of configurations of vest designs, styles, and
sizes each specifically created for that service member and his/her
service dog.

a dog wears a vest created from the service member's own uniform, the
dog wears the pride each member has earned.  The dog and vest also
take on the role of battle buddy which was so important while in
action.
WHY
- Our young service men and women have given so much, and even though
they are home, many are still in the “battle” - the battle to
reintegrate back into civilian life.  In many cases a Service Dog can
assist in the support of the service member's reintegration.  A Dog
Vest identifies the dog's purpose and mission.  A Service Dog is part
of the support team, dressed in the service member's uniform.  The
vest is adorned with insignia, patches, and even medals earned during
the warrior's service.

MY
GOAL –
is to keep up with the increased demand for these one-of-a-kind
Service Dog Vests, at no charge for our Heroes.
WHO
AM I - I retired two years ago after 25 years working as a
Federal Government employee!  I've worked for the Army, Navy,
Airforce, Department of Justice and NASA.  The last 15 years was
spent in the law enforcement field.

running a non-profit organizaton called Hounds4Heroes Tampa Bay.  She

dogs able to assist military veterans suffering with Post Traumatic
Stress Disorder (PTSD) and other “hidden disabilities.”

military jacket and insignia/patches he had worn while serving his

hence, my custom, one-of-a-kind service dog vest was born!

story:
Help fund a book that makes the world a better place

Taruni's journey of healing has been one of those experiences that touches many lives along the way. In dealing with the loss of her husband from cancer she has moved half way across the world; written and self-published a book on death and grieving; volunteers at hospice, offering patient care and bereavement support; and is also running a free-twice-monthly grief support group in Manhattan.

Now she is writing a book for commercial publication titled - A good day to die.  This book will describe in more detail the experience of caring for her terminally ill husband, the dying process, and the healing journey after his passing. To accompany this book, will be a handbook on grieving, intended as a resource for professionals working in the area of bereavement and for the bereaved. 

I am launching this campaign to help her write this book.

I have set the goal for the last week of this campaign at US $2,400.  Prior to this campaign we raised $1,159. 

Additionally, my hope is that we will exceed that goal because I want to contribute to the editing and publishing of Taruni’s new book on death and grieving. She has already completed a first edition, which she self-published (excerpts here).

The process of writing her new book has begun. A part of that process includes taking JP’s ashes to Mayapur, India, to cast them into the River Ganga. Following that, she will return to Australia. She has not been back since JP left his body. 

Taruni and her husband's relationship was deeply spiritual. It began in Australia but took them to India in search of  greater answers about life's mysteries. The Sanskrit philosophy that arises out of India wrapped itself deeply into their lives. It now provides Taruni with the insights that color her writing, For those reasons I feel strongly that this trip represents a cycle of completion for Taruni in the life long process of grieving. 

This December 17 marks five years since the passing of Taruni’s husband, who she affectionately calls JP.  I only met him once, and briefly, but in that brief encounter, I saw what a kind and saintly person he was. His three year battle against brain cancer was both a grueling and spiritual ordeal for Taruni and JP. Throughout it all and up to the end Taruni, did what I can only describe as one of the most wonderful, selfless, and important things one person can do for another. She gave JP a truly spiritual and loving passing from this life to the next. I am in awe of Taruni.

Since that time of loss and trauma, I have seen her grow and heal; sometimes slowly, sometimes painfully, but with firm determination. 

I want to help ensure that this book gets written. Her book will help and support thousands of people who struggle with reality of loss. 

So please give what you can afford.

Thank you in advance,

Atma

story:
What is Dancing Over Kyoto?

Dancing Over Kyoto is an Ebook launched in late August 2013. It was my intention to launch Dancing as an Ebook (done), let it rock along for a few months (done), then crowdfund putting it in a hard copy and/or print-on-demand format, which is what I'm doing here at indiegogo.

I'm the author, writing under the pen name Richard Russell. I'm an American who's twice lived in Japan and over the past dozen years have traveled back and forth to my between the U.S. and Japan some 20 or so times. Over the course of the 30-year sweep of Dancing Over Kyoto the reader lives the experiences of a student, a teacher, an antiquities dealer, a spouse, an attorney, and a man falling in love, and sometimes done-in by love. Dancing's novelistic story arc, tales from India and China along with Japan, and a healthy dose of sometimes discomforting-but-true Southern Gothic, all contribute to its unique place among "travel memoirs."

While sales (downloads), feedback and customer reviews of Dancing Over Kyoto as an Ebook have been positive (sometimes glowing) to date, bringing it out in hard copy (both in soft cover and hard cover) will help it expand its audience and readership tremendously.


Bringing Dancing to Print: Funding & Perks

I'd like to raise at least $3,500 to bring Dancing to Kyoto to print by February 14, Valentine's Day, 2014. The schedule is a tight one:  raising the funds needed to expand Dancing with a glossary and Japanese language primer, pay for formatting, final edits, printing, promotion and have it ready to its hard copy launch date is an ambitious one, but it's doable. Of course the lion's share of the costs go to formatting, edit double-checks, printing set-up, and purchasing (even at a discount) hard copies for promotional purposes. Also, I'm negotiating a contract to have Dancing available as a print-on-demand book available at and through 30,000 book stores and online retailers worldwide such as Barnes & Noble, Amazon.com, etc. 

Before proceeding to Perks, I want to share what one Deep South author, columnist and radio host, Carroll Dale Short, has written about Dancing over at its Ebook site:

"'Dancing Over Kyoto' is ostensibly a memoir and travelogue, but it's far more than the sum of its parts: engaging and moving, with moments of laugh-out-loud humor. What most sets the writing apart, especially in today's literary/pop culture of style over substance, is its total lack of artifice. The tone is of a casual conversation with the reader, but the narrative lingers in the mind and heart long after one has finished it."

Now I want to bring this book to a wider audience, but need your help to do so!

PERKS!

Any contribution will be appreciated and valued. Here are several specific Perks, which will be sent to crowdfunders within thirty (30) days of Dancing Over Kyoto's availability in hard copy form (remember:  it's already available as an Ebook here.)

$10:  A signed cover art photo Bookmark (that's a Noh mask, photographed by the author in Kyoto in 2003) & cover art photo post card mailed to you with a personalized note of thanks from the author. Also, if desired and requested, your name featured on Dancing's website as a valued contributor to bringing Dancing Over Kyoto to hard copy format.

$50  All of the above, plus, if desired and requested, an Acknowledgement in the hard copy edition of Dancing Over Kyoto, plus an (approx) 8"x11" photograph of the cover art photo, suitable for framing and signed by the author.

$100 All of the above, plus, for the first 20 $100 contributors, a BookStub (a plastic, credit card-size card) allowing the holder a free download of Dancing as an Ebook, which the holder's free to keep, use, or give as a gift as they may please, plus, a second(approx) 11x8" photograph taken by the author and suitable for framing:  The Stone Buddha of Kurodani Temple (Kyoto, Japan. 2003). See here:

$500 All of the above (excepting the BookStub), plus, -- for the first eight (8) $500-$749 contributors -- a softcover edition of Dancing Over Kyoto signed by the author.

$750+ All of the above (excepting the BookStub), plus, a piece of antique Japanese Imari porcelain, acquired by the author in Japan (retail value of each piece, $50-$75.00). This last perk must be limited to five (5) contributors of $750 or more. The Imari porcelain is actually part of Dancing Over Kyoto, as it was acquired on one of several buying trips to Japan described in Part III of Dancing Over Kyoto. 

Dancing's Impact

The more people who read Dancing Over Kyoto, the greater and deeper appreciation they will have, not only for a country and people so special to me, but also for the joys and lessons available and attainable to anyone, anywhere they may travel. Or, for those who will never travel overseas, Dancing allows them both an inexpensive vacation and adventure, as well as Japan-inspired wisdom to assist such readers savor their own neighborhood, local restaurant, or moment all alone. These are hardly my insights; in Dancing Over Kyoto I merely pass along lessons learned from experiences I've been through!


A Few Final Words

Please know that even if you cannot contribute to bringing Dancing Over Kyoto to hard copy format, it's already available in Ebook format. What's more, I would humble and thankful for your "spreading the word," whether or not you can contribute! Use Indiegogo's share tools, or any method you choose! 

Thank you and 心からありがとうございます!

Richard Newton

a/k/a  Richard Russell

story:
A LOVE OF A LIFETIME

All my life I have loved classic rock music. I remember growing up listening to Saturday evening oldies on the radio with my parents, watching Sha Na Na on TV and revelling in Elvis movie double features on Sunday afternoons. I used to keep a notebook and when I listened to Casey Kasem deliver to Weekly Top 40 I would write down all the little trivia he would divulge about artists, especially about artists like The Beatles, The Rolling Stones or other classic rock stars.

Now I have decided that it's time to take my passion for classic rock and share it with as many people as possible. I have gathered other classic rock lovers to help me create this exciting new publication, Rock Roots Magazine, which will focus solely on classic rock music. We are already working hard on our inaugural issue which will come out in June.

 FREEDOM OF THE PRESS DOESN'T COME FREE

Unfortunately, creating a magazine has a lot of costs associated with it and I can't afford to do it all alone. Yes, eventually, I will have advertisers and subscriber that will help cover the cost of Rock Roots Magazine, but in the mean time, I need funds to get this baby off the ground.

Your donation will go to help cover the cost of:

  • Creating an LLC
  • Purchase of expensive publishing software
  • Web hosting with large storage, bandwidth and security features
  • Stock photo purchases
  • Fees for freelance writers, editors and artists
  • Purchase of books and CDs for review
  • Marketing costs
  • IT and web design services

 

But your donation will do more than cover these costs, it will help make a dream come true. And not just for me, but for the others involved in this project who are also excited to share their love of classic rock with the world and eager to be a part of something special.

THEY'RE NOT JUST STORIES AND PICTURES

Music touches our lives in a way that nothing else does. Our magazine will bring back cherished memories, revive interests, inform and even educate. So many people love classic rock, but others merely enjoy being reminded of the music of their childhood, their youth, of a simpler time.  Then there are those who have not had the joy of early rock and hearing where we started from. Rock Roots Magazine will bring this to them too. In fact, we will even have a section written by teens giving their perspective on classic rock artists they are being introduced to.

In the late 90s, I ran a successful Beatles fan site on MSN Groups, and from 2004 - 2011, I ran a site called Raven the Rock n Roll Maven where I researched rock questions for people and provided info on the music of the 50s, 60s, 70s and 80s, so I have experience with seeing how sharing information and points of view on music can bring people together.  I know Rock Roots Magazine can be a success.  Will be a success.

 

Your choice of t-shirt/tote from our Rock Roots Magazine Shop*

YOUR DONATIONS

With each contribution, we will gratefully give the following:

$10 - A shout out on our Twitter and FaceBook page as well as our undying gratitude.

$25  - A free 1 year subscription to Rock Roots Magazine, plus a shout out on Twitter and FaceBook page as well as our undying gratitude.

$50 - An official Rock Roots t-shirt, a shout out on our Twitter and FaceBook page as well as our undying gratitude.

$75 - An official Rock Roots t-shirt, a free 1 year subscription to Rock Roots Magazine, a shout out on our Twitter and FaceBook page as well as our undying gratitude.

$100 - An official Rock Roots tote bag, a shout out on our Twitter and FaceBook page as well as our undying gratitude.

$150 - An official Rock Roots tote bag, a free 1 year subscription to Rock Roots Magazine, a shout out on our Twitter and FaceBook page as well as our undying gratitude.

$200 - An official Rock Roots tote bag, an official Rock Roots t-shirt, a free 1 year subscription to Rock Roots Magazine, a shout out on our Twitter and FaceBook page and - of course - our undying gratitude.

$300- An official Rock Roots tote bag, an official Rock Roots t-shirt, a free 1 year subscription to Rock Roots Magazine, and a listing on www.rockrootsmagazine as a sponsor.

$500 - 6 months of banner ads on www.rockrootsmagazine.com for yourself or a friend.

$1,000 - Corporate sponsor. Dedicated ad for 1 year on www.rockrootsmagazine.com and listing on site as corporate sponsor.

 *Does not include hoodies, sweatshirts or embroidered items. See http://www.zazzle.com/rockrootsmag to view full selection.
