story:
"In Swimming Out of Water, Catherine effortlessly weaves together the invisible connections between health, eating, emotions, environment, physical performance, and the human spirit" ~ Marc David - nutritional psychologist, best selling author, & founder of the Institute for the Psychology of Eating.

Operation Swimming Out of Water - Rescuing 1000 Women from Emotional Eating

This project outlines the outcome of a 6 year work in progress, after a life-changing experience (stuck in the Red Rock of Las Vegas for 24 hours) changed the direction of my life, to first answer the following question, and then share my findings with other women!

"How could it be harder to overcome binge eating (emotional eating and other body image issues) than to win an Olympic medal?"

{yes, this was my reality}

It took me years to figure out the missing pieces to my own healing (and to attain greater freedom with food and body), but now that I've got solutions, I'm devoted helping others by delivering a system that can effectively address any woman's specific challenges with eating, food, and body... joining me in this renewed freedom!

As mentioned above, a full spectrum of products and services have emerged out of this calling...But to complete production/marketing and delivery to thousands of women, I need your help!

As an overview, funds will be used for:

  • The Swimming Out of Water/Eat 360 book tour
  • Production and Marketing of EAT 360 Study Guide and Audio Program
  • Companion EAT360 Phone App
  • Online Marketing Campaign (including a complementary Binge Eating Solution ebook to act as a viral marketing gift)
  • Online Community maintenance and expansion for program

"Catherine Garceau's message is a gift for all women! She helps us discover that with a holistic and optimistic approach to life, including proper nutrition, we can all step on the podium of health and happiness!" ~ Kyla Schmidt, nutritionist.


Swimming Out of Water takes readers through a life-altering experience I had when I caught myself alone in the Red Rocks of Las Vegas for 24 hours. Sharing many life stories that lead up to the Olympic podium in Sydney 2000 in synchronized swimming, I reveal the secret struggles I had with eating disorders and also the many wellness discoveries I made since, while on my healing journey.

"Cat's voice takes us on a lilting journey of what it is to break the surface of struggle and offer our lives to the world.  (...) I could not put this story down." ~ Brie Mathers, author, speaker

Swimming Out of Water/EAT 360 Book tour presentations will be targeted towards students in the College market, who are at the turning point of choosing HOW they to relate with food and body in a way that honors their long-term health and well-being. Funds will be used for travel, book purchases for events and marketing collateral. As the business platform builds, middle-aged women audiences in gyms and wellness/spa centers will also be targeted. Women of all ages struggling with eating, food, and body related health issues will benefit from the growth of these face-to-face interactive presentations.

"Cat Garceau shares the amazing personal odyssey that led her to discover essential information and resources that support and celebrate true health and well-being."  ~ Dr. Cat Saunders. author of Dr. Cat's Helping Handbook: A Compassionate Guide for Being Human

EAT 360 - Emotional Awareness Training - 360° of Nourishment

After building the Wellness Olympiad program for women with eating disorders in 2010, and interviewing over 20 experts on the Spiritual, Mental, Emotional, and Physical aspects of challenges with food and body, it was time to zero in on the essentials learned and offer women struggling with emotional eating (not just severe eating disorders) a focused method to break free. I thus invited Johnny Blackburn to join me in this mission. Johnny combines functional Nutrition, EFT, Integral Life Coaching, and a Master's Degree in Psychology with clinical experience working in a renowned international Functional Medical Center as well as an integrative Addiction Eating Disorder, and Trauma Center. Together, our experiences, gifts, and understanding have created this new way for women to get back into the driver's seat of navigating their relationship with food, their body, their emotions, and their mind.

The program involves a 12 week integration audio session series and is supported with a study guide inquiry/exercise process. It covers all four wings of wellness and how they can make or break our relationship with food:

  • Mental: beliefs busters & brain changing technology
  • Physical: nourishment & self-care: movement food vitality & rhythm
  • Spiritual: sacredness &, connection 
  • Emotions: EAT process, including EFT for past releasing & present freedom

We also offer optional one-on-one coaching. This delivers personalized attention and support with additional body/mind aspects such as a 3 month targeted supplement supply and a Brainwave audio entrainment device for mental/nervous system support (created miracles for me!). We believe this to be the most comprehensive breakthrough system offered yet for emotional eating, and we need your support to built continue to grow its reach and team so we can deliver it to 1000 women over this next year, and much more beyond.

 

"Cat's blend of soul and science offers a ray of hope for anyone who's lived in the darkness of disordered eating, as well as the inspiration and tools to break free." ~ Natasha Schuler, single mom

EAT 360 PHONE APP

This complete health-building program is effective because it gets women to APPLY practices and tools that create real sustainable shifts in their lives. THIS PHONE APP IS ESSENTIAL - it creates a sense of accountability and follow through to aid in the process of transformation with eating. EAT 360 APP will not only be for those participating in the EAT 360 program, we will market it to nutritionists, life coaches, and counselors who know how important it is for their clients to follow a healthy eating regime, and release the emotions that are keeping them stuck in old behaviors. With pre/post-meal prompts, hunger/satiation check-ins, and guided Emotional Freedom Techniques to help free up emotions before eating, this App will help users raise emotional awareness while breaking through unhealthy eating behaviors. This App will be made available for both iPhone and Android applications.

"Catherine shows how freeing and empowering diving into the fullness of our feelings can be, when we learn to fully feel and release our emotions, gaining greater self acceptance, peace, and purpose." ~ Dale Paula Teplitz, Emotional Freedom Techniques, EFT trainer

Develop/Maintain Community Support and Social Media Integration

Staying on top of web integration platforms these days takes constant effort and the right team players on board to make it happen. Supporting thousands of women to become free from emotional eating will require us to offer solutions in difference mediums, catering to the different preferences and lifestyles.

Women thrive on connection -- so while we will be teaching and advocating for them to foster more face-to-face interaction with their loved ones and in their local communities, we want to offer an exciting community aspect that continues to foster Operation Swimming Out of Water.

"Catherine Garceau has turned her amazing accomplishments into even deeper wins, as she has taken on the greatest race of all: the effort to be our own best self." ~ Marianne Williamson, best-selling author

HELP US FREE 1000 WOMEN of EMOTIONAL EATING IN ONE YEAR

We hear about eating disorders, but severe eating disorders spread across a full spectrum of unhealthy relationships with food and body?  For most women, binge eating, self-loathing, and different versions of emotional eating are still being kept a personal and secret challenge, not spoken about openly and often times, passed on to the next generation.

Operation Swimming Out of Water will give a voice to the millions of women around the world who just like you and me, are successful in some areas of life, but still struggle behind closed doors - cursing their body shapes and sizes, their relationship with food, and/or the workouts they can't keep up with or obsess about. More than creating AWARENESS - we provide SOLUTIONS: My team and I are 100% committed to fulfill on this mission - changing the lives of 1000 women in the next year.

"May Swimming Out of Water awaken young women to the dangers of messing with what they eat and remind us all that our bodies, brain, and mind are so very connected!"  ~ Dr. Daniel Amen, award-winning psychiatrist, brain imaging expert and best-selling author.

Help us make this a reality.

Emotions: EAT process, including EFT for past releasing & present freedom
We also offer optional one-on-one coaching. This delivers personalized attention and support with additional body/mind aspects such as a 3 month targeted supplement supply and a Brainwave audio entrainment device for mental/nervous system support (created miracles for me!). We believe this to be the most comprehensive breakthrough system offered yet for emotional eating, and we need your support to built continue to grow its reach and team so we can deliver it to 1000 women over this next year, and much more beyond.
 

"Cat's blend of soul and science offers a ray of hope for anyone who's lived in the darkness of disordered eating, as well as the inspiration and tools to break free." ~ Natasha Schuler, single mom
EAT 360 PHONE APP
This complete health-building program is effective because it gets women to APPLY practices and tools that create real sustainable shifts in their lives. THIS PHONE APP IS ESSENTIAL - it creates a sense of accountability and follow through to aid in the process of transformation with eating. EAT 360 APP will not only be for those participating in the EAT 360 program, we will market it to nutritionists, life coaches, and counselors who know how important it is for their clients to follow a healthy eating regime, and release the emotions that are keeping them stuck in old behaviors. With pre/post-meal prompts, hunger/satiation check-ins, and guided Emotional Freedom Techniques to help free up emotions before eating, this App will help users raise emotional awareness while breaking through unhealthy eating behaviors. This App will be made available for both iPhone and Android applications.

"Catherine shows how freeing and empowering diving into the fullness of our feelings can be, when we learn to fully feel and release our emotions, gaining greater self acceptance, peace, and purpose." ~ Dale Paula Teplitz, Emotional Freedom Techniques, EFT trainer
Develop/Maintain Community Support and Social Media Integration
Staying on top of web integration platforms these days takes constant effort and the right team players on board to make it happen. Supporting thousands of women to become free from emotional eating will require us to offer solutions in difference mediums, catering to the different preferences and lifestyles. Women thrive on connection -- so while we will be teaching and advocating for them to foster more face-to-face interaction with their loved ones and in their local communities, we want to offer an exciting community aspect that continues to foster Operation Swimming Out of Water.
"Catherine Garceau has turned her amazing accomplishments into even deeper wins, as she has taken on the greatest race of all: the effort to be our own best self." ~ Marianne Williamson, best-selling author
HELP US FREE 1000 WOMEN of EMOTIONAL EATING IN ONE YEAR
We hear about eating disorders, but severe eating disorders spread across a full spectrum of unhealthy relationships with food and body?  For most women, binge eating, self-loathing, and different versions of emotional eating are still being kept a personal and secret challenge, not spoken about openly and often times, passed on to the next generation.  Operation Swimming Out of Water will give a voice to the millions of women around the world who just like you and me, are successful in some areas of life, but still struggle behind closed doors - cursing their body shapes and sizes, their relationship with food, and/or the workouts they can't keep up with or obsess about. More than creating AWARENESS - we provide SOLUTIONS: My team and I are 100% committed to fulfill on this mission - changing the lives of 1000 women in the next year.

"May Swimming Out of Water awaken young women to the dangers of messing with what they eat and remind us all that our bodies, brain, and mind are so very connected!"  ~ Dr. Daniel Amen, award-winning psychiatrist, brain imaging expert and best-selling author.
Help us make this a reality.

story:
Why you can feel really good about contributing to "The Father Letters" book. -We are now becoming very aware that the Father/Child relationship is as important as the Mother/Child relationship, and runs deep - affecting every area of our lives.  When this relationship is healthy, sons turn into mature, effective men; and girls grow into confident, lovely women.  And when it's not, the seeds of suffering and heartache, thwarted lives and repeated pattens of failure are played out.  Our entire society - at every level - is affected - for better or for worse.  Growing up in an emotionally empty relationship with my father, my life was colored gray when it came to understanding men.  As you can imagine, this played out in self-defeating ways for all of my life.  
Until, I was able to retrieve and heal my relationship with my own father.  Once that was accomplished, I sat down and wrote to him the first ever kind letter - one full of understanding, compassion and acceptance - of him and me.  My life was forever changed.  I saw myself differently, loved myself more - and could finally begin to approach life with a sense of stability and sureness.  The thought occurred to me at the time to share with friends, and as a I did, it became apparent to me that a book of letters to fathers from sons and daughters could open a whole vista of healing, acceptance, celebration and change relationship and lives.  And, in the process give honor to fathers, inviting them to take their rightful place in our world as life-shapers and the heroes they really are in their hearts.  
This book is a gift - to myself, to all the contributing writers who have submitted letters, and hopefully to all the readers who will enjoy the honesty and and transparency of this book.  Your support to help us publish with Balboa Press (Division of Hay House) will bring this book, and its important ripple effect into the daylight.  I can barely imagine the lives that will be impacted for good! 

The publishing package we feel will support this book costs $8000.00.  The costs don't stop there.  We have our Editor, Administrative Coordinator to pay, Artwork to consider, Office Expenses, Shipping and Postage, our Perks to pay for, PR expenses, and a percentage of proceeds to return to Indiegogo. If we do not reach our goal, we will still proceed with publishing.  However, it would be at a lesser level.  This book deserves the very best support possible, and is why I have already invested my personal money and time to get this far. 

All of the perks we offer have been designed to inspire, and are customized to remind of the importance our fathers play in our lives. As letters to fathers which will be included in this book come in from all over the world, the excitement is building.  We are already receiving personal notes of gratitude for beginning this project, and have witnessed healing in relationships for some, and a renewed sense of celebration for others. 
Bottom line:  I am amazed, even now at the positive change this project is creating.  I see it expanding to untold numbers of people. 
 YOU can be part of this.  
YOUR support can be one of many sparks that creates a bright, powerful fire.

And, if contributing financially is not possible - no worries!  You CAN help by getting word to your friends and family.  This site makes it easy to share information.  Your contribution is valuable and appreciated by me - and everyone who will touch this book!

My intention is that every contributor benefit in a wonderful way and for The Father Letters book to bring hope and healing into many hearts.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Leo McKay Jr. I live in Truro, Nova Scotia, Canada, where I have been a writer and a high school teacher for eighteen years. My 2003 novel, Twenty-six, a fictionalized account of the Westray mine disaster, was a national best seller and in 2010 was chosen through CBC Radio’s Canada Reads as one of the 40 most important Canadian books of the preceding decade.  My short story collection, Like This, was a finalist for the Giller Prize in 1995. I’ve been a literary magazine editor and I’ve written many articles for publications such as The National Post, The Globe and Mail, and the Halifax Chronicle-Herald.

Roll Up the Rim, my new novel, is a comic tale of obsession, redemption, divine intervention, and Timbits. Posterity may or may not decide to call Roll Up the Rim The Great Canadian Novel. With its main character employed at Tim Horton’s and obsessed with rolling up the rim to win the prize car he must park his own rusted out Escort beside every morning, Roll Up the Rim is already, even before publication, The Great Canadian Tim Horton’s Novel.

This Indiegogo campaign is not just about the book, it is part of a larger story. By fundraising in this way to publish and promote my own creative work, I am one of the first Canadian literary writers with an established record in old school publishing to make the giant step in the direction of going Indie.

You can help make this happen.

Where the Money Goes

To make this publishing venture a success, I’m going to need about 8500 dollars in start-up money. The bulk of that total (about 6000 dollars) goes to pay for a professional editing of the manuscript and for a 1200 copy print run of the physical book. On top of these costs, I have to pay Steven Berry, the professional video artist who shot my campaign video, and Ben Brush, who has done artwork and graphic design. Both of these generous souls agreed to do work ahead with their payment contingent upon the success of this campaign.

I also have to pay for set-up costs of an online merchandizing store, for sundry small formatting issues involved with ebook production, for stationery and postage to mail out copies of the book, and for the production and mailout of promotional materials to advertize the book once it’s been produced.

What You Get

What you get in return for your contribution to the campaign depends on which level of perks you choose. At the very least, you get a signed copy of the book, and you get it a couple of weeks before it is available to others. You get the ebook if that is the format you prefer, and you get that in advance as well. You get original hand printed artwork by Ben Brush. You get a live Skype reading. You get me, the author, to appear in person for a private reading and discussion. You get your contribution recognized by having your name mentioned on the website. You get your name printed in the pages of the book. One ambitious contributor gets a whole page at the front of the book, under the title of Publisher.

The Roll Up the Rim Indiegogo campaign is called a Fixed Funding campaign. That means that I have 30 days to reach my financial goal. If I reach that goal in 30 days, I get all the money minus the 4% that goes to Indiegogo.com, and the project goes forward. If the goal does not get reached, 100% of the money gets refunded to contributors.

The Impact

The campaign for Roll Up the Rim is important for three reasons.

1. Reflecting the Culture This new novel is a comic take on a vital aspect of the culture of the Canadian East Coast. Roll Up the Rim is the first work of fiction in Canada to celebrate, explore, explode, and excoriate the weirdly central place that Tim Horton’s plays in the cultural life of this place.

Tim Horton’s plays as big a role in East Coast life as primary industry, celtic music, and the legacy of the Bluenose II, and Roll Up the Rim is the first novel soaking ringing drenched in Tim Horton’s. The main character works in Tim Horton’s and the Roll Up the Rim to Win contest plays a central role in the plot of the book.

2. Making an Artistic Statement On a personal level, this book is important to me because it is a comic work.  People who know me well are often puzzled by my first two books, telling me: “You’re such a silly, humour-oriented person, but your books are so serious.” I feel I’ve rectified that divide between serious and silly with this book.

3. Going Indie The final thing that makes this campaign stand out is that it marks my move from the established literary publishing world in Canada (my first book was published by one of the premier small presses in Canada, my second with THE prestige literary publisher) and signals my foray into the realm of being an Indie writer.

The music industry has been transformed through electronic media in the last 15 years, allowing artists to step creatively and entrepreneurially out on their own. This same shift, from massive, centralized vetting and distribution to smaller, de-centralized, independently managed artistic output is just beginning to arrive in the literary world.

I am the first literary writer I personally know of to take this step, but I will not be the last. So few people have done what I’m doing with this book that all of my role models, all of the people I’ve consulted with who’ve made similar moves, have been musicians.

Your support of this campaign will not only help me achieve my goal, it will help blaze a trail for those writers who follow me down this path. We’re at the absolute rock face with this project, and that feels exciting.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to the campaign with money, please, spread the word. Share the link to this page on Facebook. Tweet it on Twitter. Post it on your blog. Email your peeps. Talk to people. Online funding depends on networks of interconnected humans. Please help this campaign by bringing it to the attention of others who may be interested in helping.

There are tools at the bottom of this Indiegogo page to help make that easy.

story:
The video above is of my recent TED talk breaking down the complexities of gender.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

UPDATE: STRETCH GOALS

$5000 (REACHED): Everyone who backs $25 or more will get a bunch of Genderbread Person and other fun gender-related swag (stickers, buttons, etc.) with their book

$10,000: For every book (paperback or hardcover) pre-ordered I will send a free book to a high school counselor (backers can name the high schools); like TOMS One For One™ (but without any Trademarks™)

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


Hi, I'm Sam and I'm a social justice advocate & comedian & writer.

For the past few years I've been writing articles about LGBT concepts and creating queer-positive edugraphics on my website, It's Pronounced Metrosexual. Maybe you're familiar with this one:

Well, I wrote a book! It's a guide to gender, from a social justice perspective. It's a couple hundred pages of gender exploration, social justice how-tos, and fun graphics & comics. 

It offers clear, easily-digested, and practical explanations of one of the most commonly misunderstood things about people: gender.

It's not just about the trans* or transgender understanding of gender, though that is certainly a component. It's about gender itself, all-encompassingly, from a socially just and non-binary slant.

I wrote it with two goals in mind. I want to help individuals who read it better understand gender themselves (their gender and others') and I want to help those individuals help other people (who haven't read it) understand gender.

"Two in one? Are you freaking kidding me?! That's one heck of a book!" - you, I'm guessing

"Why are you crowdsourcing?"

A couple publishers reached out to me to publish this book. There was only one area where we couldn't come to an agreement: I was insistent upon offering a free version through my website and they were insistent that I don't.

It's incredibly important to me that I am able to offer a free electronic copy of this book. Access is one my key values as a social justice advocate, and I don't want even a small fee to stand in the way of someone getting this book and the education it provides.

What I am doing with the money raised

The $3200 raised (just under $3000 once Indiegogo takes their share) will allow me to afford the basic services to transform the manuscript into a book (design, layout, a final stage of copy editing), get it formatted for the e-book markets (iBooks, Amazon Kindle, Barnes and Noble, and downloadable .PDF), and make it available for sale online (electronically and print-on-demand) -- all of this, of course, in addition to fulfilling the perks y'all choose for backing the project.

Originally, I had a goal of $15K, which would have allowed me to work with an independent designer, independent printshop, provide free physical copies of the book to orgs in need, and to have a budget for marketing and publicity to extend the reach of the book.

It's still my goal to raise enough funds to do some marketing and publicity, but I set the bar lower to ensure that, at the very least, the book gets made, even if it's just in a limited fashion.

Using IndieGoGo is great for two reasons

One, I retain full creative control over the book. This means I can offer a free version on my site (and I will) and I can also continue allowing others to license my writing and graphics (like the Genderbread Person) for free.

Two, crowdsourcing will give me a sense of how much demand there is for a book like this. My goal is to make it a series. I'm already working on the second book, which will be about sexuality. If this project is successful, I'll have a push to finish that book and starting writing the others (about race, class, and religion).

"More books? But this one is already two! Will those four also be two in ones?! THAT'S SO MANY BOOKS IN BOOKS IN BOOKS IN BOOKS!" - you, appreciating math

"Tell us more about this book, good sir."

The book is broken up into four sections: Basic Training (introduction to core social justice concepts), Breaking Through the Binary (an in-depth exploration of gender diversity), Feminism & Gender Equity (a reconciliation of the main gender equity movement and the teachings of the book), and Social Justice Competence for Working Toward Gender Equity (practical, concrete how-to-type chapters surrounding gender issues and social justice interventions).

Some of the content from the book has appeared on my site, but is fully developed and expanded upon in the book. Each chapter has at least one comic-type graphic to illustrate or make light of a core point.

"Ha! The comics 'illustrate' the core points of the chapters? I see what you did there." - you, appreciating puns

"Let's talk more about these rewards."

One quick note: if there's not a reward there that you think should be there (e.g., bulk discounts on copies of the book), let me know. As long as it's reasonable. And not lewd. Lewd is not reasonable.

E-Book and Full Electronic Resources Package ($10 or more)

In addition to the book, I'm creating a ton of resources that will help facilitate conversations and social justice trainings about gender. This reward will be a .ZIP of all of those resources, and include printable formats of worksheets, lesson plans, workshop curricula, activities, discussion guides, and edugraphics.

This package is what will separate the book itself (free e-book or printed copies) from the additionally priced "trainer's packet" version once the book is published. It's a great snag for Kickstarter backers to get it for $10 with the e-book -- and one I'm happy to provide as a thanks.

Signed Paperback Copy ($25 or more)

Exactly what it sounds like: a signed and personalized (by yours truly) full-color paperback copy of the finished book.

Signed Hardcover Copy ($50 or more)

Just like the last one, only this one is a hardcover, which means I can sign it harder. 

Edugraphic Posters ($80 or more)

High-quality 11X17 prints of the edugraphics featured in the book (like the Genderbread Person), rolled and shipped to your doorstep. There's one new edugraphic I'm particularly excited about, and will not be publishing it on my site until well after these posters go out, allowing backers the first peek.

Genderbread Person T-Shirt ($100 or more)

I have a few designs for this much-requested shirt, but I'm going to keep them under wraps until the first person chooses this reward. That person will get the double reward of being able to choose which design gets printed.

Heartfelt Dedication ($500 or more)

I will have a page in the book, right up front, dedicated to you to show my appreciation for your appreciation.

Appear in the Book, in Comic Form ($1000 or more)

Each chapter has at least one comic-type graphic. How would you like to be immortalized as an adorable character in one of those comics? I pinky promise not to portray you as a bigot. 

Campus Visit ($2000 or more)

The thing that led to me writing this book was my show, It's Pronounced Metrosexual. It's a one-person comedy show about snap judgments, identity, and oppression -- but in a totally funny way. I've performed at schools all over the US, topraise from students and staff alike. 

If you support this project, I'll come to your campus (or organization/business) for a day. I can do my show, lead workshops/discussions, consult and provide feedback on campus initiatives or organizations -- really, the sky's the limit. And I'll do it for a comprehensive fee of $2000 (travel, lodging, etc., included).

Hug ($5000 or more)

I'll find you. And I'll hug you. I've been told I'm a million-dollar hugger, so you're welcome in advance.

 

Thanks for not eating me.

I appreciate you taking the time learn about this project. Of all the things I've created, I believe this book is the best. It's so much of what I've done, and what matters to me, all smashed into one thing.

I also want to take a moment to thank the team of 40 editors from whom I was fortunate enough to get feedback on the manuscript. The book wouldn't be what it is without them, and while I'll be thanking them again in the book proper, I wanted to take a moment here to say it again: you know who you are, and thank you so much thank you so much thank you so much thank you so much (X10)

Yours in peace, love, and gender equity,

sK

It's still my goal to raise enough funds to do some marketing and publicity, but I set the bar lower to ensure that, at the very least, the book gets made, even if it's just in a limited fashion.
Using IndieGoGo is great for two reasons
One, I retain full creative control over the book. This means I can offer a free version on my site (and I will) and I can also continue allowing others to license my writing and graphics (like the Genderbread Person) for free.
Two, crowdsourcing will give me a sense of how much demand there is for a book like this. My goal is to make it a series. I'm already working on the second book, which will be about sexuality. If this project is successful, I'll have a push to finish that book and starting writing the others (about race, class, and religion).
"More books? But this one is already two! Will those four also be two in ones?! THAT'S SO MANY BOOKS IN BOOKS IN BOOKS IN BOOKS!" - you, appreciating math

"Tell us more about this book, good sir."
The book is broken up into four sections: Basic Training (introduction to core social justice concepts), Breaking Through the Binary (an in-depth exploration of gender diversity), Feminism & Gender Equity (a reconciliation of the main gender equity movement and the teachings of the book), and Social Justice Competence for Working Toward Gender Equity (practical, concrete how-to-type chapters surrounding gender issues and social justice interventions).
Some of the content from the book has appeared on my site, but is fully developed and expanded upon in the book. Each chapter has at least one comic-type graphic to illustrate or make light of a core point.
"Ha! The comics 'illustrate' the core points of the chapters? I see what you did there." - you, appreciating puns

"Let's talk more about these rewards."
One quick note: if there's not a reward there that you think should be there (e.g., bulk discounts on copies of the book), let me know. As long as it's reasonable. And not lewd. Lewd is not reasonable.
E-Book and Full Electronic Resources Package ($10 or more)
In addition to the book, I'm creating a ton of resources that will help facilitate conversations and social justice trainings about gender. This reward will be a .ZIP of all of those resources, and include printable formats of worksheets, lesson plans, workshop curricula, activities, discussion guides, and edugraphics.
This package is what will separate the book itself (free e-book or printed copies) from the additionally priced "trainer's packet" version once the book is published. It's a great snag for Kickstarter backers to get it for $10 with the e-book -- and one I'm happy to provide as a thanks.
Signed Paperback Copy ($25 or more)
Exactly what it sounds like: a signed and personalized (by yours truly) full-color paperback copy of the finished book.
Signed Hardcover Copy ($50 or more)
Just like the last one, only this one is a hardcover, which means I can sign it harder. 
Edugraphic Posters ($80 or more)
High-quality 11X17 prints of the edugraphics featured in the book (like the Genderbread Person), rolled and shipped to your doorstep. There's one new edugraphic I'm particularly excited about, and will not be publishing it on my site until well after these posters go out, allowing backers the first peek.
Genderbread Person T-Shirt ($100 or more)
I have a few designs for this much-requested shirt, but I'm going to keep them under wraps until the first person chooses this reward. That person will get the double reward of being able to choose which design gets printed.
Heartfelt Dedication ($500 or more)
I will have a page in the book, right up front, dedicated to you to show my appreciation for your appreciation.
Appear in the Book, in Comic Form ($1000 or more)
Each chapter has at least one comic-type graphic. How would you like to be immortalized as an adorable character in one of those comics? I pinky promise not to portray you as a bigot. 
Campus Visit ($2000 or more)
The thing that led to me writing this book was my show, It's Pronounced Metrosexual. It's a one-person comedy show about snap judgments, identity, and oppression -- but in a totally funny way. I've performed at schools all over the US, topraise from students and staff alike. 
If you support this project, I'll come to your campus (or organization/business) for a day. I can do my show, lead workshops/discussions, consult and provide feedback on campus initiatives or organizations -- really, the sky's the limit. And I'll do it for a comprehensive fee of $2000 (travel, lodging, etc., included).
Hug ($5000 or more)
I'll find you. And I'll hug you. I've been told I'm a million-dollar hugger, so you're welcome in advance.
 

Thanks for not eating me.
I appreciate you taking the time learn about this project. Of all the things I've created, I believe this book is the best. It's so much of what I've done, and what matters to me, all smashed into one thing.
I also want to take a moment to thank the team of 40 editors from whom I was fortunate enough to get feedback on the manuscript. The book wouldn't be what it is without them, and while I'll be thanking them again in the book proper, I wanted to take a moment here to say it again: you know who you are, and thank you so much thank you so much thank you so much thank you so much (X10)
Yours in peace, love, and gender equity,
sK

story:
Support My Peace Corps Work . . .   And I'll Give You My Vintage BMW!

I’m soliciting donations so I can return to humanitarian aid work as a Peace Corps volunteer. Assignments last 27 months and I intend to complete at least two tours. I’ve already completed two one-year tours with WorldTeach (Marshall Islands, 2009-2011) and have already been accepted by the Peace Corps, receiving a nomination for service in Latin America. I had intended to come home and work for a year to raise money, but have not have been able to find sufficient work to support myself and raise the necessary funds, so I’m trying this to get back into the game . . .

Check out the perks, and, as an added bonus, I am going to give my baby to one donor!

If Yours Is the Winning Donation!
• I will deliver the car, fully tuned and detailed to you anywhere in the lower 48 states;
• I will sell the car (minimum price $1200.00) and forward the funds to you;
• I will place title in your name and donate the car to a charity of your choosing so you can claim the tax deduction ($1700.00 value)

How You Get Your Donation Ticket(s) and Winning Notification!
For each $20 donated, I will put a serialized ticket with your name and e-mail address in the pot. A scanned copy of your ticket(s) will be sent to your e-mail address. On the last day of the campaign I will draw one ticket, and post the winner on my Indiegogo campaign site, as well as notify the winner for delivery instructions.

About My Baby!
She is a 1982 BMW 528e. I am the second owner and have taken diligent care of all regular maintenance and repairs since purchasing her in 2001. Engine, transmission, suspension, tires, heat and a/c are all sound and well maintained. The body is in good shape; some minor corrosion and a few dings. A complete maintenance file has been kept. She would be a great “knock around” vehicle, first car for the kid or something a BMW aficionado would have a lot of fun restoring. Or, if you have no need of the car, she can be sold or donated to charity for considerably more than the price of a ticket.

How I Will Use the Funds!
• To provide any additional equipment or articles I will need for my next assignment (depends on where I get posted);
• Maintain the expenses of keeping “on the grid” in the US (PO Box, my US cell phone number, SKYPE, online fax, AAA card, etc);
• Supplement my food stipend to insure I remain healthy while in the field.
NO funds will be spent to support me in any way while I am in the US, or on leaves or vacations in the field.

Can’t Purchase a Ticket But Still Want To Help?
If you know me, and what I’ve done with WorldTeach, your endorsement to others that don’t know me is invaluable. Please spread the word to family, friends, co-workers . . . anyone that you think could benefit from this and wants to help another.

What Happens If I Don't Raise the Entire Subscription?
Even raising half of this amount will allow me to do at least one tour, but I am hoping that I will raise enough so that I can just keep getting reassigned to field work until I am too old. I'll figure out "what next" then. This is how I want to spend the rest of my life . . . and I'm good at it.

 Thank You!

story:
To buy the paperback book click here if you live in Ireland or the UK: http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/phantoms-dous...

 

Brian Lelas is a fiction author from Ireland, hoping to spread his unique stories throughout the world. This campaign is to fund his second collection of short stories. Before reading on, if you want to see some samples of Brian's work, you can visit his website and choose from The Canvas, Heartbroken or Inversion. http://brianlelas.com/short_stories.html

Here he presents a collection of short stories titled Phantoms Doused in Night. This collection features stories from a wide range of genres including literary fiction, science fiction, horror, fable and thriller. Here's what he has to say about the book...

Phantoms Doused in Night is a project that demanded its own existence. There was no plan to make this book happen, it just banged on the back of my brain and asked to be born. Sometimes as a writer, you get really bogged down in writing something big and daunting, that it takes years, (literally years) to finish it and even longer to find a way to get it out into the world. To survive those years, I take breaks from the main path and explore little forests, tunnels and – more often than not – darker places, in search of something to fuel the greater journey. This book is a collection of those little meanderings, but to my surprise, they have turned out to be a true journey of their own. Other travels continue, but this is the one that I would like to share now.

Eleven stories make up the collection that is Phantoms Doused in Night. Some were planned, some were not, one came in a dream and one wrote itself while I stared horrified at my fingers as they typed. When you read them, try to guess which one.

This collection is special to me for many reasons, but the main one is that I want to share these thoughts and words with the people who asked for more after my first book, Dead Cartography. A lot of people had some wonderful things to say about that set. I wanted to share another path, one for those who craved answers, and even moreso for those who begged for further questions.

Through the three years that these tales were born, I have been eagerly working to deliver something special to anyone ready to read it and I thank you for showing an interest so far. If you consider backing this little piece of my time and mind, I will be eternally grateful. If this is something of a success it will be a real asset to me when seeking out partners for future projects. If that can happen, it would be a dream come true.

Best wishes,

Brian Lelas

 

EDIT: The book has funded it's small print run already! Thank you all. The more funding that comes through, the more content the book will get and the more exposure it can receive through other media, so please, keep supporting! Thank you everyone!

If you want to have a read of some of Brian's short stories, you can visit his website and choose from The Canvas, Heartbroken or Inversion. http://brianlelas.com/short_stories.html

 

The Stories in this collection:

Quietus

Inversion

Riparian Crocus

Number 12C

The Grey Noon

Over a Fallen Hill

Dust

River Tears

Wind Lock

Thursday

Sleeping Notions

 

Stretch Goals! More Phantoms if the book exceeds its target goal.

Everyone who backs the book gets their name printed inside on a credits page if the funding goal is reached and anyone who wants to add a short message can do so too.

All of the photographs used in this campaign are by Frieda Freytag. Many of them are considerations for the final cover of the book. Some directly influenced stories that made it into the book. Special bookmarks of each of the images will be printed and added to every delivery from the Physical Phantoms level and up if the project exceeds €1000, which is double the target goal.

If there is a huge success and the project reaches €3000, Brian will write a new story that will bring the total stories up to 12, which will make it into every version of the book. This 12th story is not yet written and will be the first story completed since announcing the collection.

If the project somehow manages to reach €6000, which is a big ask, Brian has promised an entirely new collection of six stories to every backer for FREE upon completion in the next two years.

 

Why crowdfunding? Where does the money go?

Brian chose to crowdfund Phantoms Doused in Night for numerous reasons. The first and most obvious reason was for an easier way to get the book out there without looking for a traditional publisher. To do that, some money is needed for printing costs (with a top quality printing partner), an ISBN to get the book international saleability and if we're all lucky, to buy his son some sweets when it's all done. The other reason was to see if this was a viable and successful way to go forward for other projects that he is actively completing and editing in the long term, plus a way to demonstrate that there are people looking for good, original writing. Any money that is somehow made as a result of this campaign will go directly into setting up the next campaign and also adding any possible extra goodies to the shipments being sent to everyone who makes it possible, like stretch goals and little bonuses.

 

Thank you for visiting the page! Now pick a level and back the book!

story:
Our project:

We provide free weekly media workshops in the Bay Area and reservations around the country, where we train Indigenous youth how to create and publish a full-color magazine, Seventh Native American Generation (SNAG), which includes a compilation CD featuring Native music. We teach youth how to write, create art, take photographs, report and interview and do layout/design. Through our program, youth express themselves, and share their thoughts with the world!
 
For our latest issue, "Fears and Dreams," SNAG staff held workshops with Native American youth from Chemawa High School in Salem, Oregon; with Northwest Youth Conference participants in Omak, Washington; and with Bay Area youth. We explored what they fear, and what they dream of. We also feature in this issue youth interviews with Native artists and leaders, an article on the SNAG bio-diesel powered shuttle bus, a "how to" guide to organizing, and as always, beautiful art!
 
READ ONLINE THE ISSUE WE ARE FUNDRAISING TO PRINT HERE:
http://issuu.com/snagmagazine/docs/snag_issue_8_finaledit?mode=window&backgroundColor=%23222222

Donations:

Our goal is to print around 2,000 full-color issues of SNAG, which we provide free to youth and ask for donation amounts from others (all donations enable us to continue providing free workshops to youth). All donations received here will go to printing the magazine and CD compilation that is included in the issue.

In the past we have relied on small grants to pay for the printing of our issues, but funding has dried up for print media. We need your help to get our magazine to rural reservations and Native communities throughout Indian Country.

If you're unable to donate, help us by spreading the word online share this page on Facebook and Twitter. Thank you.

story:
A word from the Editor:

Hi, my name is Tara Frauendienst and I am what you might call a freelance copyeditor.  I am a stay at home mom of a 19 month old boy, and I have to make time to edit, but it’s worth it for the reader to be able to clearly understand what the author meant.  I have been working with Zoe E. Whitten on her latest book series, Peter the Wolf, to get each book ready for public view. In fact, I was a customer of the first book, and noticed mistakes her previous editor had missed, and sent them to her out of the kindness of my heart, not really expecting anything in return.  Zoe is a fabulous author and it was a pleasure to edit for her.  Zoe is being very generous by donating copies of her latest book as well as the others in the series and her bestsellers to help raise funds for me. 

And now a word from the author:

Hi, I’m Zoe E. Whitten, author of the Peter the Wolf series. I’m putting together a funding drive for the third book in the series, Roll the Bones, which is already completed and was edited by the lovely Tara Frauendienst. She edited the first two books for a percentage of the sales, which hasn’t been nearly enough for all the work she did, in my opinion. So this funding drive is all for Tara, and regardless of the amount collected, I won’t make a dime off of this funding drive. All proceeds will go to Tara, who could use the money for bills, groceries, and to help clothe her baby boy, who is no doubt growing out of clothes quickly.

But what’s in it for you?

Anyone who donates $5 will get a free ebook copy of Roll the Bones in their choice of PDF, Mobi, or ePub as soon as the final draft is done. This should not take long, as I already have paid for the cover image, and I already have Tara’s editing notes to work through. All people who donate will also get their names listed in the back of the book, AND a copy of Blind Rage.

For $10 readers will also receive a copy of Dogs of War in their preferred format, AND a copy of Blind Rage.

For $15 you will receive a copy of Peter the Wolf, Dogs of War, Roll the Bones, Blind Rage, and Sandy Morrision and the Pack of Pussies.

Finally, for those brave souls willing to donate $25, you’ll get all three books, Blind Rage, Sandy Morrison and the Pack of Pussies, plus copies of The Campaign Trilogy and the spin-off, A Perfectly Empty Vessel. The Campaign Trilogy has been my most popular works to date, and A Perfectly Empty Vessel follows Wendy Stoffel, “Hunter of serial killers,” to solve a new case in Sin City. And you can get all four books in your chosen format for your generous donation to my editor.


But what are you signing up for in this third book? Well I’ll go ahead and warn you that this blurb spoils the first two books. I’ve spent a long time trying to think how to blurb a third book in a series without giving something away from the first two books, and this one...it’s just about impossible. So, if you would prefer to just read the blurb for book one, look here: http://zoewhitten.com/2011/06/24/introducing-pe.... And if that makes you curious to see the blurb for book 2, look here: http://zoewhitten.com/2012/02/27/dogs-of-war-no....

Spoiler warning’s out of the way, so here goes:

Peter Holmes, an eighteen-year-old lycanthrope and former cheerleader and gymnast, has agreed to kill a vampire for the harpy who had been keeping his sister as a slave for five years of brutal torture. Peter will do anything to keep the harpy from taking his sister back, but he isn’t clear on who his real target is. The harpy doesn’t make matters easier with the head games she’s playing to feed off of his pain, both physical and emotional.

After arriving at his destination, the harpy pits Peter against a “training target,” and he loses against the diminutive Cassandra, leading to more punishment from the harpy. If Peter can’t even beat a tiny child vampire, an abomination among her own people, what hope does he have in killing his real target? An ambush from the adult vampires confirms his worst fears, and Peter is almost killed by their brutal torture.

He barely survives, but with time to heal, a lot of training from a witch, and some major favors from his allies in the FBI, Peter may pull off the most surprising role of his budding acting career. That is, if the other vampires buy into his act and let him live, of course.

For $10 readers will also receive a copy of Dogs of War in their preferred format, AND a copy of Blind Rage. 
For $15 you will receive a copy of Peter the Wolf, Dogs of War, Roll the Bones, Blind Rage, and Sandy Morrision and the Pack of Pussies.
Finally, for those brave souls willing to donate $25, you’ll get all three books, Blind Rage, Sandy Morrison and the Pack of Pussies, plus copies of The Campaign Trilogy and the spin-off, A Perfectly Empty Vessel. The Campaign Trilogy has been my most popular works to date, and A Perfectly Empty Vessel follows Wendy Stoffel, “Hunter of serial killers,” to solve a new case in Sin City. And you can get all four books in your chosen format for your generous donation to my editor.
 But what are you signing up for in this third book? Well I’ll go ahead and warn you that this blurb spoils the first two books. I’ve spent a long time trying to think how to blurb a third book in a series without giving something away from the first two books, and this one...it’s just about impossible. So, if you would prefer to just read the blurb for book one, look here: http://zoewhitten.com/2011/06/24/introducing-pe.... And if that makes you curious to see the blurb for book 2, look here: http://zoewhitten.com/2012/02/27/dogs-of-war-no....Spoiler warning’s out of the way, so here goes: Peter Holmes, an eighteen-year-old lycanthrope and former cheerleader and gymnast, has agreed to kill a vampire for the harpy who had been keeping his sister as a slave for five years of brutal torture. Peter will do anything to keep the harpy from taking his sister back, but he isn’t clear on who his real target is. The harpy doesn’t make matters easier with the head games she’s playing to feed off of his pain, both physical and emotional. After arriving at his destination, the harpy pits Peter against a “training target,” and he loses against the diminutive Cassandra, leading to more punishment from the harpy. If Peter can’t even beat a tiny child vampire, an abomination among her own people, what hope does he have in killing his real target? An ambush from the adult vampires confirms his worst fears, and Peter is almost killed by their brutal torture. He barely survives, but with time to heal, a lot of training from a witch, and some major favors from his allies in the FBI, Peter may pull off the most surprising role of his budding acting career. That is, if the other vampires buy into his act and let him live, of course.

story:
Previews

Preview before you order! Selections from the Summer 2012 issue are now available online: 

"I will contract a flesh-eating virus. It will devour an inch of me a day, starting with my big toe. I will be dead by Autumn 2014." - First Up by Aliya Whiteley

The third day he brought up his brother’s pit bulls and pulled out a photo of two of them. “That’s Rosa—he breeds her. The other one is Elvira. She was a great fighter, but someone stole her.” - The Summer Mr H Drove Alex Santillanas Around by Jen Conley

"Olson fired another six rounds into Mercer, who just threw back his head and laughed. Olson started crying then, calling on the name of the Lord, beseeching all of Heaven to intervene. 'Why won’t you die?'" - Mercer's Ghost by Milo James Fowler

"Anechka pressed the steering collar of the Uvlechenie toward the floor while leaning back in the seat. The Uvlechenie settled onto the asteroid, (650) 2003 RKN, just the way she liked it, slowing the rotation and leaving the valuable dust mostly unshaken. It was the only gentle thing she knew how to do." - Uvlechenie by DeAnna Knippling

About Big Pulp

We're carving out a corner of the publishing world where story matters and writers get paid for their work. Got 5 bucks? You can help us out in a big way. 

Since 2008, Big Pulp has published some of the best genre fiction writers from around the world. Our zine is a modern - and somewhat condensed - version of the classic corner newsstand, where writers and readers could find pulp and popular fiction of all kinds - science fiction, adventure stories, horror, fantasy, jungle tales, mystery and true crime, romance, and super-hero sagas. We pride ourselves on offering the best of everything from all over the world. 

Big Pulp has published long-time writers and award-winners, as well as new and emerging authors. Some of our writers have published hundreds of stories or poems, but many have received their first writing credit - and first payment - from Big Pulp. We choose writing based on the story, not the byline. 

Big Pulp began publishing fiction and poetry online - completely free to readers - in March 2008. In December 2010, we launched a print version of the site, while continuing to publish work online, accessible to anyone with a computer. 

The Impact

Some of Big Pulp's funding comes from donations and advertising, but sales of our electronic and print editions are our lifeline. Without sales, we would no longer be able to pay our writers. 

We strongly believe that writers deserve to be paid for their work. We also believe that offering payment significantly increases the quality of work that is submitted to us for publication on our site and in the magazine. 

Even a few dollars means we continue to publish, writers continue to get paid, and our readers continue to have free online access to tens of thousands of words of great fiction and poetry.

What We Need & What You Get

$500 buys a lot for a small press magazine. That amount would fund our first print run for the issue. Or it would pay 100% of our contributor payments for the issue. 

All our editorial work - site maintenance, editing and proofreading, sales & events - is done pro bono. Every dollar raised through the campaign will go back into running the site and paying contributors. No exceptions. 

We're not asking for you to give something for nothing. Every bit of funding - at every level - is a purchase of one or more editions of Big Pulp, and other goodies! 

50 copies will pay 100% of our contributor costs. We know we can find 50 readers! 

No $$$? No problem! 

We know that not everyone has dough to throw around to keep someone else's dream going. We've been there. But, it doesn't cost a dime to help spread the word! 

Can you help us find 50 new readers? Tell your friends! 

If you're a writer and want to help keep a paying market in print - tell your friends! 

If you're a fan of smart genre fiction and want to continue reading great fiction and poetry online for free - tell your friends! 

The sharing tools make it easy to help spread the word through e-mail, Facebook, Twitter or your own web site. 

Tell your friends!

story:
So Basically...

The Kurosawa Project is a multi-media, multi-platform textbook/educational resource exploring the interconnectedness of Japanese cinema, culture and history, through the films of Akira Kurosawa.


The Project aims to tackle this goal while investigating alternative ways of presenting educational materials to young learners with new modes of processing information.


And More Pointedly...

The Kurosawa Project aims to introduce a new generation of students and the general public to the films of Akira Kurosawa, while extensively contextualizing them with discussions of Japanese history, culture, society, film criticism and the interconnectedness thereof.


The majority of existing resources on Kurosawa focus predominantly on the director's films as objects in and of themselves, examining their technical merits, narrative devices and place in film history. The Kurosawa Project focuses instead on the intense and fascinating connection between Kurosawa's films and Japanese history and culture.


Kurosawa directly engaged his society and its complex themes and issues. He made films for the masses with the purpose of entertaining and engaging his countrymen, with underlying themes and ideas available for intellectual analysis and interpretation.


Unfortunately, the majority of resources available regarding Kurosawa and his works emphasize the complexity of his films while downplaying in large measure their mass appeal. The Kurosawa Project aims to show readers and learners that Japanese films are not as complicated as scholars make them out to be; they are the perfect documents through which to explore the rich and complex culture and history of Japanese society.


What We'll Do With Your Money...

The money raised by The Kurosawa Project will go toward the development and creation of the website.


As of now, the template for the site consists of a simple, free Word Press format. As the Project collects funds through IndieGoGo, we'll purchase interactive, complex formats for the site, capable of hosting elements such as podcasts and film commentaries, while developing a forum and other site features.


What's more, The Project aims to create a smart phone app for the materials posted on the site, and, in the long term, a digital edition of the book portion of the project for the iPad and readers like the Kindle.


Money will also go into the purchase of materials necessary for the project, including some out-of-print and rare research materials on Japanese history and film and improved equipment/software for creating the podcasts and videos for the Kurosawa Project website.


Are Donations Tax Deductible?

Unfortunately, no.


The Kurosawa Project does not have 501(c)(3) status and cannot offer this. Sorry.


What's The Schedule For The Project?

If everything goes according to plan, The Kurosawa Project will launch in earnest in late November 2011.


When the Project launches "in earnest," we'll begin posting videos and podcasts every week, along with discussion questions for each Kurosawa movie and experts from the textbook portion of the project.

What's Up With the Audio Commentaries?

The audio commentaries will be recorded as podcasts and made available for free, unlimited streaming and downloading from The Kurosawa Project website.


During the commentary, we'll tell you exactly when to start the film so the commentary track cues up with your DVD/VHS/Blu-Ray.


I Disagree With Some Information Presented In Your Podcast And Video

The podcast, video and sample chapter currently available on the project website are rough drafts. When the Project launches in earnest, we'll redo both the video and podcast, tweaking them for accuracy and quality.


That said, thanks for keeping us on our toes. Feel free to email thekurosawaproject@gmail.com with any serious concerns.

Why Are You Qualified To Do This?

I'm glad you asked.


I hold a degree in Art History and Japanese Language and Literature from the University of Massachusetts, Amherst. As an undergraduate, I spent a year studying Japanese art, photography, film, language and society at Jochi Daigaku/Sophia University, in Tokyo. This year was partially funded by a grant from the Freeman Foundation.


In the spring of 2005, I ran a Japanese Club at the Amherst Middle School. Each week, students and I explored ways of understanding and interpreting Japanese culture and society through manga, anime, videogames and cultural objects like toys and even candy.


Upon leaving Amherst for New York City, I volunteered at Japan Society film screenings, during which time I saw a number of classic, popular, obscure and avant-garde Japanese films while engaging with Japan Society employees, fellow volunteers and audience members.


For the past 18 months, I've worked as a fulltime professional freelance writer, covering topics from Japan (its art, history, economy and the recent earthquake and tsunami) to music, film, television, history, soccer and even biology, botany and business.


What's more, I write almost exclusively for websites. This experience has allowed me to intimately familiarize myself with ever-evolving modes of presenting and consuming information, particularly for younger generations than my own.


My knowledge of Japan and extensive history studying its culture, combined with my experience as a web writer, makes me well suited to tackling a project of this nature.

Don't Forget to Spread the Word!

Please share The Kurosawa Project with anyone you might know who has an interest in Japanese language, literature, culture, history or Japan in general. You can use the "share" function on this page to do.


If you're a student of Japanese, spread the word amongst your classmates!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Michelle Brumley. I've dreamed of writing dark fantasy and science fiction since I was a child. Until recently, writing was always a dream in the corner of my vision. When I finished my novel Earth Borne, I decided I wanted to use it to break in to the publishing world. To make my dreams a reality. And I need your help.

After I finished my first draft, I realized that I needed to realistically approach the next step: I needed an editor. I discovered quickly that writing a novel may not be the hardest part of my dream. I was writing my dream, writing characters and a story that I loved. I wanted to share it with the world - only to find that hiring professional help to make that dream a reality - was unrealistic. I work a full time job that pays enough to cover my bills (sometimes not even that), and suddenly I found myself facing a reality I'd never considered: paying to have my manuscript edited. It's the first step towards actually publishing a book, the first step towards being able to call myself a "writer" and not just an "aspiring writer."

What We Need & What You Get

Here is exactly what I'm looking for:

  • Raise enough money to hire a professional editor to provide proofreading, copy editing for grammar, punctuation, spelling and consistency. If I reach my goal I will be able to have the editor provide services for story development as well.

 

  • What you get for your money ($10 or more): See your name in print! As a contributor, you'll get your name in the front part of the book listed as "Earth Borne is made possible by..." This page will be titled Contributor Page.
  • If you donate $20 or more: For $20 and your shipping address, I'll send you a series of 4x6 art prints inspired by Earth Borne. These will be printed on photo paper, using images and artwork created while writing the story and during the campaign itself. I'll transpose text directly from the story. If you have a favorite passage, character or line - I'll custom make the images for you. This contribution will get you 4 prints. This perk will also include the "thank you" postcard of $15!


 

  • If you donate $50 or more: I'll list your name in the Contributor Page, as well as make you a character in the story! We'll have to discuss the details, of course. And, most likely, you'd be a victim in the story... It is dark science fiction, after all! 

  • If you donate $100 or more: I'll list your name in the Contributor page in bold, you'll have a character in the story... and I'll send you a digital edited edition of Earth Borne for free (in .pdf, .epup, .mobi or .doc format). This won't be the final version, but it will be the first professionally edited version.

  • If I don't reach my entire goal, I can still have the novel edited. It won't be as substantial, but it will still be one more step towards my dream - and I'm thankful for that.

  • If I surpass my goal - the money will go to the editor to provide better services for Earth Borne.

The Impact

Your contribution will make my story a reality. It will go from being a manuscript that I wrote for National Novel Writing Month, to a fully edited and quality manuscript. That's where the real work begins for me; the re-writing process that will eventually be turned in to the finished product.

To give you an idea of how substantial the costs of editing are: the editors I have approached generally charge $0.01 per word to be edited (and that's just editing for spelling and grammar, this isn't even considering developmental work). My story Earth Borne is 47,000 words as a first draft. If I paid the asking price, I'd be paying $470 for basic services.

  • You'll help me with the first step in the publication process: the professional evaluation of my manuscript, where I'll receive meaningful feedback and assistance to take the first draft to the next level.

  • This is a step I won't be able to take without your financial assistance.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone can contribute financially (I am often one of those people!). However, there are other ways you can help make Earth Borne a success:

  • Read the story! Then, if you like it - and want to see it closer to publication, tell your friends!
  • Help me get the word out! Share this project to Facebook and Twitter.
  • Indiegogo has handy "share tools" available to help you!

So, what's the story about?

Earth Borne is a dark science fiction story written for National Novel Writing Month in November 2012.

Meghan is a young woman growing up in the sleepy town of Maple Falls. She's the daughter of one of the richest and most influential men in town, Doctor Konrad Lacroix. Konrad owns ISIS Laboratories - a Biochemical research facility just outside of town.

When a strange explosion rocks the ISIS facility one morning, Meghan's world is changed forever. Her life begins to spiral out of control as she receives a mysterious package from a long dead relative that threatens everything she thought she knew about her father.

Then, the Earth Borne appear.

Meghan may be the key to stopping the mysterious Earth Borne - but will she survive long enough to save the town of Maple Falls? Will she discover the truth about her father?

Read on!

http://www.TheEbonyChronicles.Wordpress.com

story:
The Project

Kalua pig and cabbage, teriyaki chicken, laulau, SPAM musubi.  For as long as I can remember, food has been an integral part of my identity and how I see the world.  The first 20+ years of my life were spent on tropical islands.  My name is Danielle Ceribo, and I grew up on Guam and then lived on Oahu, Hawai'i.  I recently earned my master's degree in Gastronomy studying the connection between food and culture.  I wrote my master's thesis on how Guam's history of colonialism and globalization have affected its foodways, which was the first time anyone had written about it.  Most of my research was interview-based, as it was extremely important to me to provide a platform for the people of Guam's voice to be heard, which had been ignored and silenced in the past. 

This past September, I was offered this amazing opportunity to write about a topic that has not had very much in-depth research on: the plate lunch.  I will be conducting research on how the plate lunch came to be such an important part of local dining culture, what kinds of foods are included in the plate lunch and why, as well as who are the ones that eat the plate lunch, and where plate lunches are sold.  Though it has been written about countlessly in newspaper articles both on the island and in the mainland US, this will be the first book dedicated solely to the topic.  The plate lunch is tied to Hawai'i's history and culture, and I am excited to be able to share this with locals, visitors, scholars, and anyone interested in learning more about what makes plate lunches so delicious and how they came about.

It is crucial to convey our own histories from our own perspectives.  That is why, in order to produce a project that is grounded in the history, culture, and voice of the locals of Hawai'i, I feel it is necessary to do fieldwork in the place itself as opposed to relying on secondary sources.  I will be on Oahu for approximately 2-3 months gathering as much data as possible, then I will return home to write. 

Your contribution will help make this project a reality.  Otherwise I would not financially be able to complete the quality of work it deserves.

What I Need & What You Get

Luckily, I already have a publisher that will pay any and all publishing/marketing expenses.  What I need is help doing the actual research, which roughly includes:

  • Airfare from Boston (where I live) to Honolulu
  • Living expenses in Honolulu to include food (for research, of course, and personal sustenance) and gas (it's Hawai'i)
  • Personal expenses, since being in Hawai'i for only 2-3 months will make it difficult for me to find employment, though I will do what I can when I am there

You can donate from the approximate cost of one plate lunch ($5.00 for a "mini") to the cost of the plane ticket ($650).

Other Ways You Can Help

You can make donations to my PayPal account (dceribo@gmail.com).  

If you are unable to contribute, please forward this campaign to your friends, families, and networks (you can do so by using the Indiegogo share tools!).

story:
Hello boils and ghouls, and horror fans the world over! It is my great pleasure to unveil to you my newest passion project, Something Good to Eat, a Halloween-themed anthology bringing together fifteen tales from some of the genres's most dynamic voices, both established and new. Featuring tales of witches, monsters, demonic possession, ghosts, ghoulies and assorted terrifying beasties, Something Good to Eat aims to scare the socks off the reader in the grand ol' tradition of E.C. Comics, Twilight Zone, Night Gallery, among other anthologies, but with as much of a comtemporary flair as possible. It's the sort of book to read curled up in a big comfy chair, on a dark and cold October night...with the doors firmly and sensibly locked, of course. 

I am a writer, editor and die hard genre fan developing a publishing venture that aims to showcase the voices and talents that often get overlooked by the big players in the field. As an avid consumer and fan, it is my goal to help keep the powerful and vital medium of the short story alive and kicking well into the 21st Century...and beyond. My own short stories have appeared in anthologies from Castrum Press, Phantasmagoria, and The Weirdbook, and I have been an Arts and Entertainment editor on my local newspaper for the past five years. I am a passionate about what I do and equally passionate about the fine work being done by other writers the world over. 

From the official synopsis:

Halloween: a night when the dead roam freely among the unsuspecting living; when the boundary between reality and fantasy, between this world and the next, is as thin as paper mache; when monsters both human and daemonic stalk the shadows, seeking easy prey…

All Hallow’s Eve: a night to hide behind your best mask, lock your doors, and keep your Jack-o’-lantern burning till dawn. Because Something is knocking at the door, boys and girls…

And it’s hungry.

DEMON’S DREAMING PRESS PRESENTS: SOMETHING GOOD TO EAT

 

What We Ghouls Need & What You Monsters Get

  • My goal as far as this crowd-funding endevour goes is to raise $4,500. This figure goes to paying some of the writers, hiring an assistant editor, and paying for further cover design and interior layout. Seeing as this is my fledgling press' first anthology, it is important to me (and to readers) that the guts of the anthology look as immaculate and professional as possible. Far too often do you read self-published or small press book releases that simply do not look like any care was put into them. I am hoping to avoid this at all costs. 
  • Those of you generous witches and demons who donate $100 or more shall receive a copy of the anthology, a t-shirt featuring the ghoulishly delightful cover art, and a poster-sized print of a "variant" cover, illustrated by comic book artist and certified madman Trevor Markwart.
  • If the full goal is not reached, what contributions have been made will go to paying the writers, and all contributors will receive a copy of the book. 

The Legacy of Fear

  • Your contribution will see to it that a lot of great and underrated writers will have their work showcased in a lovingly crafted anthology.

How to spread the terror:

  • If you can't contribute, no sweat! Any social media awareness you can help generate for the anthology would be greatly appreciated.
  • Don't forget to use those Indiegogo share tools!
