story_txt:
Welcome to our table!
We are a mother daughter duo that has created a cookbook that we are both truly proud of. My name is Harriet and I have written and tested every recipe that will be in this book. Some of these recipes have been passed down from my mother and others are recipes that my daughter, Chantel, and I have created. It's all about being simplistic. We have faced several challenges over the years, so simplicity is what we and many others truly need when it comes to getting into the kitchen.

What We Need & What You Get
The cookbook manuscript is complete!
Our funding goal of $2,500.00 will cover the expense of printing the first batch of hardcover cookbooks and give first dibs to our backers.
Check out these perks!
All backers will be listed in the "Special Thank-You" section of the book.  Every dollar counts! There are worthy perks for each contribution level from a digital PDF of the cookbook itself to signed copies and an apron to motivate you to get into the kitchen with the ones you love.
All perks will be delivered between the end of July and mid August 2019.

The Impact
By contributing to our campaign, you would not only be getting a great cookbook, you would also be investing in a life long dream and reminding others that dreams are still worth chasing.
Other Ways You Can Help
If our story touches you, share it and encourage others to contribute to help us reach our goals. 
Thank you in advance to everyone!

story:
Soon, we will bring you back to an authentic travel to start 2021 on a positive vibe.

Wish to travel differently?

Go to local spots?

Open your eyes like you had never before?

When you travel somewhere, what do you do: you buy a Lonely planet/guide du routard or type ‘’ Must do’’ in google.

My name is Claire. 10 years ago, I moved to Jakarta and built a new life here. Through the years, I became the Go to Girl, sharing my favorite places and magic spots to enjoy Jakarta. The big Durian became my second home. Amazed by the beauty of this country of its people. I wanted to share at larger scale all my local addresses to whoever came to visit my town. My motto was: stop acting like a tourist, discover the city driven by a local point of view: here was born my POP MY DAY project.

POP MY DAY is an illustrated map where is gathered 150 favorites spots to live like a local in a touristic destination.

Today 3 maps have been created: Jakarta, Bali and Ubud.

My entrepreneurial passion doesn’t stop here: I want to develop Yogyakarta and go even further to create partnership with friends around the world.

Today, I launch this crowdfunding to realize the map of Yogyakarta, prepared with passion with my good local friend Gram, a magnificent and creative Yogyakarta man. Through this new map, you will discover Yogyajakarta treasures such as the Gamelan, its nature, wonderful entreprises and cafes and so much more, I'm telling you!

 

A different way to travel LOCAL, UNIQUE AND AUTHENTIC to discover and rediscover Yogyajakarta with opened eyes.

 

What we need for the crowdfunding to realize our map?

  • 500 euros for our lovely illustrator Clementine
  • 2,000 euros for the papers and printing
  • 200 euros for the video
  • 150 euros for the gifts and shipping
  • 150 euros for the 5% Indiegogo fee of the plateform

A total of 3,000 euros needed to make our Yogyajakarta map happened!

 

The Impact

Thank to your contribution, it will allow me to get back on my feet and continue PoP My Day adventure. 2020 has been a challenging year and we are ready now to kick some Ass and get back to travel for 2021 with an extraordinary team of PoP People looking to travel soon enough!

 

Thank you so much for your support or should I say Terimah Kasih Banyak ;)

A PoP Girl in the city,

Claire.

story:
Cover Photo of "Birth As You Please" Graphic Design - Emma Clavijo

 

MODERNITY AND ITS EFFECTS ON BIRTH GIVING PRACTICES: How is modernity changing our birth giving options and choices? Can obstetric practices coexist and collaborate with midwifery and ancestral practices? Women, birthing people, in many cases face obstetric violence and are victims of claims that diminish their will and inner wisdom of giving birth the way they choose.

"To facilitate this better communication and women-centred care, the best recommendation in the new WHO guidance is the collaborative midwifery-obstetrician model whereby care is provided primarily by midwives. The Lancet Series shows midwifery care to be associated with more vaginal births, safer outcomes, positive maternal experiences, and lower costs, and an accompanying Comment clearly supports the role of midwives in reducing caesarean section use."  The Lancet Journal

 

How, where, when and with whom our female ancestors gave birth and are there ancestral birth giving practices still alive around the world? One of my  main concerns around  the dehumanization of birth giving, is the C-section rates that are raising exponentially globally having a negative effect on the overall health of humanity.

"In the USA, 20 years ago the C-section rate was 18%, now it's 32%. So the question is what drove that increase? Do all these women need it? In some communities in Sweden the C-section rate is only 5%. But in others parts of the world, it's 50%"  Quote from the Book, Your Baby's Microbiome.

“I believe that the human oxytocin system - oxytocin being the hormone of love, fundamental to birth and bonding, even in adulthood - is growing weaker. The future of the human capacity to give birth is at risk,” Michel Odent said in a contribution to Antonella Gambotto-Burk's new book, Mama: Love, Motherhood and Revolution. 

 

MY GRAIN OF SAND 

My intention to write the book, “Birth as You Please”,  is to create a reference point where twenty one mothers from around the world can connect through their individual birth stories in a creative manner and be inspired to become agents of paradigm change in the way they birth their children, in their own individual cultural, social contexts, remembering and reclaiming the right to birth as they please, safely and respected.

Women will learn from how other women carry their babies in the womb and how they give birth to them? What if in Bolivia, China or India, Canada they share the same “threat” of the C-section epidemic? And what if birthing with midwives, vaginally and naturally free of epidurals and antibiotics, is a conscious act to rescue the wisdom of our ancestors and to give the best possible entry of our babies to life.

When I was pregnant it was the birth stories I read at Ina May's Gaskin Book "Guide to Childbirth" that  inspired me to the decision to give a non medicated vaginal birth with a midwife, at Toronto birth center. I believe and trust the empowering effect of storytelling. The book "Birth As You Please"  is my intention to inspire soon to be mothers to ask more questions on how, where, when and with whom they birth their children and revive some of the ancestral birth giving practices.

WHERE AM I NOW?     

I am now In La Paz, Bolivia with my family, connecting with women and their birth stories. I am gradually finding my way to traditional birthing experiences at rural areas, as well as collecting birthing testimonies from urban women who are experiencing  C-section as their sole birthing choice.

 

FUTURE VISION: My objective in the long run is to publish the Book "Birth As You Please" in all the  countries and languages where the twenty one women will share their birth stories from, so that an international dialogue can take place on what does it really mean to "Birth As You Please".

I am also planning to hold various exhibitions of the twenty one pregnancy portraits I will be creating for the book, advocating for humanizing birth practices and rescuing ancestral wisdom.

 

 

                                                                                                                                 

 

TIMELINE AND FINANCIAL PROJECTIONS

1. Once the crowdfunding campaign is completed, I will be traveling to meet in person the women who will participate for the creation of the book, "Birth As You Please". The countries I will be visiting to record the birth stories depends on the crowdfunding amount reached.  In the box above you can have a look and idea at the financial projections and the corresponding countries.                                                        

* In the case where less than 5.000$ will be collected, then a presentation of Birth Art and Birth stories will be created at a leaflet format, where the number of portraits and birth stories will be reduced to only 5.

2. Once I have collected the twenty birth stories from a diverse group of women, the creative process of painting the pregnancy portraits will take place .

3.Once the pregnancy portraits are ready, then I will be editing the birth stories and translating them in English and Spanish.

4. The book "Birth As You Please", will be ready around February 2020. It will be printed in English and Spanish in La Paz, Bolivia at the printing company, Inventa Imprenta.

     
     
     
     
     

"BIRTH AS YOU PLEASE" TEAM           

I am very honored and lucky that I have been counting on the advice and guidance of four very insightful and talented women.

As Karine wisely said "We are the forces that mold the creative energy of "Birth As You Please""

 

Karine Ancellin on upper right corner, advises me in the story telling and creative content; an American writer and founder of A Poet's Agora, https://apoetsagora.com/, who is constantly traveling around the world and lives in Athens.

Sakeena Adamjee on bottom right corner, is a Londoner living in Granada, a flamenco dancer and  coach who supports me in the creative content.

Dimitra Tzigianni on upper left corner, is a start up coach, a Greek who lives in London and she supports with marketing and financials.

Jordan Clarke on bottom left corner, is a painter and fine art jeweler who lives in Toronto, who is gifting me with her wise creative content insight and advises me while the creation of the pregnancy portraits.  You can acquire her amazing jewellery creations at https://www.etsy.com/shop/Enarmoured

 

SPONSORS

 

Many thanks and deep appreciation for participating in the video and believing in this project since its conception to Natalie Roope Jull, Vera Kevic, Paulina Amalki Tekuna, Alex James, Paula and Ana Maria Centellas. Forever grateful to Jes Bailey, Eirini Moschaki, Abby Barclay, Dimitris Parousis, and Kulsum Merchant for their encouraging insight.

Deep appreciation and love to my supportive partner Vladimir Ilich Lopez Flores and our little son Iasonas Simon, the spark and flame of my inspiration.

                      

                                                                                                @Toronto Birth Center

story:
Short Summary

Editors Natasha Brandt and Nola Altemus are Oakland Natives with a passion for the environment and feminism. Wild Zine started as a school project and turned into so much more. Through publishing 2 issues we've met amazing women, artists and creators that help make Wild what it is. With this campaign we hope to take wild to the next level, with amazing merch, and events that help us cultivate a community of amazing women.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $500 to help keep Wild Zine alive

  • $100 to fund a website (created by Bad Ass female Negar Shafei)
  • $200 to print issue 3 (we think its our best yet)
  • $200 to make merch and host community events to bring Wild to the next level!

You get tons of cool stuff! Tee shirts! pins! FREE ISSUES OF WILD! And good karma!? what more can you want! We love you no matter how much you support us!

 

The Impact

We will be spreading to message and supporting women all over the world

  • just $2 prints one zine that can be passed around whole cities
  • Online issues have been viewed in Europe and Australia, that's pretty crazy
  • Saving the planet and empowering women is a pretty great cause and every little bit helps.

Risks & Challenges

Every issue of Wild carries a risks. Will people like it? How many people will see it? Will it get enough buzz? Thankfully we pretty much have this down

  • Every issue of Wild is different and carries different challenges. But after doing 2 issues, we know how to get people interested and get artists to contribute.
  • For publicity we plan to use social media to its full extent, get influencers and others in our community to shout us out. As well as promotion in local bookstores and businesses.
  • We have a firm number of artists willing and able to contribute. This will be our best issue yet

Other Ways You Can Help

It's totally cool if you can't donate, but you can still support WILD WOMEN

  • Shout us out on social media! 
  • ShareShareShare, get the word out

Thank you so much, by helping us you're helping us EMPOWER AND THRIVE

story:
In Short

I'm Annie.

I love the Book of Mormon. And I want to teach my kids all about it. But they are both under 4 years old and while I believe reading to them from the actual Book of Mormon every day is essential, I also wanted something to supplement our family scripture study. Something that would hold their attention.  The Church has published some awesome illustrated scripture stories for kids but I just don’t feel like they are completely appropriate for this young age.

So I created it.

Simplified, rhyming versions of stories in the Book of Mormon, with animal characters to hold the attention of even the youngest of children.

After finishing the text for the book I knew the perfect artist to illustrate it. My niece Maddie Dulaney painted beautiful water color illustrations that I'm very excited to share with you. 

With your contribution we can bring this project, which we have named Little Mormons, to life! The illustrations and text are finished for the first story Lehi's Journey.  This will be printed onto a board book, which is perfect for babies and toddlers.

We will use the profits from this book to fund the next, and then repeat that process until the entire series of stories throughout the whole Book of Mormon are printed. 
 

What We Need & What You Get

Cost breakdown:

  • $2,261.46 is the price for one run of printed books.

 

  • The remaining money raised will go towards shipping costs, illustration costs, indiegogo fees, and to start funding the second book.

 

  • Any funding beyond our goal will go towards printing additional copies of this book and the development of future books.

 

  • As a contributor to the funding of this story you will be supporting the development of the entire Little Mormons series.

 

The Impact

This is an opportunity to bring a new way to help teach children scripture stories. As they become familiar with names, places and stories in these books, they will begin to recognize them as you read the Book of Mormon together. 

I feel confident in assuming that since you are here looking at this campaign, you are probably already reading other books to the children in your life. So why not read to them (or give as a gift) something that helps introduce the most important book?

 

Purchase Options

Check out the column to the right for options to pre-order this book or donate any amount.

These "perks" for contributions vary from an e-book to bundles of the book. 

All pre-order options are discounted with free shipping for campaign contributors only.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone has the extra cash to help out, but realize the awesomeness of this project and want to help. If this is you, feel free to share our project with friends and family, on social media, at the park, in the grocery store, anywhere really... The key to our project being funded will be word of mouth!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, My name is Helpees Guirguis and I will be traveling across the world to Bataambeng, Cambodia to share Jesus Christ's love to children living in the slums of Cambodia. In the last few years, I've truly witnessed God's work in my life during difficult times. I decided that I wanted to share and let others know about God's love and his plans for them. God cares for these children, they are not abandoned but loved and that their names are engraved on the palms of His Hands. 

You can join the rescue by praying and helping us to travel and fulfill our purpose in teaching these children about God's love and training other educators to expand their knowledge about the Bible and Jesus Christ. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am praying to raise $1500 of the total $2500 for my trip
  • With your help, any funds donated will be used during the trip for several projects including Vacation Bible School supplies, hiring a driver to travel in the country, and wellness checkups.
  • All the funds will go directly to expenses for my trip 

The Impact

Our main effort through child sponsorship and church funding is to focus on four main goals:

1. The most important goal is to share the gospel with the children of Bataambang and teach them about the Jesus' love through a vacation Bible school and witness to them the good news. 

2. We also plan to serve the children and the surrounding community with wellness checkups as well as building a chicken coop to help support and maintain the physical health of the children. 

3. Another important aspect of our mission is to help educate helpers and mentors about the Bible and to accommodate different learning styles for the children. 

4. We are also seeking to set the groundwork for future mission trips to Cambodia

Other Ways You Can Help

  • There's nothing more powerful than prayer. Your prayers and support will help me and my team to keep our focus on our main goals and allow us to maintain the importance of the purpose of our mission trip and the reasons for it. 

If God's love is for anybody anywhere, it's for everybody everywhere

Your prayers and support will help me and my team to keep our focus on our main goals and allow us to maintain the importance of the purpose of our mission trip and the reasons for it. If God's love is for anybody anywhere, it's for everybody everywhere

story:
Thanks to a partnership with the publishers Orson & Co., my autobiographical novel WHEN I COME AROUND is about to become an eLume.

What’s an eLume, you ask?

An eLume is an entirely new way to experience reading on your Apple devices. It’s the future of books.

Think of the eLume as a multimedia time machine. For my book, the eLume will transport readers back to the twenty-something narrator’s world of the Bay Area in the early ‘90s.

With the eLume, you can:

- Click on illustrations that accompany the text and open a window onto images of what the characters' world actually looks like

-Listen to the music the characters are hearing

-Tap the text and have the book read to you in a professionally-produced audio

-Follow the narrator's misadventures across hand-drawn maps

-Reference an annotated glossary of the people, events and pop culture moments that defined the era, complete with curated photos

-Connect with me via Twitter and Facebook and email with your thoughts and questions

Remaking the model for publishing.

Not only is the format new, but the eLume also changes the way publishing works. The eLume is artist and writer-driven and is able to do things traditional publishers won’t, don’t and can’t do.

Award-winning author Richard Mason published his novel History of a Pleasure Seeker as Orson's first eLume last year, and it was hailed by an editor at PC World as World as “the single best digital book interface” she had ever seen. History of a Pleasure Seeker opened the door on a new way to publish. With your help, my book WHEN I COME AROUND will kick the door down, allowing all writers to follow.

So why an Indiegogo campaign?

You may be wondering why I'm not showing you any of the amazing images and footage I've found. Well, there's a simple reason for that. I can't. Not yet. That's where you come in.

It costs money to license any of these archival photos, lyrics, cover art, or movie posters and stills. Quite a lot of money.

-Short of having my three-year old sketch images of Kurt Cobain and Bill Clinton, I need to pay film studios, record labels, publishing houses, image houses, and the bands themselves to secure these rights.

-Then there's the hiring of an award-winning producer to create the narration for the book.

-And finally, there's the technical aspect of the eLume, namely the coding. The cost of coding to create all of these ground-breaking effects is expensive.

Hey, what's the book about anyway?

Without giving too much away (I hate it when people do that), WHEN I COME AROUND follows a recent Harvard graduate as he returns home to Berkeley to discover his beloved mother and heart of the family has terminal cancer. This is a book where the youthful fantasies about what life is supposed to be - late night parties with cute painters with pixie-cuts - are supplanted by the harsh realities of what it means to truly grow up.

When I set out to write this most personal of stories (a self-contained chapter of which won the John Steinbeck Award), I had no idea I'd have this amazing opportunity to tell it in such a vivid all-encompassing manner. After working this way, it’s hard to imagine how I – or anyone – would ever go back to the traditional way of publishing or reading.

There are lots of passion projects on Indiegogo of course, but the reason I’m so fired up about this is particular project is that we’re creating a revolutionary door-opener for publishing, one which benefits both writers and readers. Your support will make all the difference. Thank you.

Benj

story:
Summary

I have been a Burner since 2001. I was mentored as a Ranger in 2005 and I have been a Ranger lead and/or co-lead at Regional Burns. I have also been a Board of Directors member for one Regional Burn.

I would like to get a good number of examples, cataloging perceived violations of consent at burns and festivals with responses and possible variations, thus providing a true toolkit for consent issues at regional burns and similar festivals. The larger the number of responses, the more robust the toolkit.

The impact of this project, should it be successful, will be tremendous. This is not an exercise in academic dogma, with perhaps unrealistic responses to consent-related situations; this is a look at real situations and real responses people have actually found themselves in at burns or festivals. This may be an inoculation, a toolkit and a starting point for a discussion.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need money for editing, formatting and publishing. Formatting must be done for electronic and physical versions. 
  • Every level of contribution gets a book -- even the lowest level of $1 gets an electronic version of the book!
  • If we don't reach our goal, we'll keep the funds and use them in the best way we can to make sure the books are published and distributed in accordance with the perk level . 

The Impact

The goal of the document resource that explores real-life Burner situations involving consent (or lack thereof) and come up with a range of possible actions to take when placed in each situation. Rather than relying on one dogmatic answer for any number of instances of consent challenges, the hope is to have a number of possible answers based on real Burner experiences. In essence, this document should become a toolkit for identifying and responding to possible instances of violation of consensual contact. The intention of this project is to produce a book that will allow readers to come away with personal actions that can be taken in numerous situations by the offender, the violated and the onlooker to make things better for all parties involved and the community as a whole. 

What would you do in any of these situations?:

  • A person wears a “spank me” sign on their back or has the words spank me painted on their butt
  • A person shoots a water pistol at another
  • A person approaches from behind and puts their hands on another person’s hips and says “you’re sexy”
  • You see one person grabs another person’s butt without consent
  • A guy asks if he can spank a girl and she agrees; he lifts up her dress to give the spanking
  • The word of a newbie is different than the word of an experienced burner
  • A woman reads a “Consent” button on a shirt of another woman, says “nice button” and then grabs her breast
  • A man swipes some mud off another man’s shoulder on a raft; The second man says “I do not consent to that” and then grabs the first man’s wrist
  • A burner shoots a puff of air via an “Airzooka” at another participants body walking along
  • A friend you have cuddled with who is attracted to you (but you are not attracted to) asks to sleep in your tent because his tent is flooded
  • A burner shares his story of non-consensual contact but feels he has learned from it
  • A man grabs a woman’s butt as she is passing; Another woman standing near the man sees this and punches him in the face
  • You see one Burner trying to convince another Burner to have sex
  • A burner consents to you touching them, while their apparent partner is standing to the side

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can’t give money, doesn't mean you can’t contribute!

  • Please get the word out and post this on your social media page of choice
  • Please fill out the quick, easy and fun "consent survey" (see link below)
  • https://docs.google.com/forms/d/11KEx3ifEnac_hBxttb52BUNaLH6wEPcwLqIYowUzRxM/viewform

If you do either of the above, you will be entitled to an electronic version of this document as well.

story:
Proverbs Animation Ministry, Home of Bible based Animation, creating, developing high quality, faith-based animation for churches, schools and families.


The main goal of the Ministry is to animate the entire Bible, from cover to cover with no part left out. We indent to have the animation translated into different languages, and distribute it to the world for free, for all. (allowing anyone to get their hands on a copy)


And so to start this off we now bring you, The Animated Bible: Proverbs the Book of Wisdom.


                       

This will be a 3D computer animated film of ‘The Book of Proverbs’’. The aim is to not be an adaptation of plot or dialogue, instead we want to depict the Bible accurately, to create a Word-For-Word animated performance of ‘The Book of Proverbs’ for Children and Adults. what you will see in the animation will go closely along with what you read in the actual written words in the Bible, sticking as close to the text as possible.


The Fool_3D character design


3D character design


For a few years, we have been praying a lot about this project and how to make it happen. We are passionate about the Bible and want to use are skills to serve the whole body of Christ across denominations.



The purpose of Proverbs is really a book of moral instructions on everyday living. We decided to start off with is book, for the very same reasons given in the first seven verses which form the prologue where the reader is called to serious study for their own benefit. In just a few brief words, you are introduced to:

                                   (1) The genre of this literature, in verse.1

                              (2) The direct and clear purpose, in verses 2-6

                                   (3) The main important motto in verse.7


We want to create an educational tool that speaks to our current and future cultures. 


The Simple_3D character design


The Scorner_Concept Art


Title_Concept Art



3D computer animation is an expensive and long process.  We will be animating the entire Bible over a few years, however will be releasing the animation in a series of chapters. We aim to continue production on the book of Proverbs as of April 2014, and have it completed by December 2014.


Folly_3D character design




Proverbs Animation Ministry team consists of very experienced and talented people with exceptional credentials behind them. In spite of being a small company start up we have worked hard in providing the community with high quality, faith-based production art and animation services second to none.

We have over 18 years of experience in the following per-production and post-production methods:

                                                                     Graphic

Developing Logos, Brochure designing, Colour correction, Image editing & Retouching, Flyer, Poster, Banner, Header.

                                                              Pre-Production

                             Script Writing, Story Boarding, Sketches, Animatics

                                                       2d CGI development

             Character Designing, Animation, E-Card, Background Designing,Illustration, 2d animation (Movie & TV Series)

                                                       3d CGI Development

         Character, Object & Background modelling, Lighting, Texturing, Rigging 3d Animation (Movie & TV Series)

                                           Post production & Visual Effects

                                         Particles, Rotoscoping, Compositing.

                                                         Sound & Video

                          Sound production & editing, Video production & editing.

This challenging opportunity will allow us to enhance the skills acquired over the years, whilst contributing to the body of Christ.



Our aim is to raise enough funds to allow us to continue production on The Book of Proverbs . However it’s extremely expensive to implement all the resources necessary to compete this project.

Your contribution will directly cover our equipment from hardware to software, supporting every stage of the animation production line, distribution and translation.

We at Proverbs Animation Ministry are working tirelessly with all of our combined experience to ensure we produce the best visually animated word for word account of the Bible, but we need your help to complete this.


                               

If you love our mission, and are unable to make a contribution, please help us by spreading the word, about Proverbs Animation Ministry.

You can post our link and make comments on your facebook wall, tweet about us, Share the link with friends, send emails to your contacts with our link. Any small bit on your part will help our small team in a big way.

                                             

                       We need you to be a part of our team!!

Proverbs Animation Ministry Daily Proverbs, for more join us on Facebook, twitter or instagram .

story:
The Book: Strictly Walk Slimmer, out in 2015

I love walking, don't you? I am your virtual guinea pig putting walking to the test to see how much weight you can lose with daily walking and how much fitter you can get.

Walking is underrated as a way to keep healthy and my job is to provide plenty of research plus my own personal experience to get more people walking.

This Indiegogo campaign will fund the following:

  • Buy recording equipment to interview health experts for the book.
  • Buy a number of books and research papers on the benefits of walking.
  • Get a professional proof reader and editor to go through the text.
I am very grateful for your support.

I am a self-published author and this is my third book: I am sure you will love it!

The book. which will be ready in January 2015, aims to demystify weight loss and exercise and to make being healthy fun and natural.


What You Get


FAME! Yes! Your name will be listed in the acknowledgements in my book Strictly Walk Slimmer, so you can boast to your friends you are a patron of the arts and literature!

If you are a bit shy, you can still donate anonymously, share this page on social media or ask a question.

Have a look at the perks and pick the one you like the most.

The best questions will be included in the book: I want the writing process to be as democratic as possible. Feel free to email me at paola@energya.co.uk.

Once again thank you so much for your support.


Don't forget that if you can't donate right now you can still be my cheerleader and share this campaign on social media!

In health,


Paola Bassanese

Author and award-winning massage therapist

www.energya.co.uk

story:
Hippocampus Magazine, founded in 2010 and named for the seahorse-shaped part of the brain where memories are formed, is an online publication set out to entertain, educate and engage writers and readers of creative nonfiction. 

Since our first issue went live in May 2011, we've published hundreds of essays, memoir excerpts and flash pieces from emerging and established writers. On the education end, we've featured scores of interviews, reviews, craft articles and writing life columns. And our loyal and growing community is a testament that we're indeed heartily engaging with our audience on our website, through email and on social media.

We're proud of what we do. I'm incredibly grateful for a helluva volunteer staff (that's who I mean when I say "we"!) and am thankful for some great opportunities to tell our story via some fantastic interviews this past year, which you can read here.

As founder and publisher, I'm personally asking for a little help as we take our magazine to the next level!


Expanding Our Reach

Hippocampus Magazine is an online only publication that serves people all over the world, but we LOVE people. And we want to meet them, share with them, learn from them.

Now that we're reaching our fifth year, we're ready to fulfill our mission even further by bringing an otherwise virtual community to life via a creative nonfiction conference in August 2015. We're thrilled about HippoCamp! And from response we've received so far, others are too!


What We Need & What You Get

HippoCamp will ideally be an annual event, and the goal is that the conference will  fund and sustain itself moving forward, but the nature of it being the first year means we need a little help with seed money--a buffer, if you will--for up-front expenses such as:

  • Marketing campaign (printing, postage, advertising costs)
  • Deposits for keynote and other speakers (announcement coming Jan. 1; if you know creative nonfiction, you'll know this name.)
  • Venue-related fees

We know that lots of small gifts add up so we didn't set any giving levels at more than $150, and we created perks geared toward writers and non-writers--and some with a local flair since part of this event is to bring people to Lancaster. We hope you will think they are fun!

Whether we meet our $2,500 goal or not, any funds raised through this campaign will be an immediate, incredible jumpstart for the conference.

Indiegogo allows payments through PayPal (our preference, but listed as second option) or credit card. Please note that  you do not  need a PayPal account to check out with PayPal.


The Impact

HippoCamp: A Conference for Creative Nonfiction Writers is an in-the-flesh extension of our three-fold mission.

This three-day event will feature notable speakers, engaging attendee-led sessions in three tracks, interactive panels, readings, social activities, networking opps and optional, intimate pre- and post-conference workshops in Lancaster, Pa., a city rich in history, arts and culture. There's lots happening behind the scenes as we speak, and lots of more details to come.

HippoCamp (isn't the name awesome, by the way?!) will strengthen ties with our readers and attract new ones; it will bring people from all over the country to a hip city, as well, giving our magazine a sense of place and a way to share where we (at least a few of us!) live.

In addition to the keynote and panelists, the conference will feature several sessions led by attendees (we had an open call for session proposal submissions over the summer and into the fall), giving writers a platform to share their knowledge and help build credentials.

Risks & Challenges

It's important that we understand the potential event-planning risks. As any conference organizer knows, when working with certain venues, such as the amazing location we selected, there are food minimums and room blocks to fill. (This means our attendees will be well fed and sleep comfortably!) Knowing that, we set our budget with a certain attendance goal in mind, and we're being cautiously realistic. 

As we shared, we're hopeful the conference will fund itself, but registrations are typically, as an industry-wide rule, sporadic and/or last-minute, hence the need a just a little bit of help from kind folks like you to help with deposits and up-front costs.

To encourage early registration, we're, as most conferences do, offering an early bird rate. Still, we're looking to build a small buffer. 


    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you're not able to help us out with a few bucks now, no worries. I'd still love you to get involved! Just being aware of us supports us more than you know.

    • Read our magazine; we'd love you to visit! We're certain you'll find a story that sticks with you!
    • Share a link to our conference website on social media; if you're sharing on Twitter, use #hippocamp15
    • If you write creative nonfiction, submit your work for consideration. 
    • If you have writer friends, tell them about our magazine; maybe we're a good fit for their work!

    Thanks for reading. We know there's a lot of great projects and causes out there, and we also know that ours is a very niche project, so we appreciate your time!


    -Donna Talarico

    Founder & Publisher

Hippocampus Magazine,
founded in 2010 and named for the seahorse-shaped part of the brain 
where memories are formed, is an online publication set out to 
entertain, educate and
engage writers and readers of creative nonfiction.  



Since our first issue went live in May 2011, we've published hundreds of essays, memoir excerpts and flash pieces from emerging and established writers. On the education end, we've featured scores of interviews, reviews, craft articles and writing life columns. And our loyal and growing community is a testament that we're indeed heartily engaging with our audience on our website, through email and on social media. 
We're proud of what we do. I'm incredibly grateful for a helluva volunteer staff (that's who I mean when I say "we"!) and am thankful for some great opportunities to tell our story via some fantastic interviews this past year, which you can read here.
As founder and publisher, I'm personally asking for a little help as we take our magazine to the next level!

Expanding Our Reach 




Hippocampus Magazine is an online only publication that serves people all over the world, but we
LOVE people. And we want to meet them, share with them, learn from them. 
Now that we're reaching our fifth year, we're ready to fulfill our mission even further by bringing an otherwise virtual community to life via a creative nonfiction conference in August 2015. We're thrilled about HippoCamp! And from response we've received so far, others are too!


   What We Need & What You Get 


HippoCamp will
ideally be an annual event, and the goal is that the conference will  fund and sustain
itself moving forward, but the nature of it being the first year means we need a little help
with seed money--a buffer, if you will--for up-front expenses such as: 
 Marketing campaign (printing, postage, advertising costs)

Deposits for keynote and other speakers (announcement coming Jan. 1; if you know creative nonfiction, you'll know this name.) 

Venue-related fees

We know that lots of small gifts add up so we didn't set any giving levels at more than $150, and we created perks geared toward writers and non-writers--and some with a local flair since part of this event is to bring people to Lancaster. We hope you will think they are fun!


Whether we meet our $2,500 goal or not, any funds raised through this campaign will be an immediate, incredible jumpstart for the conference. 
Indiegogo allows payments through PayPal (our preference, but listed as second option) or credit card. Please note that  you do not  need a PayPal account to check out with PayPal.

    The Impact 
 


HippoCamp: A Conference for Creative Nonfiction Writers is an in-the-flesh
extension of our three-fold mission. This three-day event will feature notable
speakers, engaging attendee-led sessions in three tracks, interactive panels, readings,
social activities, networking opps and optional, intimate pre- and
post-conference workshops in Lancaster, Pa., a city rich in history, arts and
culture. There's lots happening behind the scenes as we speak, and lots of more details to come. 
HippoCamp (isn't the name awesome, by the way?!) will strengthen ties
with our readers and attract new ones; it will bring people from all over the country to a hip city, as
well, giving our magazine a sense of place and a way to share where we (at least a few of us!) live.In addition to the keynote and panelists, the conference will feature several sessions led by attendees (we had an open call for session proposal submissions over the summer and into the fall), giving writers a platform to share their knowledge and help build credentials.

story:
In Brief / En Bref

(Français en-dessous) 

  • Bringing together vietnamese and senegalese cousins around a family lunch ?
  • Growing up in a home where multiple languages are spoken ?
  • Being born from ancestor's who crossed the Sea of China on makeshift boats ? 
  • Broadening family’s multi-cultural horizons by hitting the road with a carnival ?
  • Shifting from one continent to another with a tent as sole home ?
  • Fleeing the national extremisms until love brings together one’s descendants ?
  • Being enrolled in the national army and falling in love during a military mission ?
  • Studying, living or travelling abroad and meet your life partner there ?

This is how modern cosmopolitans come to birth. No further waiting, in this book, they share with you their family story and their cosmopolitan feeling. 

All these life stories are told to you in a short story collection that we aim to finance thanks to your support on Indiegogo.

* "Pro" stands for : Professional services (designers...)

(VERSION FRANÇAISE) 

  • Réunir ses cousins vietnamiens et sénégalais lors d’un repas de famille ?
  • Grandir sous un toit où plusieurs langues se côtoient simultanément ?
  • Etre né d’aïeux qui ont traversé la Mer de Chine à bord de bateaux de fortune ? 
  • Elargir les horizons multi-culturels familiaux avec un cirque sur les routes ? 
  • Passer d’un continent à l’autre avec pour seul habitat une tente ? 
  • Fuir les extrémismes nationaux jusqu’à ce que l’amour unisse nos enfants ? 
  • Etre enrôlé dans l’armée et tomber amoureux dans le pays d’affectation ? 
  • Etudier, vivre ou voyager à l’étranger et y rencontrer son compagnon de vie ? 

De là naissent les citoyens du monde contemporain. Sans plus attendre, toutes ces histoires de vie vous sont racontées dans le recueil que nous cherchons à financer grâce à votre soutien sur Indiegogo. 

* "Pro" indique : Services professionnels (illustrateurs...)

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> WHAT ELSE ? <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<

(Français en-dessous)

Who are we ? Cosmopolitans aged from 13 to 60, born thanks to multi-cultural marriages that came to reality based on intertwined migratory destinies. This short life stories collection is aimed to convey a message of peace and open-mindedness. Not only it’s possible to learn how to live together but on top of this, it’s rewarding.

The aim of this crowdfunding ? Build an attractive layout for this short life stories collection, with pictures illustrating it. Print several samples of it so as to distribute it massively, in french and in english.

(VERSION FRANÇAISE) Le but du financement ? Construire une mise en page attrayante du recueil avec des photos qui illustrent les témoignages. En imprimer plusieurs exemplaires pour distribuer massivement ce recueil, en version française et en version anglaise.

Qui sommes-nous ?Des cosmopolites âgés de 13 à 60 ans, nés de mariages multi-culturels, grâce à des destins migratoires croisés. Ce recueil de témoignages a pour vocation de transmettre un message de paix et d'ouverture. Non seulement il est possible d'apprendre à vivre ensemble, mais en plus, cela est enrichissant. 


What you get when you help us / Pourquoi nous aider

(Français en-dessous) The funds to be raised are aimed to finance the professional services required to build a great layout for both the e-book and the paper version of this short life stories collection. These professional services will be hired for the english and the french version of this collection. Also, the first copies of this short story collection will be printed. Here below is the split of the financing required according to the different tasks addressed :

The rewarding gifts of the crowdfunding include the very first printed copies of the short stories collection. 

If the final amount of the crowdfunding is not reached, the funds raised will be allocated to each single item of the whole project that can be financed : the english e-book, the french e-book, the english paper book, the french paper book.

(VERSION FRANÇAISE) Les fonds collectés ont pour but de financer les services professionnels auxquels nous faisons appel pour construire une mise en page attrayante de la version e-book et papier de ce recueil. Ces services professionnels s’occuperont de la mise en page pour la version anglaise et française de ce recueil. De plus, les toutes premières versions de ce recueil seront imprimées. Voici ci-dessous la répartition du financement selon les différentes tâches requises :

Les contreparties de cette campagne incluent les premières versions imprimées de ce recueil de témoignages. 

Si la somme finale n’est pas atteinte, les fonds levés seront alloués à chaque sous-section du projet qui pourraient ainsi être financés: la version e-book en anglais, la version e-book en français, la version papier en anglais, la version papier en français.


Our collective impact / Notre impact

(Français en-dessous) 

Do you want to join an initiative that will contribute and enlighten the world ? If so, by financing the full version with pictures illustrating the short life stories told in this book, you’ll be part of the process to spread an amazing message of love and benevolence. And this is amazing.

This positive shoot is required to build a harmonious society, in which each and everyone of us is a blossomed being.

You want to get a foretaste of the great dynamics you’ll join ? The partial e-book version with no pictures is already available for free download, on Amazon. Here’s the URL link to copy-paste in your browser : http://www.amazon.com/dp/B01BX9NCY2?ref_=pe_242.... The download is free during the first three days.

Thanks to this crowdfunding, this short life stories collection will be available in its full version with pictures - both in english and in french - as paper book and e-book. Two options will be proposed : free download of the book or copy-order of the printed-version. The margins earned through the sales of the former will be fully given to actions in support of education.

(VERSION FRANÇAISE) Vous avez envie de contribuer à ré-enchanter le monde ? Si tel est le cas, en nous aidant à financer la version complète avec des photos illustrant chaque portrait cosmopolite de ce recueil, vous contribuerez à diffuser un incroyable message d’amour et de bienveillance. Et ça, c'est grandiose. 

Cette dose de positivisme est nécessaire pour construire une société plus harmonieuse, au sein de laquelle chacun d’entre nous est épanoui. 

Vous souhaitez avoir un avant-goût de cet incroyable mouvement de fond auquel vous pouvez participer ? Il est d'ores et déjà possible de télécharger la version e-book partielle et sans photos du recueil, en copiant - collant ce lien vers Amazon : http://www.amazon.com/dp/B01BX9NGFW?ref_=pe_242.... Le téléchargement est gratuit les 3 premiers jours de la campagne.

Grâce au financement, le recueil sera disponible en version complète avec photos - en français et en anglais - sous formats papier et e-book. Il y aura dès lors deux possibilités : télécharger l'e-book gratuitement ou commander la version papier. Les bénéfices réalisés par la vente de la version papier seront intégralement reversés à des actions en faveur de l’éducation.


Our challenges / Nos défis

(Français en-dessous) 

We are more than 20 cosmopolitans sharing with you the story of our ancestors’ intertwined destinies, who came from every continents. Among others, we talk about what we learned out of this.

The main challenge now is to let the maximum number of persons know about the existence of this short life story collection. It’s the only way to reach the target amount of this crowdfunding, and to go beyond… let’s be ambitious ! This can only be achieved thanks to you sharing the news about this crowdfunding. On our side, we have contacted press and influencers who care about education, so that this initiative be spread beyond our close relationship circles.

(VERSION FRANÇAISE) Nous sommes plus de vingt cosmopolites à partager avec vous l'histoire des destins croisés de nos ancêtres venant de tous les continents. Nous parlons entre autres de ce que nous en retirons comme héritage.

Le principal défi à présent est de faire connaître l’existence de ces témoignages au plus grand nombre. C'est le seul moyen d'atteindre l'objectif du financement, et de le dépasser… soyons fous ! Cela passe par vous et les partages que vous ferez concernant cette campagne. De notre côté, nous avons contacté la presse ainsi que tous les influenceurs sensibles à la cause de l’éducation pour que cette initiative soit connue au-delà de réseaux proches.


A thousands ways to help us / Des milliers de manières pour nous aider

(Français en-dessous) 

Any support is important, be tangible through financing, or not tangible by sharing the news related to this crowdfunding with your relatives and friends. Indiegogo offers a bunch of tools to help you support us in the spread of this initiative ! So, from all of us, a huge THANK YOU !

(VERSION FRANÇAISE) Toute contribution est importante, qu'elle soit tangible grâce à un don financier, ou intangible grâce au partage des informations relatives à cette campagne avec votre cercle proche. Indiegogo met une variété d'outils à disposition pour vous aider à nous soutenir dans la diffusion de cette campagne ! Alors, de notre part à tous, un immense MERCI !

story:
Nigel Percy's Dream

Nigel Percy is the author of over a dozen nonfiction books on Amazon, but "Songs Of Harmony" (written using the pseudonym Andrew Elgin) is his first novel. Harmony is a world that is an expression of Nigel's love of intuition, closeness to Nature and his belief in the importance of being authentic, using your gifts and living your passion.

Self-publishing is a powerful tool for getting your work out to the appropriate audience, but it leaves all aspects of publishing to the author, who in the past only had to write a great story. Cover design, editing, compiling and marketing all take time, effort, money and know-how, making the indie author's life challenging, as he wears so many different hats for each project.

A support system is needed for such a complex project to succeed. This campaign creates a community of readers who support Nigel's goals and want to be an integral part of the success of his book by helping raise funds to cover the two biggest expenses in the publication of "Songs Of Harmony".


The Plot of "Songs Of Harmony"

After being kidnapped and dumped on another planet, Javin awakens to discover all memories of his early life have disappeared. The world he finds himself on, Harmony, is nothing like his home planet, Haven, even though they are both in the same solar system. Harmony has no industry, no cities, no metal, only small groups of people living quiet, uncomplicated lives.

And yet things are not as simple as they first appear. Everyone except Javin seems to have some mysterious connection with the planet. As if that’s not enough, they all seem to have strange gifts, such as being able to heal, to communicate with animals, to see the future.

Javin struggles to adapt to his new home at the same time as trying to reclaim his memories. Unsettling dreams lead to his meeting with an independent-minded woman, Meldren. Together they experience visions they cannot explain but which seem to have a purpose, if only they could understand them.

In order to survive the effects of these visions, they have to give up everything. Doing so brings them to face a new crisis; one which is much bigger than they could have imagined. The fate of the entire planet, it seems, is in their hands. Will they be able to make the right decision and what will it cost them?

    What Is Needed

    The expenses this campaign is seeking to fund are: professional editing services by Judith Tarr, herself a well known author of sci-fi/fantasy novels; and a professionally designed book cover. Together these two items cost $1200. There are other expenses involved in the publication of the book, but it is these 2 key elements that the campaign seeks to fund.

    What Your Help Will Accomplish

    Nigel has spent the last 4 years writing this novel in his 'spare' time, and he would dearly love to publish Book 2 of the Harmony series within about a year. By helping fund the biggest expenses of publication, you free Nigel to do what he does best and what he most enjoys: writing. Not only will this novel get published faster, the next one will come out sooner.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Thanks for your interest in Nigel's fiction work as author Andrew Elgin. Please visit his website and register to get a free sample of his writing and to be notified about future books. http://andrewelgin.com

    We also suggest you "Like" his Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/Andrew-Elgin-1635962526664168/?fref=ts

    Please use the share tools on this page to tell your friends about this campaign.

The fate of the entire planet, it seems, is in their hands. Will they be able to make the right decision and what will it cost them?   What Is Needed
The expenses this campaign is seeking to fund are: professional editing services by Judith Tarr, herself a well known author of sci-fi/fantasy novels; and a professionally designed book cover. Together these two items cost $1200. There are other expenses involved in the publication of the book, but it is these 2 key elements that the campaign seeks to fund.
What Your Help Will Accomplish
 Nigel has spent the last 4 years writing this novel in his 'spare' time, and he would dearly love to publish Book 2 of the Harmony series within about a year. By helping fund the biggest expenses of publication, you free Nigel to do what he does best and what he most enjoys: writing. Not only will this novel get published faster, the next one will come out sooner.
  Other Ways You Can Help Thanks for your interest in Nigel's fiction work as author Andrew Elgin. Please visit his website and register to get a free sample of his writing and to be notified about future books. http://andrewelgin.com
We also suggest you "Like" his Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/Andrew-Elgin-1635962526664168/?fref=tsPlease use the share tools on this page to tell your friends about this campaign.

story:
Short Summary

Who am I?

I’m Laya Saul, an award-winning author (Mom’s Choice Gold is my favorite). My goals in publishing are creating books that make the world better by helping people on their journey in life. Life experiences and a master’s degree in psychology helped me write a self-help book for teens.  Being a mom (and now a grandmother!) opened my heart to create this whimsical book based on the way I put my children to sleep when they were little. (The title comes from the way my father told my children he loved them. Though you can’t hear his tone, the blessing is there!) I’m motivated to publish this book for the little ones in my life and I’ve already gotten the feedback that there are others who want it for the kids in their lives too.

I intentionally did not use human images in this book because I didn’t want skin color, ethnicity, age or gender to limit who could relate to the images. It’s not a parent to a child because not everyone who reads this book has her parent reading it. It could be a sibling, grandparent, aunt, uncle, or godparent reading this story. Children can project themselves into the story in whatever way their imaginations will delight.

Want to know more about me? Check out my websites:

http://www.auntlaya.com

http://www.nurturingwomen.com 



How your investment will be used:

Your contribution to this campaign will help cover the publication costs and get this sweet book into your home!

Publishing costs include illustrations, typesetting, printing and shipping. Your copy or copies of the book will go to print no matter what; of course the more backers, the more production costs will go down. I aim to produce the finest quality books that the funding collected provides. If the funding exceeds the goal and I can go into offset printing (instead of POD) there will be more copies to donate. With funding of $5000 I will donate a minimum of 50 books to children’s organizations and/or needy families. With funding at $7000 a minimum of 100 books will be donated.

What We Need & What You Get

A few more details:

•  Whatever level you choose to participate will help cover prepublication costs and the bare bones of POD (print on demand) publishing. If donations exceed the initial campaign, I may be able go to offset printing and that means I can print more books of consistent high quality.  

•  I know the young children who you give this book to will enjoy reading it over and over. The e-book will be fun, but the print book even more so as you wind down a busy day with your little ones off line. Choose the print to hang on the wall that keeps the love and adventure in the background all the time.

•  In the event that we don’t reach the entire goal, we’ll print your copy of the book and fulfill your perks no matter what, so you can enhance the journey with those you love.

The Impact

Kids don’t remember much from their first formative years but what they see and hear will still have a big impact over their lifetime.

•  Sweet “love notes” like I Love You So Much will anchor the message over and over. We all have rough days but how wonderful to have the support, even in the simplest of ways, to bring us back to center and the essential love we want to give.

•  I’ve told teens reading my first book, You Don’t Have to Learn Everything the Hard Way, to think of it as a “love note” from my heart to theirs. There really is power in the written word. Caring is a soothing balm in a world full of difficulties.

•  I love connecting, so feel free to contact me through this campaign or on www.KadimaPress.com with any questions.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk with this project is all mine because I will do all the ordering and make sure you get the reward you choose with a blessing. Unless there is some act of G.d that is out of my control, you’ll get the perk you choose. I’ll keep you posted along the way.

Other Ways You Can Help

•  Please share this campaign in an email to your friends who are parents, grandparents, aunts, uncles and cousins of babies and toddlers. (Because those babies will be toddlers in a minute!)

•  This is a worthy project to share on social media, too. (I’m listening to a music CD I got through crowd funding because someone cared enough to share on Facebook.)

•  Don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much, many blessings!

story:
Short Summary

So here is the deal in short:

  • I am a paranormal researcher with over 13 years in the field and have been to some of the most exciting locations.
  • I want to write a second book sharing my experiences, but the fact is, writing a book takes time and ordering copies of the book even for myself costs money.
  • This campaign will free up my time to be able to go in depth with a second book, talk about the locations not written about in the first one, and also to explain some of the new findings, techniques, and include a chapter on misidentification of every day happenings that people confuse with paranormal activity.

Why should you contribute??

What We Need & What You Get

Let me break it down:

  • $800 is a small goal, but it's a good starting point. The minimum. After IndieGoGo fees, paypal fees, etc, it will leave me with just enough to cover my time for writing without going into debt.
  • Going over $800 will activate stretch goals, and with stretch goals come bigger and better perks. We're already offering some pretty nice perks, so this will just add to the experience.
  • Think of it as pre-ordering the next book. Some of the perks include copies of the original book, as well as copies of the new book as soon as it's available. The perks will be cheaper than anything you will be able to buy via Amazon, Barnes & Noble, Books a Million, etc once the book is released.
STRETCH GOALS:


The Impact

Here is what your contribution will do for the project:

  • It will allow me to focus on writing the book and putting out the best possible product.
  • The last book "I Am a Ghost Hunter" got RAVE reviews on Amazon, and has sold over 1500 copies JUST at the events I have personally sold them at. Amazon has recorded over 6,500 sales of the book alone. Not bad for a first book, eh?
  • With so many ways of picking up a book these days, this is the easiest way to get a physical book IN YOUR HANDS. Digital copies are available as well, but really, is there ANYTHING else like sitting in your room, in the dark, with a flashlight while reading about experiencing real life hauntings?

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • We understand not everyone can help with funds. That's why we make it easy for you, if you decide you cannot spare even a single dollar, just do us a huge favor and tell a friend. Share it on your Facebook, Twitters, Reddits, Instagrams, etc and help us get the word out.
  • You can use built in share tools via IndieGoGo or you can just copy and paste the link. If you would like to join our campaign team and help spread the word that way, just let us know!

We'll add stretch goals as we get closer to reaching the actual goal. Some of the perks to look forward to will be, signed PROOF copies, signed original cover art, exclusive photo sets, access to web only content that will accompany the stories you are reading in the book just to name a few. Thank you in advance and I look forward to your support!

story:
Project Background

My name is Roy G. Guzmán, a Honduran poet pursuing an MFA in creative writing at the University of Minnesota, and I was chosen to complete a four-week writing residency at the Vermont Studio Center. This would mark my first writing residency, but although I received a generous grant to cover part of the tuition, I am still responsible for the remaining cost. Your pledge of any amount will enable me to work during this residency on my first poetry manuscript, tentatively titled, Catracho.

Catracho is a project with roots that extend back to 2011, a year in which I unflinchingly questioned my identity as a Latino. Catracho is a term used broadly for people of Honduran heritage and has a rich history going back to a time when the United States wanted to acquire new territories in Central America. This tension between Honduras and the U.S. informs most of my work.

I came to the United States when I was 9, but due to an oversight in my visa, I remained in the country past the time authorized; thus, I became illegal. As someone who has struggled with his immigrant-queer identity, I ended up silencing so many aspects of my life through religious fanaticism, violence upon my body, and shame. I tried to disassociate myself from my background when memories became a source of pain, alienation, and guilt. Years later, while teaching in South Florida, I was able to heal with the help of friends and family. Since then, I have been writing on what I have learned throughout this journey. In a way, writing has given me a second chance at life.

While Catracho explores my challenges as an immigrant (I grew up in Allapattah, a very impoverished neighborhood in Miami), this project cannot exist without (re)considering my place of birth: Tegucigalpa, Honduras. For a quick glance at the overwhelming amount of violence that has plagued Honduras and my family, the U.S. Department of State has created the Overseas Security Advisory Council (OSAC), which recently published the "Honduras 2015 Crime and Safety Report." Last year, the Pew Research Center also published "5 facts about Honduras and immigration [to the U.S.]," looking at some of the prime reasons Hondurans flee the country.

My commitment to these social and global injustices is integral to Catracho. If you'd like to check out more of my work, please read the Librotraficante issue of Drunken Boat and The Acentos Review.

How Your Contribution Will Help

Your pledge will enable me to spend 4 weeks in Johnson, Vermont, revising work I have written up until my time at the residency, generating new poems, and hopefully producing a book that goes beyond the specifics of my life and brings international attention to what Hondurans and Honduran immigrants are undergoing.

The $2500 will help me cover the rest of the residency fees, and travel and living expenses during my residency. Any remaining money will help me submit work to literary journals and apply to manuscript competitions.

Perks!

I want to make sure I acknowledge your kindness in any way I can. As someone who understands the challenges writers face to make ends meet, I have seen how much generous patronage can help an artist survive and thrive. 

If you make any kind of contribution to this project, in addition to being thanked on Facebook, Twitter, Wordpress, my soon-to-be-unveiled website, or at any of my future readings, here are some ways I will express my profound gratitude:

  • $10: You will receive a handwritten postcard from Vermont.

  • $25: Receive updates via E-mail, once a week, about the progress of my project during the residency. You will also receive a handwritten postcard from Vermont.

  • $40: The poet Christina Collins, author of the exquisite Conspiracy of Beauty (winner of the 2014 Gertrude Chapbook Competition for Poetry), is also a visual artist who has kindly donated some fantastic cards. I will mail you a set of 5. You will also receive weekly updates via E-mail about the progress of my project during the residency.

  • OR $40: This summer, Notre Dame Review is publishing 2 of my poems, the result of a wonderful workshop you can read more about on The Best American Poetry Blog. I will sign, personalize, and mail you a copy of this issue. You will also receive weekly updates via E-mail about the progress of my project during the residency.

  • $50: Each week you will receive 2 new poems in your inbox. You will also receive weekly updates about the progress of my project during the residency.

  • $75: You will receive a keychain made in Honduras. Each week you will also receive 2 new poems in your inbox and updates about the progress of my project during the residency.

  • $150: I used to be a sketch artist when I was younger, and (surprisingly) I can still draw. I'd love to draw your portrait and mail it to you! It can also be the portrait of someone else. Each week you will also receive 2 new poems in your inbox and updates about the progress of my project during the residency.

  • OR $150: If you have a book that came out recently or will be published soon, mail me a copy and I will review it. I will pitch it to five journals of your choosing. Each week you will also receive 2 new poems in your inbox and updates about the progress of my project during the residency.

  • $250: Have you been thinking about learning or practicing your Spanish? I will tutor you in Spanish for 10 hours! Hours can be spread out any way you want. You will receive fun assignments. This can be done in person (if in or near the Twin Cities) or through Skype, and references can be provided. Each week you will also receive 2 new poems in your inbox and updates about the progress of my project during the residency.

  • OR $250: Do you have a document you need to translate from English to Spanish, or from Spanish to English? I have experience translating everything from poetry to lyrics to essays to technical writing. Perhaps this is your poetry or a family document you've inherited. I can provide references. Each week you will also receive 2 new poems in your inbox and updates about the progress of my project during the residency.

  • $500: Have you been thinking about learning or practicing your Spanish? I will tutor you in Spanish for 20 hours! Hours can be spread out any way you want. You will receive fun assignments. This can be done in person (if in or near the Twin Cities) or through Skype, and references can be provided. Each week you will also receive 2 new poems in your inbox and updates about the progress of my project during the residency.

Art made by yours truly.

Can you tell who she is?

Cards made by Christina Collins.

Honduran keychains!

*NB: Perks will be mailed, E-mailed, or submitted no later than 1/31/2016*

What If You Can't Make a Monetary Contribution?

Any kind of support for this project is important to me. Even if you can't make a monetary contribution, you can still help this campaign by word of mouth, social media, your blog, or via E-mail, and make sure to use the Indiegogo share tools above/left. A simple "share" could make a difference!

I would also be happy to do an interview in person, over the phone, through Skype, or participate in a panel interested in raising awareness about Honduras and Honduran immigrants.

THANK YOU FOR TAKING THE TIME TO CHECK OUT AND SUPPORT THIS CAMPAIGN!!!

story:
Short Summary

In the last two years since Trav's good computer broke he's been stuck using a 5 year old Dell netbook with a cracked motherboard and no sound.  Despite how much this limited his options for being on the internet, he made the best of it and primarily spent a lot of time on Facebook and Reddit posting the long diatribes and elegant intellectual ass-kickings that we all love to watch, and being able to use Facebook messenger and Skype to keep in touch.  

Unfortunately the netbook eventually crapped out on him, dropping him down to no way to regularly post on the internet except through a tablet with a twitchy virtual keyboard which, if any of you have ever tried to type with such, you'll know was drastically limiting his flare and verbosity.  Last month on a whim we tried restarting the netbook and it worked, allowing him to come back and resume his more normal schedule of textual abuse of the weak-minded and willfully ignorant.  Today the netbook is dead, completely and utterly dead, and Travis simply cannot bear trying to go back to using the tablet(which is nothing more than a rooted 1st gen NookColor) as his only means of interacting with the internet world.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need:
$200.  That's it.  $200 will allow us to purchase Travis the cheapest refurbished laptop available on newegg (including the fees indiegogo will take for processing payments and not meeting the minimum $500) so he can get back to what he does best, being an asshole for truth and justice.

What you get:
The pleasure of having Travis around adding his unique perspective to conversations, the warm and fuzzy feeling of helping somebody out for a few bucks out of your pocket, and a sincere thank you and acknowledgement of a favor done from somebody who -always- pays people back.

The Impact

Without people to talk to/debate with, Trav starts to stagnate and turn inward, that never ends well.  For only a few dollars from anybody who's ever enjoyed his company, that doesn't have to happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have a spare laptop, even a dinosaur, as long as it has a wireless card and is in basic working order, that would make all the difference in the world to one very sad Luciferian.  If you still want to contribute but don't want to go through indiegogo, contact Sherry and tell her what other ways you'd like to help.

Thanks a lot in advance, this is just kind of a stab in the dark here.  If it doesn't work out it doesn't work out, we understand that most of you probably have a lot of priorities for your money that come first, but we figured it was worth a try before all the inside walls of our house wound up covered in rants written in sharpie marker.

story:
L'association

L'Association Vendéenne est responsable éditorial du site du Mouvement des Libérés, qui relate jour après jour le combat des Libérés de la Sécu.

La totalité des dons est encaissée par l'Association Vendéenne.


Pourquoi l'Association Vendéenne a besoin de vous

Le Mouvement des Libérés n'a pas de forme juridique, et donc pas de cotisation. C'est un groupe de personnes bénévoles, constituées de "libérés de la sécu" à travers la France.

Au mois de décembre 2014, le Régime Social des Indépendants (R.S.I) a fait parvenir à l'Association Vendéenne un droit de réponse, suite à la publication de deux articles sur le site du Mouvement des Libérés.

  • "Le MLPS fait condamner le RSI", qui relaie l'article publié initialement sur le site du MLPS
  • "Le RSI est sans existence légale et ne peut donc pas vous poursuivre en justice pour recouvrer vos cotisations !", qui relaie l'article publié sur le site de Maître Rocheblave

Le RSI estime que le droit de réponse n'a pas été respecté, et intenté une action en justice contre l'Association Vendéenne ainsi que son président en nom propre.

Pour en savoir plus, vous pouvez consulter l'article publié lors de la réception de l'assignation en référé au TGI de Paris.


Nous souhaitons aussi aider "Morgan Morin"

Morgan a perdu son mari en 2009, et depuis l'engrenage ne s'arrête pas. Elle se défend actuellement devant les tribunaux face aux caisses de sécurité sociale. Il n'est pas possible d'en dire plus à ce sujet, ce dernier étant en cours d'instruction.

Il ne nous est pas possible de connaître ses nouvelles conditions de vie, qu'elle assume avec son fils de 9 ans et de rester sans rien faire. Pour cette raison, nous souhaitons lui venir en aide avec l'achat d'un lave-linge. Ce n'est pas grand-chose, mais ça lui évitera d'utiliser sa cuisine en tant que buanderie, et votre participation lui apportera surtout beaucoup de chaleur et d'énergie pour la suite de son combat.

Car ce combat continue, avec refus du RSI de prendre en charge les soins pour elle et son enfant. 

Tout dépassement de la somme demandée dans ce financement participatif sera reversé à "Morgan Morin".


Contreparties



D'autres façons d'aider

Vous ne pouvez peut-être pas contribuer financièrement, mais vous pouvez quand même nous aider en diffusant cette page autour de vous !

Merci, FORZA.


Factures de l'avocat et de l'huissier




Merci

à toutes celles et ceux qui ont commencé à participer avant le lancement de ce financement participatif, et vous tous qui nous aidez à travers vos dons.
