story:
The Shelby County Arts Council, The Alabama Writer’s Forum and “Writing Our Stories”

From: Bruce Andrews, Executive Director of The Shelby County Arts Council

The Shelby County Arts Council is a Non Profit 501 c3

This program was originally innovated and developed by the Alabama Writer’s Forum and the Department of Youth Services in 1997. Writing Our Stories uses a refined and developed curriculum that targets at risk youth but is all inclusive in its positive affect on the student population where it is taught.

 With the funding we seek; The Shelby County Arts Council will bring back Writing Our Stories to Columbiana Middle School for a fifth consecutive year, in addition we will expand to Montevallo Middle School. Writing Our Stories is not only an anti-violence, anti-bullying program, but has proven to be a catalyst to better learning. Students are energized and inspired by the application of writing skills and grammar to the creative process of writing poetry.  At the end of a 10 week session with teaching writer Tony Crunk ( award winning published poet and teacher) the 7th grade students receive a professionally bound anthology of their own poetry.

What We Need & What You Get

  • This is a proven , award winning program; already the recipient of the Governor's Excellence Award and the 2013 Impact Award from the Alabama Arts Alliance. We have wanted to expand it for 5 years now. We are going to do that in 2015! Montevallo Middle School will be added this year! 
  • This program is supported by The Alabama  State Council on the Arts, Alabama Power and Senator Cam Ward. Having said that we are $8000. short ! We are confident we can team up with the community and pull this off for the kids! The cost of the program at two schools will be between 22 and 23,000. dollars. We have 15,000. committed already. 
  • If you give $50. or more, you will receive the anthology. 
  •  If you give $100. or more, you will be printed in the closing ceremony's program, and your sponsorship will be mentioned at the two closing ceremony assemblies. 
  • If you give $1000. or more, you will be printed IN THE BOUND POEM ANTHOLOGY as a platinum sponsor and in the closing ceremony's program, and your sponsorship will be mentioned at the two closing ceremony assemblies.School administration, students, AWF, SCAC and the news media will be at the Closing Assemblies. These ceremonies are to give the kids applause and approval as they recieve thier own copy of the finished work.
  • The Impact

The program hinges on the amazing teaching style of Tony Crunk. As a teaching writer, Mr. Crunk comes to us through A.W.F. with a string of impressive credentials. His ability to get students into the process of writing poetry is proven and effective. Tony gets ALL the students involved; the athlete, the scholar, the shy and the bold. The self-revelation that happens openly in these classroom sessions becomes “a great equalizer”. Students discover they have more in common as human beings than not. The result of this 10 week process is a transformed classroom population with freshly developed means of creative expression and new found respect for each other.  ” All it takes is a few minutes with Mr. Crunk, and the faces and moods (of the students) transform to reflect the possibilities and opportunities that poetry provides” Mr. Richard Scott / 7th grade English teacher.

Writing Our Stories in conjunction with SCAC has proven to be an Award Winning Program:

·  The Governor’s Innovation Award in 2012

·  The Alabama Art’s Alliance Impact Award in 2013

The evidence of success is easy to see! Each 10 week session ends with a bound and published anthology of the student’s poems. It is impressive and heartwarming to see an auditorium full of parents, students and administration cheer as each student reads his/her poetry from the podium and receives a bound copy of their own published work. I would add, “It is impressive to me to see ALL manner of students get applause from the masses for something other than a sports event. Yes, I am a fan of sports, but what these students learned in Writing Our Stories will more than likely last them a lifetime”.

Challenges

As the Executive Director of SCAC it is my responsibility to seek funding for worthy programs that are Arts related. I can tell you, having taught art in the Juvenile Detention facilities, most incarcerated kids are not "bad kids". They are kids who lack a constructive ability to express themselves. If all you know is "street slang" and peer pressure as your development mentors..expressing yourself in school and in social situations becomes a "bridge too far". Many students in the 7th grade are prime for the detriments of peer pressure and usually set their path for high school and beyond in this grade .The 7th grade is a "crossroads" for many kids. The point being, 7th grade is the IDEAL time to impart these creative writing skills that will benefit them FOR LIFE.  You can contact me personally for further detail as I am a FIRM BELIEVER in what we can accomplish through this program. Bruce Andrews 205-669-0044. Whatever you can give, especially if you live in SHELBY COUNTY, ALABAMA, we need your help!  

Other Ways You Can Help

IF YOU CAN NOT GIVE..PLEASE SHARE THIS OPPORTUNITY WITH YOUR FRIENDS AND CONTACTS! 

THANK YOU MY FRIENDS

story:
Why is This Project Important?

Imagine a world where love was the ruling emotion. I am not talking about our romantic notion of love, but a pure heart centered way of being that encourages a creative, loving solution to all of life's little obstacles. Yes, it is possible to live from "LOVE" and joyfully support all of the people you interact with on a daily basis. I personally know of at least one place on earth where this social dynamic actually exists.

Let me tell you about it...

A little more than two years ago, I travelled to a small village south of Iquitos, Peru to spend time meditating on the purpose of life. Fifty-two days after stepping into the mysterious Amazonian Rainforest, I emerged full of life, love, vitality and ready to share my newly discovered happiness with anyone who would listen. For the first time in my life I had found true peace.

Working under the protective eye of indigenous shaman Adela Navas and her son Jose, I learned to traverse the exciting landscape of an ethereal spirit world known only to a few gifted shaman. 

After publishing a full account of my Amazonian adventure in 'Journey Beyond Words' I vowed to return to the rainforest, continue my studies with the shaman and publish another book chock full of life altering experiences.

This is your chance to help make my dream come true and share this rare gift of shamanic wisdom with the world.

A final note for anyone who would like to take on a larger role and head up part of this project, please send me your email address and how you will be contributing. I will assign that role to you and add you as part of the team.

Go Team!

 

Why are You Attending the Shamanism Conference?

To visit, interview and attend ceremony with my friend and teacher Adela Navas. During the downtime between conference lectures I will be conducting indepth interviews with a number of shaman for my new book "Return to Eden."

 

When and Where is the Conference?

Thank you for asking. The 9th International Amazonian Shamanism Conference is being held in Iquitos, Peru between July 21 and July 27, 2013.

Funds raised during this campaign will pay for travel and lodging expenses to and from the conference.

 

How Can I Help?

By selecting one of the contribution options. Beyond that warm and fuzzy feeling of knowing you have helped me achieve my goal, you'll be receiving some really cool perks. Don't forget to share this with all of your friends.

 

Money is Tight. How Else Can I Help?

I understand some people are not able to contribute financially. If you find yourself in this category, don't despair. I need to cast a wide net to gather as much support as I can in the next few weeks. Want to be part of a team and make this happen? Here are a few non-monetary ways you can help support this project: 

  • Be an Ambassador: Talk to everyone you know and help me spread the word. Who knows, you might inspire your friends and family to learn more about the global benefits of shamanism.
  • Send me Love: Happy emotions are a powerful force for positive change. You can feel good about simply sharing your love vibration and holding the vision of our success in this endeavor.

 

Much Love to all of my new friends.

PEACE

story:
South African Elections - 7 May 2014
The South African Elections take place every 5 years - we have to use this opportunity to represent the conscious people of our country an provide inspiration for other countries to follow. We have reduced the required funding to succeed in our mission to $40,000 or R400,000 because we will only contest the national ballot - NOT the 9 different provinces. We are almost there - please continue to support this critical funding initiative for the people of South Africa. Thanks to this crowd funding site for the UBUNTU Party, we have managed to raise the necessary deposit of $20,000 / R200,000 to participate in the South African Elections on 7 May 2014. We borrowed this money and the cheque was delivered on the 12th March to the IEC and will secure the UBUNTU Party place on the Ballot for the National Assembly - we are aiming for 4 seats in Parliament - with your help this is very achievable. But we will need continued support to pay for the media and advertising campaign that will inform the people of our presence. So we need to raise a total of $40,000 by the 24th March 2014. Please share this initiative with everyone who is passionate about human rights and human sovereignty. The UBUNTU Party represents these rights and so much more for the people who believe that we are evolving towards higher consciousness as a species.

OUR ACTIONS OF THE PAST
Michael Tellinger and The UBUNTU Party has been active in the Supreme Court of Johannesburg since 2011. His actions have exposed the criminal activities of the banksters in South Africa and shown the people how the private banks, together with the SOUTH AFRICAN RESERVE BANK, control our government and dictate the economic policy to the people, enslaving every single one of us with their private money. The barrier to entry in these elections is a clear indication how the bankers and the government use money to manipulate, what should be free elections in South Africa. Together with Scott Cundill from the New Economic Rights Alliance, and others who have taken on the banks, our collective actions have resulted in a dramatic drop in legal actions against the people by the banks - and at least one critical adaptation to the High Court Rules, that will benefit the people.

Our full philosophy is outlined in detail in the UBUNTU Contributionism book. Please find it on our website - www.ubuntuparty.org.za
The book is the main source of funding for the UBUNTU movement and party. I will outline our manifesto in brief below.

THE UBUNTU MANIFESTO -  A Blueprint For Human Prosperity

The UBUNTU movement is a movement of unity and higher consciousness, allowing people to move from divided communities driven by competition, greed and money, to communities that live in united harmony of cooperation - creating abundance for all on every level of human endeavour - without the ultimate need of money - but rather the simple principles of Contributionism - where everyone uses their god-given talents or acquired skills to benefit everyone in their community. The UBUNTU philosophy allows people to move from communities driven by money, greed and corporate control, to communities driven by people, their talents and passion for life.

We, the people, have appointed the politicians as our servants to do the best they can for us - the people. The politicians and the government have failed us dramatically on every level. They have betrayed the dream of Nelson Mandela and many other people of integrity who dedicated their lives to our freedom. Today, we face a greater threat than any other threat we have faced before. The threat of absolute enslavement by those who control the global economy and the financial systems. We recognise that money has been introduced to the human race by a small powerful group of banking families as a tool of absolute enslavement. These powerful banking families control every crack and crevice of human activity. They have taken control of our water supply, food supply, energy, health, education and even spiritual evolution. This cannot continue. 

Ubuntu is passionate about freeing up the scientific community to invent and create, delivering alternative free energy to the people, restructuring the entire education system to suit the people and not corporations, turning hospitals into true places of healing, ensuring that the farmers are in control of food production instead of GMO giants like Monsanto, and decentralizing government so that the people can govern themselves in their own communities.

Our Inalienable Rights – The Rights of All People

1.  The country belongs to its people - The land belongs to the people

2.  The water, the rivers and lakes belong to the people

3.  The beaches and the oceans around us belong to the people

4.  The forests, the mountains, the skies above and the airwaves belong to the people

5.  All the minerals in the ground belong to the people - gold, the platinum, chrome, copper, iron, tin, aluminium, diamonds, coal and all others

These do not belong to the government or private corporations that have laid claim to it.

We plan to initiate a rapid transformation programme which will replace the privately owned SOUTH AFRICAN RESERVE BANK with a People's Bank - that creates tax-free and interest-free money for the people by the people allowing progress without restriction - for every human activity imaginable - in food, science, inventions, community, education, arts and culture, health, and more. This is a critical immediate but interim measure to allow people to realise that money was created as a tool of enslavement by the banking families to control humanity. As we use our own money to create abundance on every level of human activity, we will soon realise that we do not need money at all - and that people can live utopian lives on our beautiful planet of abundance. 

Because money does nothing - people do everything. People plant the seeds, grow the food, create the technology and solve mathematical equations - people show deep emotion are capable unbridled compassion and people hold the capacity for infinite LOVE. Money only gets in the way of human aspirations. Please read

UBUNTU Contributionism - A Blueprint For Human Prosperity - for more.


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise US$100,000 for the following reasons.
1) $65,000 to be allowed entry to the elections and appear on the ballot of the national assembly and also the ballot of all nine provinces.
2) We need to raise an additional $35,000 or more, for spreading our message in the media who only promote the agenda of the ruling party.

We do believe that with our growing awareness and support in SA and around the world we can make a great contribution to the liberation of the people of South Africa from their economic slavery.


Other Ways You Can Help

Our aim is to have 1000 monthly supporters/contributors of $10 each - to stabilize our activity and allow UBUNTU to grow without constant concerns. With that kind of support we can virtually move mountains. It is ironic that we need money to free ourselves from its strangle-hold, but this is the path we are on and this is how the financial system has been designed to keep people trapped in its web of control. But the future belongs to the people - not to the corporations that have enslaved us for the past several centuries under the false banner of freedom and democracy using money as their weapon. So if you can, go to our website and make a small monthly contribution by choosing one of the options you can afford. Join the UBUNTU movement online and then tell everyone.  www.ubuntuparty.org.za
story_txt:
South African Elections - 7 May 2014The South African Elections take place every 5 years - we have to use this opportunity to represent the conscious people of our country an provide inspiration for other countries to follow. We have reduced the required funding to succeed in our mission to $40,000 or R400,000 because we will only contest the national ballot - NOT the 9 different provinces. We are almost there - please continue to support this critical funding initiative for the people of South Africa. Thanks to this crowd funding site for the UBUNTU Party, we have managed to raise the necessary deposit of $20,000 / R200,000 to participate in the South African Elections on 7 May 2014. We borrowed this money and the cheque was delivered on the 12th March to
 the IEC and will secure the UBUNTU Party place on the Ballot for the 
National Assembly - we are aiming for 4 seats in Parliament - with your 
help this is very achievable. But we will need continued support to pay for the media and advertising campaign that will inform the people of our presence. So we need to raise a total of $40,000 by the 24th March 2014. Please share this initiative with everyone who is passionate about human rights and human sovereignty. The UBUNTU Party represents these rights and so much more for the people who believe that we are evolving towards higher consciousness as a species.OUR ACTIONS OF THE PAST
Michael Tellinger and The UBUNTU Party has been active in the Supreme Court of Johannesburg since 2011. His actions have exposed the criminal activities of the banksters in South Africa and shown the people how the private banks, together with the SOUTH AFRICAN RESERVE BANK, control our government and dictate the economic policy to the people, enslaving every single one of us with their private money. The barrier to entry in these elections is a clear indication how the bankers and the government use money to manipulate, what should be free elections in South Africa. Together with Scott Cundill from the New Economic Rights Alliance, and others who have taken on the banks, our collective actions have resulted in a dramatic drop in legal actions against the people by the banks - and at least one critical adaptation to the High Court Rules, that will benefit the people.Our full philosophy is outlined in detail in the UBUNTU Contributionism 
book. Please find it on our website - www.ubuntuparty.org.za The book is the main source of funding for the UBUNTU movement and party. I will outline our manifesto in brief below. THE UBUNTU MANIFESTO -  A Blueprint For Human Prosperity 
The UBUNTU movement is a movement of unity and higher consciousness, allowing people to move from divided communities driven by competition, greed and money, to communities that live in united harmony of cooperation - creating abundance for all on every level of human endeavour - without the ultimate need of money - but rather the simple principles of Contributionism - where everyone uses their god-given talents or acquired skills to benefit everyone in their community. The UBUNTU philosophy allows people to move from communities driven by money, greed and corporate control, to communities driven by people, their talents and passion for life.We, the people, have appointed
the politicians as our servants to do the best they can for us - the people. The politicians and the
government have failed us dramatically on every level. They have betrayed the
dream of Nelson Mandela and many other people of integrity who dedicated their
lives to our freedom. Today, we face a greater threat than any other threat we
have faced before. The threat of absolute enslavement by those who control the
global economy and the financial systems. We recognise that money has been introduced to the human race by a small powerful group of banking families as a tool of absolute enslavement. These powerful banking families control every crack and crevice of human activity. They have taken control of our water supply, food supply, energy, health, education and even spiritual evolution. This cannot continue. Ubuntu is 
passionate about freeing up the scientific community to invent and 
create, delivering alternative free energy to the people, restructuring 
the entire education system to suit the people and not corporations, 
turning hospitals into true places of healing, ensuring that the farmers
 are in control of food production instead of GMO giants like Monsanto, 
and decentralizing government so that the people can govern themselves 
in
their own communities.
Our Inalienable Rights
– The Rights of All People
1. 
The
country belongs to its people - The land
belongs to the people
2. 
The
water, the rivers and lakes belong to the people
3. 
The
beaches and the oceans around us belong to the people
4. 
The
forests, the mountains, the skies above and the airwaves belong to the people
5. 
All
the minerals in the ground belong to the people - gold, the platinum, chrome,
copper, iron, tin, aluminium, diamonds, coal and all others 

These do not belong to the government or private corporations that have laid claim to it.We plan to initiate a rapid transformation programme which will replace the privately owned SOUTH AFRICAN RESERVE BANK with a People's Bank - that creates tax-free and interest-free money for the people by the people allowing progress without restriction - for every human activity imaginable - in food, science, inventions, community, education, arts and culture, health, and more. This is a critical immediate but interim measure to allow people to realise that money was created as a tool of enslavement by the banking families to control humanity. As we use our own money to create abundance on every level of human activity, we will soon realise that we do not need money at all - and that people can live utopian lives on our beautiful planet of abundance. Because money does nothing - people do everything. People plant the seeds, grow the food, create the technology and solve mathematical equations - people show deep emotion are capable unbridled compassion and people hold the capacity for infinite LOVE. Money only gets in the way of human aspirations. Please read UBUNTU Contributionism - A Blueprint For Human Prosperity - for more.What We Need & What You GetWe need to raise US$100,000 for the following reasons.1) $65,000 to be allowed entry to the elections and appear on the ballot of the national assembly and also the ballot of all nine provinces.2) We need to raise an additional $35,000 or more, for spreading our message in the media who only promote the agenda of the ruling party. We do believe that with our growing awareness and support in SA and around the world we can make a great contribution to the liberation of the people of South Africa from their economic slavery. Other Ways You Can HelpOur aim is to have 1000 monthly supporters/contributors of $10 each - to stabilize our activity and allow UBUNTU to grow without constant concerns. With that kind of support we can virtually move mountains. It is ironic that we need money to free ourselves from its strangle-hold, but this is the path we are on and this is how the financial system has been designed to keep people trapped in its web of control. But the future belongs to the people - not to the corporations that have enslaved us for the past several centuries under the false banner of freedom and democracy using money as their weapon. So if you can, go to our website and make a small monthly contribution by choosing one of the options you can afford. Join the UBUNTU movement online and then tell everyone.  www.ubuntuparty.org.za

story:
to cure: (v) The art and craft of preserving food

What is the to cure: Project About?

to cure: is the beginning of an extensive multimedia project documenting the state of artisanal and craft food production in the United States.  It's a place for telling and sharing stories, for preserving knowledge.  There are people out there, more each day, hand-crafting the things we eat.  Each of these artisans incorporate ingredients and techniques which our conventional food system so frequently overlooks:  Time, Passion, Integrity.  For these craftsmen, these curators of food culture, making is about more than making money.  It’s about doing the right thing, in the right way.

Once, long ago, we would spend our evenings sitting around the fire, eating together, and sharing stories.  Rather than epic sagas filled with heroes and villains, victory and defeat, love and tragedy, we suspect that, more often than not, these were tales of life’s little labors.  How raw materials were discovered, gathered, and through the magic of human handiwork, transmutated and given new meaning, perfect on all its sides.  There is healing in touch.  There is strength and warmth and life present in things hand-made.  This is an epic all its own. And it deserves being told.

So what of to cure:? What might be our mythos of creation? Like many good ideas, it was born one evening over a beer. Brad had dreams of Italy and returning to work on organic farms. Chris of northern France and research on the breweries to be found there. But we also yearned for America! Why seek elsewhere what is budding in our own backyard? So we decided that we’d set off on a journey. That we’d spend the summer travelling our country like the roots of grass, low to the ground, entrenched in the local soil. And like the grass grows, to cure: seemed to take on a life of its own.

While distinctly different individuals, we share one common passion: People and the things that nourish them. No doubt, we interpret nourish quite broadly; it is to not only to feed but also to fuel, to provide the life, the warmth, and the energy that keeps us going. We found in craft production the perfect combination of these: better food because it was made by living, breathing people who lived and breathed for it, and better people because they were engaged with their hands and with their minds in the making of the things they loved. As craft foods sustain those who make it and those who consume it, so too does it nourish us.

As students and educators of the American artisanal food renaissance, we are turning to you for help in spotlighting the behind-the-scenes producers and inspirational stories which continue to spur this movement ever forward.

What We Need & What You Get

From May 2013 until September 1, 2013, we will be traveling the country, working with a myriad of brewers, cheesemakers, farmers, winemakers, salumists, and more - 15,000 miles and over 100 days of showcasing the passion and integrity inherent in small-scale craft production.

This campaign will allow us to complete principal data collection in the forms of photography, video, interviews, memoirs, and hands-on participation in various methods of artisanal food production. Your support will primarily help with production costs and the inevitable cost of extended transportation.

We invite you to be a founding member of our production team and to help this project "gogo" at a vital time in its genesis. You’ll be on the inside of The Anthology, a collection of compelling stories which will undoubtedly speak to our very roots as American consumers and entrepreneurs. And of course, we’ll keep you posted on our progress all along the way. We're so excited to launch this campaign, and to share our passion with others. No matter what your level of backing, we're hugely grateful, and so pleased to have you on board. Most of all, we look forward to introducing you to the inspiring cast of producer-characters who will take center stage in our project.

What Is indiegogo?

Artisanal production has long been funded by patrons, individuals with various visions who support artistic and craft production.  Indiegogo combines the modern trend of eCommerce with classical patronage, allowing backers to contribute funding in exchange for a variety of rewards.  Rewards may be as simple as recipes or postcards, but frequently include finished products, producer credit, or, in the case of to cure:, educational classes and artisanal swag.  Of course, our unending gratitude will accompany any contribution.

The campaign for "to cure: A Food Anthology" ends on June 7, 2013, so it's important to respond soon.  And please, send a link to anyone else who might be interested.  Thanks!

After I Pledge, When Will I Receive My Perk?

Many of the Perk Levels to cure: offers include items or events which will be ready at various times.  The Indiegogo perk structure only allows us to submit one date for the estimated delivery of perks.

Posters, Recipes, and Swag (Artisanal Gifts from Producers) will be sent or delivered as they are received. This means we could be mailing you a t-shirt and glassware in early June, or some artisanal jams and honey in August.

If you donate to receive a Beer and Cheese Tasting class, we'll contact you with details regarding when we will be in your area.  From there, we'll work with you to pick the best date for everyone involved.

Finally, while the to cure: team wishes that the eJournals will be ready as soon as possible, in reality it takes time to do these projects the justice they deserve.  With our documentary endeavors wrapping up in late August, we expect that the first volume of The Anthology will be ready around November.  From there, we expect that volumes will be released every couple months until the set is complete.

Can I Help to cure: In Some Other Way?

Of course!  

  • You can spread the word and point other people to this page.  
  • You can also Follow Us on Twitter, or Like Us on Facebook.
  • Don't forget to check out our website, www.tocurefood.com!
  • Have a suggestion for an inspiring artisanal food story?  Email us at chris@tocurefood.com or brad@tocurefood.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

story:
¿Qué?

Lejos no es un lugar nos muestra un crisol de personajes, un cadáver exquisito compuesto por diferentes tramas que se enlazan en una deliciosa madeja.

Laura, que había perdido a su hija dos meses antes por culpa de una enfermedad degenerativa, aparece muerta en un poblado a las afueras de una pequeña ciudad de provincias. Cinco años más tarde, Sara es testigo del atropello de un hombre mientras fotografiaba rincones de esa misma ciudad para Salvador, su marido enfermo de akinetopsia. En otro rincón distante Cuca, la esposa del hombre atropellado, soportará su drama de tener que cuidar de él después de haber dejado de amarle muchos años antes.

Los tres sucesos irán confluyendo por culpa del dolor y el remordimiento de sus protagonistas, encerrados en una ciudad cualquiera de este mundo global en el que las desgracias, sin embargo, parecen ocurrir siempre demasiado lejos.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Diego Bris.

Nacido en Guadalajara hace cuarenta y seis años en el seno de una familia numerosa donde los libros ocuparon mucho tiempo y espacio, allí sigue viviendo. Está casado desde hace dieciséis años y tiene dos hijos de seis y nueve años de edad. Los datos suelen ser fríos pero estos pocos aglutinan los mayores tesoros de su vida.

Actualmente, trabaja como ingeniero de caminos, canales y puertos en una multinacional francesa y compagina su actividad profesional con su pasión por la literatura. Los números y las letras parecen ámbitos opuestos en el mundo actual y, sin embargo, Diego Bris los entiende como maneras distintas de construir: pequeños edificios o grandes universos. Así fue de pequeño y así lo sigue siendo ahora.

Lejos no es un lugar es su cuarta novela después de Metropolitano (finalista I Premio Hispania de novela histórica), Solo los hombres entierran (finalista XX Premio Fernando Lara 2015) y La vaca.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«El día que todo cambió sucedió una semana después. Sara apareció en casa a deshoras, cuando él salía de la ducha y ella tendría que estar en alguna rueda de prensa. Salvador lo sabía porque solía dejar preparada la ropa la noche anterior y la que él había visto antes de acostarse era la propia para esos eventos, ropa incómoda de postín. Sara entró apresuradamente y no reparó en que él iba desnudo bajo su batín; le decepcionó que ella no se fijara en ese detalle porque solía atraparlo y hurgarle por debajo de la ropa para excitarlo. Recordaba que ella le anunció un nuevo trabajo y que a él esa noticia no le alegró especialmente porque suponía una pérdida de equilibrio en sus vidas y es que apreciaba mucho más una pobreza estable que la incertidumbre de una riqueza efímera. Sara le restó importancia al cambio alegando que seguiría cerca de su jefe don Ramiro y que, por desgracia, eso contrarrestaba cualquier otra mejora. La vio cruzar el pasillo desvistiéndose con prudencia y no asimiló que Sara ya estaba en la faena de su nuevo puesto y don Ramiro le había encomendado su primer encargo. Se quitó la blusa, la falda y las medias y lo recogió todo sobre su brazo; tanto esmero extrañó a Salvador, acostumbrado al desorden natural de su mujer y lo achacó a los nervios que brotan el primer día de todo comienzo.
          —¿Te vuelves a marchar? —le gritó desde la cocina, sosteniendo su taza de café.
          —Sí —respondió ella también a voces—. He venido a ponerme algo cómodo, nada más.
          —¿No te vale la ropa que llevabas? Pues menudo cambio…
          Salvador escuchó la respuesta como una de esas frases de las que nunca se espera ser testigo o auditorio, tengo cáncer o mamá ha muerto y que provocan las náuseas, el llanto, el dolor. Sara se había esforzado mucho en contentarle después de una semana perdido por la ciudad, devorando rostros y andares que resultaban no ser de Laura, con tanto ahínco y amor que había olvidado el motivo de su decaimiento. Uno ama sin condiciones y acepta ser baluarte de una forma tan natural que no intuye los momentos de zozobra y ella, en aquel instante de aquel maldito día, no recordó que sus palabras estarían recién salidas de la fragua y quemarían la piel de las entrañas. Salvador no pudo sospechar nada y escuchó la sentencia.
          —Han encontrado el cadáver de una mujer en el poblado de Villaflores».

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 920€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Diego Bris vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

Sara se había esforzado mucho en contentarle después de una semana perdido por la ciudad, devorando rostros y andares que resultaban no ser de Laura, con tanto ahínco y amor que había olvidado el motivo de su decaimiento. Uno ama sin condiciones y acepta ser baluarte de una forma tan natural que no intuye los momentos de zozobra y ella, en aquel instante de aquel maldito día, no recordó que sus palabras estarían recién salidas de la fragua y quemarían la piel de las entrañas. Salvador no pudo sospechar nada y escuchó la sentencia.          —Han encontrado el cadáver de una mujer en el poblado de Villaflores».
¿Cómo?
Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 920€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.
Además...
Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Diego Bris vea publicada su obra.
Gracias por vuestro tiempo.
Política de Privacidad

story:
Hi! My name is Stacy C. Bauer. I am a wife, mother, teacher and author. I have always loved writing and have been sharing funny stories about my own children for years. 2 years ago, I took a leave from my career as a teacher and decided to write a book. I ran a successful kickstarter a year ago and was able to publish my first book Cami Kangaroo Has Too Many Sweets, a book based on my daughter Cami and her quest to sneak and eat every treat she could get her hands on. It also tells of the consequences she faced as a result of that. This was the first book in my series about my children, Cami and Wyatt: "Cami Kangaroo and Wyatt Too". 

Last summer, I started working on the second book in the series: "Cami Kangaroo Has Too Much Stuff". I chose this subject, because I figured there were other children out there who have trouble with too much stuff and staying organized, just like my daughter Cami does.

 

Some adorable illustrations from my talented illustrator, Rebecca Sinclair.

We've already been busy promoting the new book!

Cami and I were on the local news a few weeks ago.

I was featured in 3 newspapers last week: 

   It has been my dream to become a published author for a long time. Last year, I realized that dream because of your support. I would love to continue my series with this book and can't wait to see what I can do with this next book! My family and I are so grateful for your interest and support!

What We Need & What You Get

If you choose to support my campaign, your contribution will be used to fund the first run of my book, which includes printing, shipping, illustrations, marketing and editing. 

Rewards for YOU: personalized hardcover books, 2 free eBooks and a PDF Activity book for all backers! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our campaign by using the Indiegogo tools! Help spread the word about bringing this book to life! Thank you SO much!
Stacy Bauer and family

story:
Story of My Book

Beyond the Diploma is a book that dives into the newfound autonomy that college students face after graduating. Through dozens of stories, I’ll share powerful messages and practical advice for leveraging the autonomy into happiness, success, and fulfillment, but on YOUR terms.

My name is Ashane Govind and I am the author of Beyond the Diploma. I wrote this book because I was shocked to learn what I truly cared about, after I graduated. For me, I learned that I missed a lot of things that I took for granted in college and that I cared about more than just my day job.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the degree of autonomy that you have in your life. Ultimately, I hope to instill some intellectual curiosity about your own post-grad journey to help you capitalize on the autonomy in your life.

If you recently graduated college and are faced with newfound control over your life, or if you’re just around the corner from that, I know you will benefit from hearing these stories.

Beyond the Diploma is a nonfiction book that speaks to recent grads and prospective grads who want to look at their future and their values in a new way.

 

The Book

The book is based on the stories of others. I’ve interviewed 50+ college graduates and college students about their goals, values, and definitions of fulfillment. Each story you read will provide a different color of what the post-grad journey means. You'll learn about different kinds of autonomy in the post-graduation environment, and you'll hear dozens of stories from real-life individuals. Here's a taste:

  • Abrahan: A world-class mind from an undocumented family, spent his post-grad years proving to his family, his community, and most importantly, himself, that he has what it takes to compete with the best and the brightest.
  • Melanie: A future doctor who spent her years of college trying to identify the best way she can save lives, and how she found her calling in optometry.
  • Joonyoung: Through introspection and reflection in her college years - found that the camaraderie she felt with her swim teammates, college peers, and childhood friendships is what helps her unlock fulfillment and happiness at work.
  • Keith: Through his college and post-grad adventure, Keith learned that no decision is truly final. Today, he's prioritizing his work week-by-week to keep doing things he's actually excited about.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, eBook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and eBook.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And more!

 

About the Author

Ashane Govind is a Senior Financial Analyst at Capital Group. He graduated from New York University in 2019 and is completing his Masters in Business Analytics from University of Southern California. He loves to learn and always tries to find ways to think a little deeper.

Ashane loves to talk about interests, passions, and aspirations. He has only one goal for the impact of this book: to help readers think a little more carefully about their values, and layer them into their decision-making.

In his spare time, Ashane plays the saxophone, exercises, and hangs out with his quarantine puppy, Mac. Some say Ashane is a young, bright mind who loves to smile. Those who know Ashane closely, though, will tell you about his obsession with skincare, his weekly boba craving, and his funky sneaker collection.

For more information, you can connect with Ashane on LinkedIn or on Instagram @ashanegovind.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I’ve mitigated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I'll be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #BeyondTheDiploma and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

With love,
Ashane

story:
(English below)

VÊTEMENTS CHAUDS POUR LES RÉFUGIÉS SYRIENS À ARSAL, BEKAA, LIBAN

Nous sommes un groupe de Libanais indépendants concernés par la situation inquiétante des réfugiés syriens au Liban. Alors qu’il y a plus d’un million de réfugiés syriens sur les territoires libanais, tous les réfugiés ne reçoivent pas l’aide fournie par UNHCR et les organisations non gouvernementales, surtout pas ceux qui vivent loin des grandes villes ou près de la frontière avec la Syrie. Nous avons décidé de lancer une campagne de levée de fonds afin d’acheter des vêtements chauds pour quelques milliers de réfugiés syriens qui vivent dans des tentes dans ce rude hiver. Les vêtements seront spécifiquement distribués aux réfugiés syriens du village d’Arsal, un village libanais situé au nord du Bekaa, dans la province de Baalback. On a choisi ce village car il est complètement isolé et peu d’aide y arrive. Les organisations non gouvernementales locales et internationales trouvent que cette région est loin des villes principales et est non sécuritaire en raison enraison des affrontements près de la frontière. Les routes amenant à Arsal ne sont pas développées et seules les voitures 4x4 puissent y arriver. Le village d’Arsal compte environ 30,000 habitants libanais et accueille présentement plus de 60,000 réfugiés syriens, la plupart d’entre eux vivant dans des tentes fournies par UNHCR. Ce camp réfugié est comme un cadeau empoisonné pour eux étant donné qu’on y manque la majorité des besoins élémentaires de survie.

BREF APERÇU

L'hiver de cette année est un des hivers les plus froids du siècle dernier. Les réfugiés syriens souffrent désespérément du froid. Beaucoup parmi eux arrivent au Liban sans argent ou pièce d’identité ce qui les fait souffrir de la faim et du froid. Ceux qui n’ont pas de pièces d’identité sur eux ne sont pas éligibles de l’aide fournie par l’UNHCR. Beaucoup parmi eux se sentent humiliés de demander de la nourriture ou des vêtements et préfèrent de souffrir seuls dans leurs tentes. Jusqu’à présent, à chaque jour plus de 30 familles rejoignent ce camp de réfugiés s’enfuyant de la Syrie et échappant à la mort sans savoir qu’un autre type de mort les attend à l’autre côté de la frontière.

Psychologiquement émus par la guerre, émotionnellement détruits par la perte de leurs maisons et des membres de leurs familles, torturés par le froid et les conditions de vie difficiles, beaucoup d’entre eux pensent retourner en Syrie et préfèrent mourir en dignité dans leur terre natale au lieu de vivre dans des conditions inhumaines.

On est un groupe de militants et militantes libanais; quelques-uns parmi nous travaillent dans le village d’Arsal et dans les autres camps réfugiés de la Bekaa et témoignent sur une base quotidienne les conditions des réfugiés syriens au Liban. Nous sommes concernés par la nonchalance nationale et internationale envers la crise syrienne. On pense que l’effort de militants à tous les niveaux allant de l’éducation jusqu’à la solidarité en termes de matériel est vraiment nécessaire.

OBJECTIF

Notre objectif est d’agir dans notre capacité en collectant des fonds afin de montrer notre solidarité, autant que possible, avec ceux qui ont été forcés de quitter leurs maisons en Syrie. En se basant sur des observations proches, nous avons remarqué que le besoin principal pour ces quelques mois est les vêtements chauds spécifiquement pour les enfants et les personnes âgées qui sont en train de mourir du froid. Notre objectif est de distribuer environ 500 articles d’habillement (chandails, chaussettes, gants, tuques, etc.) et des couvertures qui sont vendus sur le marché local libanais. Les prix moyens de ces articles, s’ils sont achetés dans les friperies ou dans les magasins locaux, varient entre 3$ et 10$. Notre objectif est de réchauffer autant qu’on peut les réfugiés syriens d’Arsal. On compte sur vous afin de donner à ce petit geste un sens significatif et chaud. Votre don, aussi petit qu’il peut être, est vraiment apprécié. Nous espérons que vous allez prendre en considération cette campagne et de faire une contribution qui va appuyer le peuple syrien pendant cet hiver.

Vous pouvez trouver ci-dessous quelques articles tirés des journaux locaux et
internationaux sur la situation des camps de réfugiés syriens au nord du Bekaa
au Liban qui peuvent vous aider à comprendre mieux la situation. On vous promet
de vous envoyer des photos après la distribution des articles.

Merci de partager cette campagne avec ceux que vous pensez sont intéressés par aider et en considérant un petit don.

Pour plus d'informations contactez nous: help.arsal@gmail.com

ARTICLES

http://dailystar.com.lb/News/Lebanon-News/2013/Dec-12/240756-a-cold-night-with-refugees-in-the-bekaa-valley.ashx#axzz2pq2Gvxuu

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

(English version)

WARM CLOTHES FOR THE SYRIAN REFUGEES IN ARSAL, BEKAA, LEBANON

We are a group of independent Lebanese people that are concerned by the alarming situation of the Syrian refugees in Lebanon. As there are over one million Syrian refugees on the Lebanese territories, help provided by UNHCR and Non Profit Organizations is not reaching everyone, especially those who live far from the big cities and by the Syrian borders. We decided to launch a campaign to collect some money in order to buy some warm clothes for the thousands of Syrian refugees that are living in tents in this harsh winter. The clothes will be specifically distributed to the Syrian refugees in the village of Arsal, a Lebanese village situated by the Syrian borders in the North of Bekaa, in the province of Baalback in Lebanon. We chose this village as it is isolated and little help is getting there. Local and international Non Profit Organizations find this region very far from the main cities and unsecure because of of the fighting near the borders.  The roads leading to this village are not developed and only 4x4 cars can get there. The village of Arsal has 30,000 Lebanese inhabitants and is hosting over 60,000 Syrian refugees most of them living in tents provided by the UNHCR. This refugee camp is like a poisoned gift for them as it lacks most of the basic survival needs.

BRIEF OVERVIEW

The winter this year is one the coldest winters in the last century. Syrian refugees are suffering desperately from the cold. Many among them arrived to Lebanon without any money or any ID which makes them suffer from hunger and cold. Those who don’t have any ID on them are not eligible to the aid given by UNHCR. Many among them feel humiliated to ask for food and clothes and prefer to suffer alone in their tents. Until now, every day at least 30 more families join this camp fleeing away from Syria and escaping death without knowing that another kind of death is waiting for them at the other side of the borders.

Psychologically chocked by the war, emotionally destroyed by the loss of their houses or members of their family, tortured by the cold and hard living conditions, many of them are thinking of going back to Syria and preferring to die in dignity in their homeland instead of living under these unhuman conditions.

We are a group of young Lebanese activists in which some of us are working in Arsal village and the camps in the bekaa, who are witnessing the bad living conditions of Syrian refugees in Lebanon on a daily basis and are concerned by the local and international indolence towards the Syrian crisis. We feel that this effort of grassroots
activists on all levels from education to actual material solidarity is necessary.

GOAL

Our aim is to act within our capacities by fundraising to show solidarity as much as we can with those who have been forced to flee from their homes in Syria. Based on some closed observations, we noticed that the main need during the couple of months is warm clothes especially for kids and elderly who are dying from cold. We are aiming on distributing around 500 warm clothing items (sweaters, socks, gloves, hats, etc.) and blankets that sold on the local Lebanese market. The average prices for these items if they are bought from local second stores or from local stores are between 3$  to 10$. Our aim is to make as warm as we can the Syrian refugees in Arsal. We really count on you on making this small gesture a meaningful and warm one. Your donation as small as it can be would really be appreciated. We hope that you will check out our fundraising campaign and consider making a contribution to support the Syrian refugees this winter.

You can find below some articles from the local and international news about the situation of Syrian refugees in the region of Northern Bekaa in Lebanon that can help you understand better the situation. We promise to send you some photos from the camp with the items distributed.

Thank you for sharing this campaign with those who might be able to help and for considering a small donation.

For further information contact us at : help.arsal@gmail.com

Psychologiquement émus par la guerre, émotionnellement détruits par la perte de leurs maisons et des membres de leurs familles, torturés par le froid et les conditions de vie difficiles, beaucoup d’entre eux pensent retourner en Syrie et préfèrent mourir en dignité dans leur terre natale au lieu de vivre dans des conditions inhumaines. On est un groupe de militants et militantes libanais; quelques-uns parmi nous travaillent dans le village d’Arsal et dans les autres camps réfugiés de la Bekaa et témoignent sur une base quotidienne les conditions des réfugiés syriens au Liban. Nous sommes concernés par la nonchalance nationale et internationale envers la crise syrienne. On pense que l’effort de militants à tous les niveaux allant de l’éducation jusqu’à la solidarité en termes de matériel est vraiment nécessaire. OBJECTIFNotre objectif est d’agir dans notre capacité en collectant des fonds afin de montrer notre solidarité, autant que possible, avec ceux qui ont été forcés de quitter leurs maisons en Syrie. En se basant sur des observations proches, nous avons remarqué que le besoin principal pour ces quelques mois est les vêtements chauds spécifiquement pour les enfants et les personnes âgées qui sont en train de mourir du froid. Notre objectif est de distribuer environ 500 articles d’habillement (chandails, chaussettes, gants, tuques, etc.) et des couvertures qui sont vendus sur le marché local libanais. Les prix moyens de ces articles, s’ils sont achetés dans les friperies ou dans les magasins locaux, varient entre 3$ et 10$. Notre objectif est de réchauffer autant qu’on peut les réfugiés syriens d’Arsal. On compte sur vous afin de donner à ce petit geste un sens significatif et chaud. Votre don, aussi petit qu’il peut être, est vraiment apprécié. Nous espérons que vous allez prendre en considération cette campagne et de faire une contribution qui va appuyer le peuple syrien pendant cet hiver. Vous pouvez trouver ci-dessous quelques articles tirés des journaux locaux etinternationaux sur la situation des camps de réfugiés syriens au nord du Bekaaau Liban qui peuvent vous aider à comprendre mieux la situation. On vous prometde vous envoyer des photos après la distribution des articles. Merci de partager cette campagne avec ceux que vous pensez sont intéressés par aider et en considérant un petit don.Pour plus d'informations contactez nous: help.arsal@gmail.comARTICLEShttp://www.lorientlejour.com/article/843866/a-ersal-le-calvaire-sans-fin-des-refugies-syriens.htmlhttp://www.citizenside.com/fr/photos/faits-divers/2013-12-11/87724/liban-la-neige-recouvre-le-camp-de-refugies-syriens-et-le-village-d-arsal.html#f=0/837335http://dailystar.com.lb/News/Lebanon-News/2013/Dec-12/240756-a-cold-night-with-refugees-in-the-bekaa-valley.ashx#axzz2pq2Gvxuuhttp://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2523132/Syrian-refugees-dying-cold-camps-refused-official-recognition.html-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------(English version)WARM CLOTHES FOR THE SYRIAN REFUGEES IN ARSAL, BEKAA, LEBANONWe are a group of independent Lebanese people that are concerned by the alarming situation of the Syrian refugees in Lebanon. As there are over one million Syrian refugees on the Lebanese territories, help provided by UNHCR and Non Profit Organizations is not reaching everyone, especially those who live far from the big cities and by the Syrian borders. We decided to launch a campaign to collect some money in order to buy some warm clothes for the thousands of Syrian refugees that are living in tents in this harsh winter. The clothes will be specifically distributed to the Syrian refugees in the village of Arsal, a Lebanese village situated by the Syrian borders in the North of Bekaa, in the province of Baalback in Lebanon. We chose this village as it is isolated and little help is getting there. Local and international Non Profit Organizations find this region very far from the main cities and unsecure because of of the fighting near the borders.  The roads leading to this village are not developed and only 4x4 cars can get there. The village of Arsal has 30,000 Lebanese inhabitants and is hosting over 60,000 Syrian refugees most of them living in tents provided by the UNHCR. This refugee camp is like a poisoned gift for them as it lacks most of the basic survival needs. BRIEF OVERVIEWThe winter this year is one the coldest winters in the last century. Syrian refugees are suffering desperately from the cold. Many among them arrived to Lebanon without any money or any ID which makes them suffer from hunger and cold. Those who don’t have any ID on them are not eligible to the aid given by UNHCR. Many among them feel humiliated to ask for food and clothes and prefer to suffer alone in their tents. Until now, every day at least 30 more families join this camp fleeing away from Syria and escaping death without knowing that another kind of death is waiting for them at the other side of the borders.Psychologically chocked by the war, emotionally destroyed by the loss of their houses or members of their family, tortured by the cold and hard living conditions, many of them are thinking of going back to Syria and preferring to die in dignity in their homeland instead of living under these unhuman conditions.We are a group of young Lebanese activists in which some of us are working in Arsal village and the camps in the bekaa, who are witnessing the bad living conditions of Syrian refugees in Lebanon on a daily basis and are concerned by the local and international indolence towards the Syrian crisis. We feel that this effort of grassrootsactivists on all levels from education to actual material solidarity is necessary. GOALOur aim is to act within our capacities by fundraising to show solidarity as much as we can with those who have been forced to flee from their homes in Syria. Based on some closed observations, we noticed that the main need during the couple of months is warm clothes especially for kids and elderly who are dying from cold. We are aiming on distributing around 500 warm clothing items (sweaters, socks, gloves, hats, etc.) and blankets that sold on the local Lebanese market. The average prices for these items if they are bought from local second stores or from local stores are between 3$  to 10$. Our aim is to make as warm as we can the Syrian refugees in Arsal. We really count on you on making this small gesture a meaningful and warm one. Your donation as small as it can be would really be appreciated. We hope that you will check out our fundraising campaign and consider making a contribution to support the Syrian refugees this winter.You can find below some articles from the local and international news about the situation of Syrian refugees in the region of Northern Bekaa in Lebanon that can help you understand better the situation. We promise to send you some photos from the camp with the items distributed. Thank you for sharing this campaign with those who might be able to help and for considering a small donation.For further information contact us at : help.arsal@gmail.comARTICLEShttp://dailystar.com.lb/News/Lebanon-News/2013/Dec-12/240756-a-cold-night-with-refugees-in-the-bekaa-valley.ashx#axzz2pq2Gvxuuhttp://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2523132/Syrian-refugees-dying-cold-camps-refused-official-recognition.htmlhttp://www.citizenside.com/fr/photos/faits-divers/2013-12-11/87724/liban-la-neige-recouvre-le-camp-de-refugies-syriens-et-le-village-d-arsal.html#f=0/837335http://www.lorientlejour.com/article/843866/a-ersal-le-calvaire-sans-fin-des-refugies-syriens.html

story:
My name is Allison Leonard and Kiss 5 Tigers is a project I've been working on for about a year now.

My Story

I had been working a corporate banking job for about 3 years.  (No, my hair was not purple while I had that job!)  The job was changing to become more and more a call center environment, which did not make me happy.  I applied to other jobs both within and outside the company, but I was not called for interviews.  Having so little luck with changing jobs, I decided that maybe I needed to radically revision how I earn money.

I started looking at my friends, both in real life and online, to see what success they were having and how they achieved it.  Success is a variable thing, that is, one person may consider herself perfectly successful by being self-supporting, another may have a business she wants to start, a third may be happy to trade off money for time with her family.  For me, a job that I didn't dread and that allowed me to pursue my real life interests seemed ideal.  That seemed to mean an online job or at least a job that used the internet as my major delivery method.  I began looking at ways to use my computer to generate income.  

In March, my teenage daughter came to live with me.  She has had a difficult life and she felt that she was struggling in her dad's house so she wanted to try living with me again.  It was hard getting her settled in.  She is currently being treated for PTSD and ADHD, and she is back in high school as a junior where she's a solid A - B student. She wants to go to college to study child psychology and help other children having difficulties.  

Although my daughter is doing great now, when she first moved in, she caused some chaos which impacted my work.  My supervisor was aware of my unhappiness with my job and wanted me off the team because she felt my dissatisfaction was having a negative impact on other team members.  In May, she let me go.  I applied for and received unemployment, which allowed us to cover daily living expenses.  My daughter's father did not and still does not pay child support.

Looking for work involves a fair amount of networking.  I realized that many of my friends were also unemployed or underemployed.  As a group, we are stressed and scared, neither of which is a good way to live.  I wanted to help myself, but I also want to help my friends do better.  I thought, if I can figure out how to support myself, I can show other people how to do that, or maybe I can even create jobs within my community.  

In December, my unemployment award ran out.  Dates are fairly important here.  My last date that was payable was 12/14.  My last day to request payment was 12/22.  I called the unemployment office to find out what they needed for the extension, and I was informed that the last day for extensions was 12/28.  When I was unemployed in the past, as long as I qualified for the extension before the end date, I got paid.  I explained this to the unemployment lady.  She informed me that per the federal government, even if I qualified for the extension, she was unable to disperse any funds after 12/28.  

I have applied for welfare.  For the first time in 3 months, I have heard from a company that is interested in interviewing me.  I have completed the training to be an ESL teacher.  And, I don't want to rely on one source of income any longer.  Which brings me to my project, Kiss 5 Tigers.

What is Kiss 5 Tigers?

One morning I woke up with the phrase "kiss 5 tigers" blazing in my brain.  I had no idea what that actually meant at the time, so I tried to ignore it but it wouldn't go away.  After much searching of my personal iconography, I realized that the tigers represent things that are attractive but also big, scary and potentially dangerous.  The number 5 indicated different areas of life.  Kissing these tigers, then, means to draw close and be fairly intimate with big scary issues in several areas of my life.

Kiss5Tigers on Wordpress.com is the blog I began in response to this internal imperative.

My original plan was to share my successes and inspirations, and that's still on the table!  I am not unusual, so I figured if I could build a better life and achieve a certain amount of success, then my path might be helpful to other people.

However, as I have become downwardly mobile, a second function has emerged.  I want a platform to share my truth and my story.  Again, I am not unusual: if I am having these struggles, so are other people.  If I struggle with transportation or paying rent or feeding my child, so do other people.  It's a fundamental principle of women's experience, that speaking our truths publicly is revolutionary.  

I'm not seeking a revolution in society, only in my life!  I am ready for the wheel to turn and to begin the upward climb, and I believe it's important to share that story with people.  Not because my story is outstanding or because I am noteworthy, but because it is common and I am typical, and therefore my story - like other average people's stories - is invisible.  

Henry David Thoreau has famously said, "'Most men lead lives of quiet desperation and go to the grave with the song still in them."  I want to do better than that, and I want you to do better too!  Kiss5Tigers the blog is my way of singing my song.

When I started this project, I was employed and the fee to register my domain name seemed negligible.  Today, with so little money left in the bank, unemployment run out, and a welfare application in process, I simply cannot justify spending even this small amount on something that is not a necessity.

Therefore I stand before you, hat in hand, asking for assistance keeping this token of my dream alive.  

Nitty Gritty

In truth, it would cost me under $20.00 to keep this domain name.  Indiegogo requires that I request $500.00 and as an unemployed single mom, I assure you, extra money would not be wasted!  Keeping my cell phone turned on and my internet functional are also necessary for job hunting.  I don't have a car, but bus fare is $5.00 any time I need to go to the doctor, the unemployment office, a food pantry or an interview.

Just a few donations of a couple of dollars would resolve my domain registration cost.  And of course, if you choose not to assist, please spread the word!

story:
What is Blood and Wine?

     Blood and Wine follows the exploits of Senior  Detective James "Pub" Riley of the Unusual Crimes Division. James is confident, intelligent, smug, handsome...and an addict, regularly succumbing to alcohol, drugs and sex. He also happens to be a vampire, which in a world without humans, is the norm. His trusted friend and driver Ian Worth is a shadow, a genetically inferior vampire, who like others of his kind, are generally looked down upon by the pure vampires and treated like second class citizens. Together, James and Ian have solved many crimes in Port Stoker, but their biggest mystery is just beginning when they rescue Tinka, a shadow with amnesia who is the sole survivor of a brutal massacre. Together they will stumble upon the biggest conspiracy that their world has ever known.

     Blood and Wine is mainly set in Port Stoker, the capital city of Freeland. It is 97 years after a devastating world war and plague have destroyed large sections of the planet, leveling cities, polluting the environment and decimating the population. Predicting this event, and partially causing it, a group of the very oldest and most powerful vampires, the Eternals, prepared elaborate bunkers to save some of the population. Now new cities are being built, order has been restored and life is starting to move on. The Eternals have gone into hiding, protected by the Guardians and the Sothurian Council. Technology, which was partially blamed for the collapse of civilization, is slowly being rebuilt, but it is costly and unreliable. Primitive computers, cell phones and cars are available only to the government and the elite. Electricity is limited, candles and gas lamps light the city, while horses and carriages fill the streets. Prostitution, gambling and some drugs are legal, used to keep the general populace complacent. "Human Fiction" is the latest fad in books and plays. The most popular beverage is wine mixed with animal blood.

     Port Stoker is populated by a wide array of characters, all with their own secrets and hidden agendas, and Detective Pub Riley has more than most. Many of these he even keeps from his best friend and driver, Ian Worth. Ian is a shadow, a second class citizen of the vampire world. His friendship with Pub has taken him into many parts of vampire society that he never would have experienced otherwise. Into their lives comes Tinka, a shadow with a past that she either cannot or will not remember. Her fate is quickly intertwined with those of Pub and Ian as they are thrust into the middle of a mystery bigger than any they have ever known. The town is led by Mayor Jordy Darkwood, a vampire struggling with his conscience as he fights to hold things together as the politics of the old world and the new come crashing together, while his wife Mercy is hiding the fact that she is one of Pub's many mistresses. Lorlet, a local herbalist and psychic, is a confidant of Pub's, and the only female he has not been able to seduce. The underworld of Port Stoker is ruled by The Edge and his ruthless enforcer, Mr. Bates, both of whom know more of the secrets of Freeland than most. Then there are Ivy, Rose and Thorne LePlante, the triplet owners of Satiate, the towns largest brothel and gambling hall, which is a frequent haunt of Pub's. Other important characters include Favour Boulet, art gallery owner and one of Pub's frequent conquests, Wheezy Becket, Pub's landlady and owner of Becket's Books, Professor Myers Eller, expert in human mythology, and Seatta Seaut, an author whose human fiction books, The Sun Dancers,  have become all the rage. And then there is Savean, a female vampire of great mystery, power and beauty, recently returned to town from parts unknown with an agenda that will forever change Port Stoker, Freeland and all who live there.

     Blood and Wine will be the first of six books in a series by the same name. Over the course of the series, many secrets will be revealed, relationships formed and tested, conspiracies will run wild and a shocking revelation will change everything and everyone.

 What Do I Want To Achieve?

      First and foremost, I want to entertain the reader with a world unlike any they have ever seen, with characters both unique and exciting, but at the same time believable and relatable. I want to take the vampire legend and honor its history and traditions while also infusing it with new ideas of what a vampire is. In most vampire stories, humans are in integral part to the story. We seldom see how vampires act among themselves when they are not trying to seduce or devour people. In  Blood and Wine, I have crafted  a unique and well thought out world where humans do not exist. I want to immerse readers into a very detailed landscape, reimagined through the eyes of a vampire. What would a world look like where its inhabitants can never venture into the sun? I spent years creating this world, focusing on the smallest of details, and believe that I have come up with a place never before seen in literature. I have greatly enjoyed creating this place and these one of a kind characters. I hope you enjoy reading about them and come to love(and hate) them as much as I do.

 Who Am I?

     Good question. The answer has many parts, some that are still being added as I continue to change and learn new things about myself. The important part, at least in this instance, is that I am a story teller, a crafter of lore, who has finally decided to put it all down into a series of novels and try my hand as a writer. I have written many short stories and some a little too long to be called short stories, but this only my second attempt at a novel. The first ended when I realized I didn't really care about the characters or believe in the story. That's what makes this time so different. With Blood and Wine, I have spent years thinking about this story, dissecting every part of it, reworking the ideas, throwing out the ones that didn't work and expanding the ones that did. I have created a world full of characters, some who made the cut and some who didn't and some who turned out to be totally different than who I originally thought they were. I have breathed life into this place and to me it has become real, not in the I'm crazy way, but in the way that I finally believe in what I'm writing, I care about the characters and what happens to them, even the not so nice ones and there are a lot of those.

     My simple bio is that I grew up in the '70s in a small town in North Carolina. I honed my imagination in a time before technology started killing it. I was always a voracious reader, spending many hours in our towns library, always checking out the maximum amount of books. I read everything I could get my hands on, and at some point decided, I want to do that. Of course, as it often does, life got in the way and being a writer was put on the back burner. Now after a lifetime of many different careers, including over 10 years in the book selling business, and countless creative writing classes, it is time to pursue the dream, hopefully with your help.

     I have been living in Las Vegas for the past 10 years and although I don't think I have ever actually met one, if vampires do exist, this is where they would live. This town has reawakened my imagination. I have met many unique individuals, some of whom have at least partially morphed into characters in my book. I have experienced what it's like to live in a place where you can actually do everything in the dark and sleep away the daylight hours. I use all of this to up the realism in the book.

What's The Money For and What Do You Get?

     The money raised will be used for many different things.

   + to finance the completion of book one.

   + to self publish book one in digital and hardcover formats

   + to commission original artwork for the series

   + to market the series to find a major publisher to put the series in wide release

   + promotion of the series

The more money that is raised, will result in higher quality books published in greater quantity. Money left over will go towards book 2 in the series.

     For helping to fund this project, backers will receive many great rewards depending on the amount pledged. Some rewards include digital and hardcover copies, t-shirts, a personal thank you in the acknowledgements section of the book, a chance to name a character in the book, a chance to have me personally come to your house to read the book and much more. Check out the rewards section for more details. Without your support, it may take years to get this project completed if at all. With your contributions, I plan to be finished and meet all reward responsibilities by the end of May next year, if not sooner.

   Risks And Challenges

     There are always risks and unexpected challenges with any project. However, I promise to do my best to meet all deadlines and to produce an enjoyable quality book in the end. I have a strong support system of family and friends to help when and where needed, plus access to contacts from my many years in the book selling business. If any unforeseen obstacles arise or plans change, I will inform all backers immediately. I will also be posting constant updates on the status of the project. Also please feel free to contact me with any questions you may have.

Other Ways You Can Help

 I know that not everyone can contribute financially. I appreciate any amount that you can give. It all adds up.  You can also help by getting the word out about my project to as many people as possible by posting it on your Facebook page or Twitter or posting it on group pages. I can also always use more contacts in the publishing world.

And Lastly

     I would like to thank everyone who has taken the time to read my proposal. I hope you will be able to help out. I believe that Blood and Wine is something special and I hope that you will too once you read it. Thanks again.
